title: 被 (bèi) - Passive voice marker
short_explanation: Used to indicate passive voice in a sentence.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese character '被 (bèi)' is a grammatical particle used to denote the passive voice. Passive voice is when the subject of the sentence is acted upon by the verb. It can be translated as 'by' in English. Please note, it is often used when the action is negative or not to the benefit of the subject.

examples.cn: 我的手机被我弟弟借走了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de shǒujī bèi wǒ dìdì jiè zōu le.
examples.en: My phone has been borrowed by my younger brother.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_被_bèi_-_Passive_voice_marker_20231230_我的手机被我弟弟借走了.mp3

examples.cn: 我的蛋糕被狗吃掉了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de dàngāo bèi gǒu chī diào le.
examples.en: My cake was eaten by the dog.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_被_bèi_-_Passive_voice_marker_20231230_我的蛋糕被狗吃掉了.mp3

examples.cn: 这个故事被大家传得满城风雨。
examples.pinyin: Zhège gùshì bèi dàjiā chuán dé mǎnchéng fēngyǔ.
examples.en: This story was spread by everyone creating a commotion in town.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_被_bèi_-_Passive_voice_marker_20231230_这个故事被大家传得满城风雨.mp3

examples.cn: 我的工作被新来的员工接替了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de gōngzuò bèi xīn lái de yuángōng jiētì le.
examples.en: My job has been taken over by the new employee.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_被_bèi_-_Passive_voice_marker_20231230_我的工作被新来的员工接替了.mp3

title: 除非 (chúfēi) - Unless
short_explanation: Used to express a condition that must be fulfilled.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '除非 (chúfēi)' is used to present a condition that must be satisfied for the event or action in the main clause to occur. It is equivalent to saying 'unless' in English. The sentence usually has two parts, the '除非' clause and the main clause. The action or event in the main clause can only happen if the condition in the '除非' clause is fulfilled.

examples.cn: 除非你努力学习，否则你不会通过HSK考试。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ nǔlì xuéxí, fǒuzé nǐ bù huì tōngguò HSK kǎoshì.
examples.en: Unless you study hard, you won't pass the HSK test.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_20231230_除非你努力学习否则你不会通过HSK考试.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你早点躺下，否则明早你会很累。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ zǎo diǎn tǎngxià, fǒuzé míngzǎo nǐ huì hěn lèi.
examples.en: Unless you go to bed early, you will be very tired tomorrow morning.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_20231230_除非你早点躺下否则明早你会很累.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你告诉我真相，否则我不会相信你的话。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ gàosù wǒ zhēnxiàng, fǒuzé wǒ bù huì xiāngxìn nǐ de huà.
examples.en: Unless you tell me the truth, I won't believe what you say.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_20231230_除非你告诉我真相否则我不会相信你的话.mp3

examples.cn: 除非他道歉，否则我不会再跟他讲话。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi tā dàoqiàn, fǒuzé wǒ bù huì zài gēn tā jiǎnghuà.
examples.en: Unless he apologizes, I won't talk to him again.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_20231230_除非他道歉否则我不会再跟他讲话.mp3

title: 既然 (jìrán) - Since, now that
short_explanation: Used to indicate that given a particular fact or situation, something else follows logically.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '既然 (jìrán)' is a conjunction used to express the idea of 'since' or 'now that' in English. This is generally used to introduce a condition or fact that is already known or obvious, and to imply that something else follows logically from this known condition or fact.
formation: 既然 + known fact/reason, then + logical result

examples.cn: 既然你已经完成了作业，那么你就可以去玩了。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán nǐ yǐjīng wánchéngle zuòyè, nàme nǐ jiù kěyǐ qù wánle.
examples.en: Since you have already finished your homework, then you can go and play.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since_now_that_20231230_既然你已经完成了作业那么你就可以去玩了.mp3

examples.cn: 既然他不想去看电影，我们就换个计划吧。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán tā bùxiǎng qù kàn diànyǐng, wǒmen jiù huàn gè jìhuà ba.
examples.en: Since he doesn't want to go watch a movie, let's change the plan.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since_now_that_20231230_既然他不想去看电影我们就换个计划吧.mp3

examples.cn: 既然明天是假日，我打算睡懒觉。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán míngtiān shì jiàrì, wǒ dǎsuàn shuì lǎnjiào.
examples.en: Since tomorrow is a holiday, I plan to sleep in.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since_now_that_20231230_既然明天是假日我打算睡懒觉.mp3

examples.cn: 既然你不喜欢吃西红柿，我就不做西红柿炒鸡蛋了。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán nǐ bù xǐhuan chī xīhóngshì, wǒ jiù bù zuò xīhóngshì chǎo jīdànle.
examples.en: Since you don't like tomatoes, I won't make tomato scrambled eggs.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since_now_that_20231230_既然你不喜欢吃西红柿我就不做西红柿炒鸡蛋了.mp3

title: 一旦 (yídàn) - Once, in case
short_explanation: Used to express a hypothetical situation or an event that could possibly happen in the future.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '一旦 (yídàn)' is used to explain a hypothetical situation or an event that might occur in the future. It could be likened to the English terms 'once' or 'in case'. It is often used to discuss scenarios that when occur, will trigger a certain response or create a certain situation.

examples.cn: 一旦你法定退休，就可以领取养老金。
examples.pinyin: Yídàn nǐ fǎdìng tuìxiū, jiù kěyǐ lǐngqǔ yǎnglǎojīn.
examples.en: Once you reach the legal retirement age, you can receive a pension.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yídàn_-_Once_in_case_20231230_一旦你法定退休就可以领取养老金.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦他接受了这项工作，就必须全职投入。
examples.pinyin: Yídàn tā jiēshòu le zhè xiàng gōngzuò, jiù bìxū quánzhí tóurù.
examples.en: Once he accepts this job, he will have to devote himself full-time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yídàn_-_Once_in_case_20231230_一旦他接受了这项工作就必须全职投入.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦发现有人违反规定，我们将立即采取行动。
examples.pinyin: Yídàn fāxiàn yǒu rén wéifǎn guīdìng, wǒmen jiāng lìjí cǎiqǔ xíngdòng.
examples.en: Once we discover someone violating the rules, we will take immediate action.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yídàn_-_Once_in_case_20231230_一旦发现有人违反规定我们将立即采取行动.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦火势失控，会造成不可估量的损失。
examples.pinyin: Yídàn huǒshì shīkòng, huì zàochéng bùkěgūliáng de sǔnshī.
examples.en: Once the fire gets out of control, it can cause incalculable damage.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yídàn_-_Once_in_case_20231230_一旦火势失控会造成不可估量的损失.mp3

title: 只要...就... (zhǐyào... jiù...) - As long as...then...
short_explanation: This construction expresses the concept of 'if ___ then ___' or 'as long as ___ then ___'.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, the grammar construction '只要...就...' (zhǐyào... jiù...) is a compound sentence pattern typically employed to show a cause-effect relationship or a prerequisite-condition result. It translates to 'as long as...then...' in English and is used to state the conditions for something to happen. It indicates that once the condition expressed by '只要 (zhǐyào)' is fulfilled, the result expressed by '就 (jiù)' will happen.

examples.cn: 只要你努力学习，就一定会成功。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào nǐ nǔlì xuéxí, jiù yídìng huì chénggōng.
examples.en: As long as you study hard, you will definitely succeed.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyào_jiù_-_As_long_asthen_20231230_只要你努力学习就一定会成功.mp3

examples.cn: 只要我们坚持下去，就没有什么是不可能的。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào wǒmen jiānchí xiàqù, jiù méiyǒu shénme shì bù kěnéng de.
examples.en: As long as we persist, nothing is impossible.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyào_jiù_-_As_long_asthen_20231230_只要我们坚持下去就没有什么是不可能的.mp3

examples.cn: 只要接到电话，我就立刻过来。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào jiē dào diànhuà, wǒ jiù lìkè guòlái.
examples.en: As long as I receive a call, I will come right away.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyào_jiù_-_As_long_asthen_20231230_只要接到电话我就立刻过来.mp3

examples.cn: 只要天气好，我们就去公园玩。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào tiānqì hǎo, wǒmen jiù qù gōngyuán wán.
examples.en: As long as the weather is good, we will go to the park to play.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyào_jiù_-_As_long_asthen_20231230_只要天气好我们就去公园玩.mp3

title: 尽管 (jǐnguǎn) - Even though, despite
short_explanation: Used to indicate contrast between two things or situations.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '尽管 (jǐnguǎn)' is a conjunction used in sentences to bring out a contrast or counter point. It is the equivalent of 'even though' or 'despite' in English, usually followed by a contrasting clause to emphasize the contradiction or unexpected outcome.

examples.cn: 尽管他已经努力了，但是他还是没能赢得比赛。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tā yǐjīng nǔlì le, dànshì tā háishì méinéng yíngdé bǐsài.
examples.en: Even though he tried hard, he still didn't win the game.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐnguǎn_-_Even_though_despite_20231230_尽管他已经努力了但是他还是没能赢得比赛.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管天气很冷，我们还是决定去公园散步。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tiānqì hěn lěng, wǒmen háishì juédìng qù gōngyuán sànbù.
examples.en: Despite the chilly weather, we decided to go for a walk in the park.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐnguǎn_-_Even_though_despite_20231230_尽管天气很冷我们还是决定去公园散步.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管这个问题很难，我还是决定尝试解答。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn zhège wèntí hěn nán, wǒ háishì juédìng chángshì jiědá.
examples.en: Even though this question is difficult, I still decided to attempt to answer.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐnguǎn_-_Even_though_despite_20231230_尽管这个问题很难我还是决定尝试解答.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管他对我很生气，我还是选择原谅他。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tā duì wǒ hěn shēngqì, wǒ háishì xiǎnzé yuánliàng tā.
examples.en: Despite him being very angry at me, I still chose to forgive him.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐnguǎn_-_Even_though_despite_20231230_尽管他对我很生气我还是选择原谅他.mp3

title: 不如 (bùrú) - Not as good as, inferior to
short_explanation: Used to express 'not as good as' or 'inferior to'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '不如 (bùrú)' is often used to express a comparison showing that something is 'not as good as' or 'inferior to' something else. It is an important tool in Mandarin language to express comparison between two entities or actions.

examples.cn: 他的中文水平不如我。
examples.pinyin: Tā de zhōngwén shuǐpíng bùrú wǒ.
examples.en: His Chinese level is not as good as mine.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_他的中文水平不如我.mp3

examples.cn: 这家餐馆的服务态度不如那家。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cānguǎn de fúwù tàidu bùrú nà jiā.
examples.en: The service attitude of this restaurant is not as good as that one.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_这家餐馆的服务态度不如那家.mp3

examples.cn: 做事只看结果，不如注重过程。
examples.pinyin: Zuò shì zhǐ kàn jiéguǒ, bùrú zhùzhòng guòchéng.
examples.en: Only looking at the results of work is not as good as valuing the process.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_做事只看结果不如注重过程.mp3

examples.cn: 被动学习不如主动学习。
examples.pinyin: Bèidòng xuéxí bùrú zhǔdòng xuéxí.
examples.en: Passive learning is inferior to active learning.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_被动学习不如主动学习.mp3

title: 无论...都... (wúlùn... dōu...) - Regardless of...always...
short_explanation: This is used to express the idea that 'no matter what/who/how...' the result or action remains consistent.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '无论...都... (wúlùn... dōu...)' signifies the concept of 'regardless of' or 'no matter what/who/how' in English. It indicates that irrespective of the varying conditions or situations represented by the part of the sentence that follows '无论' (wúlùn), the outcome or reaction that '都' (dōu) leads to remains constant.

examples.cn: 无论你多么的忙碌，都应该保持良好的生活习惯。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn nǐ duōme de mánglù, dōu yīnggāi bǎochí liánghǎo de shēnghuó xíguàn.
examples.en: Regardless of how busy you are, you should always maintain good living habits.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论都_wúlùn_dōu_-_Regardless_ofalways_20231230_无论你多么的忙碌都应该保持良好的生活习惯.mp3

examples.cn: 无论我怎么尝试，他都不想理解我。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn wǒ zěnme chángshì, tā dōu bùxiǎng lǐjiě wǒ.
examples.en: No matter how I try, he always refuses to understand me.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论都_wúlùn_dōu_-_Regardless_ofalways_20231230_无论我怎么尝试他都不想理解我.mp3

examples.cn: 无论天气怎么样，她都会每天跑步。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn tiānqì zěnme yàng, tā dōu huì měitiān pǎobù.
examples.en: Regardless of the weather, she always goes for a run every day.

examples.cn: 无论走到哪里，都不要忘记你来自哪里。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn zǒu dào nǎlǐ, dōu búyào wàngjì nǐ láizì nǎlǐ.
examples.en: Regardless of where you go, always remember where you come from.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论都_wúlùn_dōu_-_Regardless_ofalways_20231230_无论走到哪里都不要忘记你来自哪里.mp3

title: 正在 (zhèngzài) - In the process of
short_explanation: Used with a verb to indicate an ongoing action.
long_explanation: The Chinese phrase '正在 (zhèngzài)' is typically used in conjunction with a verb to denote that the action is currently in progress. It is closely aligned to the English present progressive tense, representing an activity that is happening 'right now' or during an unspecified period surrounding the present moment.
formation: Subject + 正在 + Verb + Rest of sentence

examples.cn: 我正在看一本关于中国历史的书。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhèngzài kàn yīběn guānyú Zhōngguó lìshǐ de shū.
examples.en: I am in the process of reading a book about Chinese history.

examples.cn: 他们正在学习为了明年的高级汉语水平考试。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zhèngzài xuéxí wèile míngnián de gāojí Hànyǔ shuǐpíng kǎoshì.
examples.en: They are in the process of studying for next year's advanced level Chinese test.

examples.cn: 她正在准备晚餐,因为今晚有客人来。

examples.cn: 我们正在讨论如何提高销售收入。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zhèngzài tǎolùn rúhé tígāo xiāoshòu shōurù.

title: 一般 (yìbān) - Generally, usually
short_explanation: Used to express the usual condition or state of affairs.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '一般 (yìbān)' is often used to describe the general or usual state of something or somebody. It translates to 'generally' or 'usually' in English. This word is often used to talk about habits or how things usually are.
formation: Subject + 一般 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我一般早上七点醒来。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yìbān zǎoshang qī diǎn xǐng lái.
examples.en: I usually wake up at seven in the morning.

examples.cn: 我们一般晚上去公园散步。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yìbān wǎnshang qù gōngyuán sànbù.
examples.en: We usually go for a walk in the park in the evening.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一般_yìbān_-_Generally_usually_20231230_我们一般晚上去公园散步.mp3

examples.cn: 这家酒店一般在周末非常忙。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā jiǔdiàn yìbān zài zhōumò fēicháng máng.
examples.en: This hotel is generally very busy on weekends.

title: 直到...才... (zhídào... cái...) - Not until...then...
short_explanation: This pattern is used to indicate that something didn't happen or wasn't realized until a certain moment or condition was met.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese grammar structure '直到...才...' (zhídào... cái...) is used to express a certain event or action that does not take place until a specific time or condition is met. It emphasizes the lateness of the action's realization, akin to the English structure 'not until...then...'.

examples.cn: 我昨天晚上直到12点才回家。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuótiān wǎnshang zhídào 12 diǎn cái huí jiā.
examples.en: I did not get home until 12 o'clock last night.

examples.cn: 他们直到看到成绩单才知道自己的考试成绩。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zhídào kàn dào chéngjìdān cái zhīdào zìjǐ de kǎoshì chéngjì.
examples.en: They didn't know their exam scores until they saw the report card.

title: 宁愿...也不... (nìngyuàn... yě bù...) - Would rather...than...
short_explanation: This structure is used to express a strong preference between two options.
long_explanation: The phrase '宁愿...也不...' in Mandarin Chinese is used to denote one's preference for one option over the other. It directly translates as 'would rather... than...' in English. It is used to indicate that a person, given two options, leans strongly towards one and doesn't want the other.
formation: Subject + 宁愿 + Option 1 + 也不 + Option 2

title: 无法 (wúfǎ) - Unable to, can't
short_explanation: Used to express inability to perform an action or an impossibility.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '无法 (wúfǎ)' is an adjective used to declare an incapability to undertake a certain action, or to denote something is not feasible or possible. It is the equivalent of saying 'unable to' or 'can't' in English. This word is commonly used to express limitations, unfeasibility of a situation or action, or incapability.
formation: Subject + 无法 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我无法理解你为什么喜欢看那部电影，我个人觉得它太无聊了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ wúfǎ lǐjiě nǐ wèishéme xǐhuān kàn nà bù diànyǐng, wǒ gèrén juédé tā tài wúliáo le.

examples.en: He can't accept this decision because he thinks it has a big impact on his future.

short_explanation: Used to emphasize the necessity or inevitability of an event or action.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '非...不可 (fēi...bùkě)' is applied to express strong assertion that something needs to be done or must happen, corresponding to 'must' or 'have to' in English. This set phrase shows a sense of urgency and obligation in certain scenarios.

examples.cn: 你非得按时完成这项工作不可，这对公司来说非常重要。

title: 竟然 (jìngrán) - Unexpectedly, to one's surprise
short_explanation: Used to express surprise or unexpectedness.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '竟然 (jìngrán)' is used to indicate surprise or the unexpectedness of an action, event, or situation. It's similar to saying 'unexpectedly' or 'to one's surprise' in English. It's typically used when the reality of a situation contrasts with one's expectations or assumptions.
formation: Subject + 竟然 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence.

examples.cn: 我竟然在这个小城市遇到了我的老朋友。

title: 除了...还/也... (chúle... hái/yě...) - Apart from...also...
short_explanation: This phrase is used to show in addition to something, there's also something else.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '除了...还/也... (chúle... hái/yě...)' is used to express that in addition to the item or action previously mentioned, there are also other items or actions. This structure is often used to introduce additional information or facts about a topic, person, or situation. The choice between '还' (hái) and '也' (yě) is largely interchangeable and based on personal preference.

examples.cn: 除了会说英语，他还能说流利的日语和法语。
examples.pinyin: Chúle huì shuō yīngyǔ, tā hái néng shuō liúlì de rìyǔ hé fǎyǔ.

title: 一直到 (yìzhídào) - All the way until

It's translated to English as 'all the way until' or 'continuously until'. In the sentence structure, it is usually followed by the condition or the time that ends the previous action or situation.

examples.cn: 我一直到明天早上才能回家。

title: 不是...而是... (bùshì... érshì...) - It's not... but...
short_explanation: Used to correct a misconception or to emphasize the true nature of a situation or thing.

title: 原来 (yuánlái) - Originally, as it turns out
short_explanation: '原来 (yuánlái)' is used to indicate that something that was discovered or realized which was different from what the speaker originally thought.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '原来 (yuánlái)' is used when the speaker discovers or realizes something that was different from their original assumption or thought. It can be translated as 'originally', 'so', or 'as it turns out'. '原来' is usually placed at the beginning of the sentence but can also be placed in the middle to emphasize the discovered information.

title: 照 (zhào) - According to, in accordance with
short_explanation: The word '照 (zhào)' is used in Mandarin to indicate doing something according to or in accordance with a particular rule, guideline, instruction, etc.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '照 (zhào)' implies following or sticking to a particular rule or instruction when performing an action. It's typically used to denote that one is carrying out an activity as instructed or according to a specific plan, rule, or guideline. This word can be used in various contexts and can be placed either before or after the subject.

title: 尽量 (jǐnliàng) - As much as possible
short_explanation: Used to express trying as much as possible to do something.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '尽量 (jǐnliàng)' is used to indicate an earnest effort to accomplish something to the fullest extent possible, similar to 'as much as possible' or 'to the best of one's ability' in English. It is used before the action that you are trying to maximize.
formation: Subject + 尽量 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 她尽量避免和他直接交流，因为他总是很尖酸刻薄。
examples.pinyin: Tā jǐnliàng bìmiǎn hé tā zhíjiē jiāoliú, yīnwèi tā zǒng shì hěn jiānsuānkèbó.
examples.en: She tries to avoid direct communication with him as much as possible, because he is always very sharp and sarcastic.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽量_jǐnliàng_-_As_much_as_possible_20231230_她尽量避免和他直接交流因为他总是很尖酸刻薄.mp3

examples.cn: 我们应该尽量减少浪费食物。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yīnggāi jǐnliàng jiǎnshǎo làngfèi shíwù.
examples.en: We should try as much as possible to reduce food waste.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽量_jǐnliàng_-_As_much_as_possible_20231230_我们应该尽量减少浪费食物.mp3

examples.cn: 整个冬天，我尽量每天都去健身房锻炼。
examples.pinyin: Zhěnggè dōngtiān, wǒ jǐnliàng měitiān dōu qù jiànshēnfáng duànliàn.
examples.en: Throughout the winter, I try as much as possible to go to the gym every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽量_jǐnliàng_-_As_much_as_possible_20231230_整个冬天我尽量每天都去健身房锻炼.mp3

examples.cn: 尽量吃新鲜的蔬果，以保健康。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnliàng chī xīnxiān de shūguǒ, yǐ bǎojiànkāng.
examples.en: Try as much as possible to eat fresh fruits and vegetables for health.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽量_jǐnliàng_-_As_much_as_possible_20231230_尽量吃新鲜的蔬果以保健康.mp3

title: 趁 (chèn) - To take advantage of
short_explanation: This expresses the idea of taking advantage of an opportunity or situation to do something.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '趁 (chèn)' is used to express the concept of utilizing an opportunity or a situation to carry out a certain action. It often implies that the action is performed while the given situation or condition is still in progress and is analogous to 'taking advantage of' or 'seizing the moment' in English.
formation: Subject + 趁 + Situation/Opportunity + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 趁天气还不错，我们去公园散步吧。
examples.pinyin: Chèn tiānqì hái bùcuò, wǒmen qù gōngyuán sànbù ba.
examples.en: Let's take advantage of the decent weather and go to the park for a walk.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_趁_chèn_-_To_take_advantage_of_20231230_趁天气还不错我们去公园散步吧.mp3

examples.cn: 趁老板不在，他偷偷地抽烟。
examples.pinyin: Chèn lǎobǎn bù zài, tā tōutōu de chōuyān.
examples.en: He smokes secretly taking advantage of the boss's absence.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_趁_chèn_-_To_take_advantage_of_20231230_趁老板不在他偷偷地抽烟.mp3

examples.cn: 趁她还没有离开，我打算向她道歉。
examples.pinyin: Chèn tā hái méiyǒu líkāi, wǒ dǎsuàn xiàng tā dàoqiàn.
examples.en: I plan to apologize to her while she hasn't left yet.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_趁_chèn_-_To_take_advantage_of_20231230_趁她还没有离开我打算向她道歉.mp3

examples.cn: 趁着周末你有空，我们可以去看电影。
examples.pinyin: Chèn zhe zhōumò nǐ yǒu kōng, wǒmen kěyǐ qù kàn diànyǐng.
examples.en: While you have free time over the weekend, we can go to see a movie.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_趁_chèn_-_To_take_advantage_of_20231230_趁着周末你有空我们可以去看电影.mp3

title: 难怪 (nánguài) - No wonder, so that's why
short_explanation: Used to express realization or understanding of a previously confusing or surprising situation.
long_explanation: '难怪 (nánguài)' is an exclamatory phrase in Mandarin Chinese used when something that was previously not understood becomes clear, resulting in an expression of understanding or realization. It is equivalent to saying 'No wonder' or 'So that's why' in English. This phrase is often used upon discovering the reason behind a certain occurrence, action, or behavior.
formation: 难怪 + explanation / cause of surprise

examples.cn: 难怪你不饿，你刚吃了一大块蛋糕。
examples.pinyin: Nánguài nǐ bù è, nǐ gāng chīle yī dà kuài dàngāo.
examples.en: No wonder you're not hungry, you just had a big piece of cake.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难怪_nánguài_-_No_wonder_so_thats_why_20231230_难怪你不饿你刚吃了一大块蛋糕.mp3

examples.cn: 难怪他累，他昨天一夜没睡觉。
examples.pinyin: Nánguài tā lèi, tā zuótiān yīyè méi shuìjiào.
examples.en: No wonder he's tired, he didn't sleep all last night.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难怪_nánguài_-_No_wonder_so_thats_why_20231230_难怪他累他昨天一夜没睡觉.mp3

examples.cn: 难怪你的中文这么好，你在中国住了五年。
examples.pinyin: Nánguài nǐ de Zhōngwén zhème hǎo, nǐ zài Zhōngguó zhùle wǔ nián.
examples.en: No wonder your Chinese is so good, you lived in China for five years.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难怪_nánguài_-_No_wonder_so_thats_why_20231230_难怪你的中文这么好你在中国住了五年.mp3

examples.cn: 难怪她那么开心，她的男朋友刚求婚了。
examples.pinyin: Nánguài tā nàme kāixīn, tā de nán péngyou gāng qiúhūn le.
examples.en: No wonder she is so happy, her boyfriend just proposed.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难怪_nánguài_-_No_wonder_so_thats_why_20231230_难怪她那么开心她的男朋友刚求婚了.mp3

title: 虽然...却... (suīrán... què...) - Although... yet...
short_explanation: Used to express contrast or contradiction between two situations or states.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '虽然...却... (suīrán... què...)' is used to express a contrast or contradiction between two situations or states. The statement following '虽然' sets up an expectation, but '却' introduces a reality that contradicts or contrasts with that expectation. It is equivalent to the English construct 'Although... yet...'.
formation: 虽然 + Statement, 却 + Contradicting statement

examples.cn: 虽然他很穷，却很快乐。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán tā hěn qióng, què hěn kuàilè.
examples.en: Although he is poor, he is very happy.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽然却_suīrán_què_-_Although_yet_20231230_虽然他很穷却很快乐.mp3

examples.cn: 虽然这个课程很难，却很有趣。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán zhège kèchéng hěn nán, què hěn yǒuqù.
examples.en: Although this course is hard, it is very interesting.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽然却_suīrán_què_-_Although_yet_20231230_虽然这个课程很难却很有趣.mp3

examples.cn: 虽然天气很糟糕，我们却决定去野餐。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán tiānqì hěn zāogāo, wǒmen què juédìng qù yěcān.
examples.en: Although the weather is terrible, we decided to go for a picnic.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽然却_suīrán_què_-_Although_yet_20231230_虽然天气很糟糕我们却决定去野餐.mp3

examples.cn: 虽然她总是忙碌，却总是有时间帮助别人。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán tā zǒng shì mánglù, què zǒng shì yǒu shíjiān bāngzhù biérén.
examples.en: Although she is always busy, she always has time to help others.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽然却_suīrán_què_-_Although_yet_20231230_虽然她总是忙碌却总是有时间帮助别人.mp3

title: 从此 (cóngcǐ) - From now on, henceforth
short_explanation: This phrase is used to designate the beginning of a new state or behavior that will continue into the future.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '从此 (cóngcǐ)' is an adverb of time, meaning 'from now on' or 'henceforth'. Its usage often points towards a change in state or behavior that starts from the point in time specified or inferred in the context, and will continue into the future. It is used in multiple contexts to describe both physical and abstract changes.
formation: 从此 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 他从此开始节约用水。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóngcǐ kāishǐ jiéyuē yòngshuǐ.
examples.en: From now on, he has started to conserve water.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_从此_cóngcǐ_-_From_now_on_henceforth_20231230_他从此开始节约用水.mp3

examples.cn: 自从那次事故后，他从此不再开车。
examples.pinyin: Zì cóng nàcì shìgù hòu, tā cóngcǐ bù zài kāi chē.
examples.en: Since that accident, he has stopped driving from then on.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_从此_cóngcǐ_-_From_now_on_henceforth_20231230_自从那次事故后他从此不再开车.mp3

examples.cn: 从此，我决定每天早上跑步。
examples.pinyin: Cóngcǐ, wǒ juédìng měitiān zǎoshang pǎobù.
examples.en: From now on, I decided to run every morning.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_从此_cóngcǐ_-_From_now_on_henceforth_20231230_从此我决定每天早上跑步.mp3

examples.cn: 他答应从此不再喝酒。
examples.pinyin: Tā dāyìng cóngcǐ bù zài hējiǔ.
examples.en: He promised that he would not drink alcohol from now on.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_从此_cóngcǐ_-_From_now_on_henceforth_20231230_他答应从此不再喝酒.mp3

title: 反而 (fǎn'ér) - On the contrary, instead
short_explanation: Used to indicate an opposite or unexpected result.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '反而 (fǎn'ér)' is used to indicate a result that is contrary or opposite to what was previously mentioned, or something that happens other than what was expected. It is often equivalent to saying 'on the contrary' or 'instead' in English. Using '反而' can help to introduce a surprising or unexpected detail in a sentence.
formation: Sentence or phrase + 反而 + Outcome

examples.cn: 我以为这场比赛会很难赢，但是我们反而轻松取得了胜利。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐwéi zhè chǎng bǐsài huì hěn nán yíng, dànshì wǒmen fǎn'ér qīngsōng qǔdéle shènglì.
examples.en: I thought this match would be hard to win, but instead, we easily won.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_我以为这场比赛会很难赢但是我们反而轻松取得了胜利.mp3

examples.cn: 她没有生气，反而感到很高兴。
examples.pinyin: Tā méiyǒu shēngqì, fǎn'ér gǎndào hěn gāoxìng.
examples.en: She did not get angry, instead, she felt very happy.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_她没有生气反而感到很高兴.mp3

examples.cn: 我原以为他会反对我的建议，他反而非常支持。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yuán yǐwéi tā huì fǎnduì wǒ de jiànyì, tā fǎn'ér fēicháng zhīchí.
examples.en: I originally thought he would oppose my suggestion, but on the contrary, he was very supportive.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_我原以为他会反对我的建议他反而非常支持.mp3

examples.cn: 他没有感到难过，反而感到宽慰。
examples.pinyin: Tā méiyǒu gǎndào nánguò, fǎn'ér gǎndào kuānwèi.
examples.en: He did not feel upset, on the contrary, he felt comforted.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_他没有感到难过反而感到宽慰.mp3

title: 从来 (cónglái) - Always, at all times
short_explanation: Used to indicate a situation that has been true 'always', or 'at all times'
long_explanation: 从来 (cónglái) is a Mandarin Chinese adverb that can be used to express the English concept of 'always' or 'at all times', indicating a situation or event has been true from the past until now. It is often used in conjunction with 不 or 没 (before the verb) to express 'never'. Conversely without 不 or 没, '从来' suggests that something 'always' happens.

examples.cn: 我从来不喝咖啡，因为它让我睡不着觉。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ cónglái bù hē kāfēi, yīnwèi tā ràng wǒ shuì bù zháo jiào.
examples.en: I never drink coffee because it keeps me awake.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_从来_cónglái_-_Always_at_all_times_20231230_我从来不喝咖啡因为它让我睡不着觉.mp3

examples.cn: 他从来都是按时完成工作的，很少有延误。
examples.pinyin: Tā cónglái dōu shì ànshí wánchéng gōngzuò de, hěn shǎo yǒu yánwù.
examples.en: He always finishes his work on time and seldom delays.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_从来_cónglái_-_Always_at_all_times_20231230_他从来都是按时完成工作的很少有延误.mp3

examples.cn: 从来没有人能在这么短的时间里完成这项任务。
examples.pinyin: Cónglái méiyǒu rén néng zài zhème duǎn de shíjiān lǐ wánchéng zhè xiàng rènwù.
examples.en: Never has anyone been able to complete this task in such a short time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_从来_cónglái_-_Always_at_all_times_20231230_从来没有人能在这么短的时间里完成这项任务.mp3

examples.cn: 他从来不吃早餐，所以总是在上午感到饿。
examples.pinyin: Tā cónglái bù chī zǎocān, suǒyǐ zǒng shì zài shàngwǔ gǎndào è.
examples.en: He never eats breakfast, so he always feels hungry in the morning.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_从来_cónglái_-_Always_at_all_times_20231230_他从来不吃早餐所以总是在上午感到饿.mp3

title: 比如说 (bǐrú shuō) - For example
short_explanation: Used to introduce an example or list of examples.
long_explanation: The phrase '比如说 (bǐrú shuō)' in Mandarin Chinese is used to present an example or a list of examples that help to clarify or illustrate a point being made. It is equivalent to the English phrase 'for example'. It often used when providing specific instances to support or elaborate on a general statement.

examples.cn: 我喜欢吃各种各样的水果，比如说苹果、香蕉和橘子。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān chī gèzhǒng gèyàng de shuǐguǒ, bǐrú shuō píngguǒ, xiāngjiāo hé júzi.
examples.en: I like to eat all kinds of fruits, for example, apples, bananas and oranges.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_比如说_bǐrú_shuō_-_For_example_20231230_我喜欢吃各种各样的水果比如说苹果香蕉和橘子.mp3

examples.cn: 我有很多爱好，比如说画画，弹钢琴和读书。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǒu hěnduō àihào, bǐrú shuō huàhuà, tán gāngqín hé dúshū.
examples.en: I have many hobbies, for example, painting, playing the piano and reading.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_比如说_bǐrú_shuō_-_For_example_20231230_我有很多爱好比如说画画弹钢琴和读书.mp3

examples.cn: 你可以参加各种社区活动，比如说烘焙课程，瑜伽课或志愿者服务。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kěyǐ cānjiā gèzhǒng shèqū huódòng, bǐrú shuō hōngbèi kèchéng, yújiā kè huò zhìyuànzhě fúwù.
examples.en: You can participate in various community events, for example, baking classes, yoga sessions, or volunteer services.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_比如说_bǐrú_shuō_-_For_example_20231230_你可以参加各种社区活动比如说烘焙课程瑜伽课或志愿者服务.mp3

examples.cn: 在这个城市有很多值得参观的地方，比如说博物馆、公园和艺术画廊。
examples.pinyin: Zài zhège chéngshì yǒu hěnduō zhídé cānguān de dìfang, bǐrú shuō bówùguǎn, gōngyuán hé yìshù huàláng.
examples.en: There are many places worth visiting in this city, for example, museums, parks and art galleries.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_比如说_bǐrú_shuō_-_For_example_20231230_在这个城市有很多值得参观的地方比如说博物馆公园和艺术画廊.mp3

title: 光是...就... (guāng shì... jiù...) - Just...alone...
short_explanation: Used to emphasize that one aspect alone is enough to cause another action or result.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '光是...就...' is used to draw attention to the significance of a single factor or aspect by signaling that it alone is sufficient to trigger the additional action or result that follows. Its equivalent in English would be 'just... alone...'. The component '光是...' signifies the notable factor, while '就...' indicates the subsequent action or result.
formation: 光是 + Notable aspect + 就 + Subsequent action/result

examples.cn: 光是考虑这个项目的成本，就足够让我担忧了。
examples.pinyin: Guāng shì kǎolǜ zhège xiàngmù de chéngběn, jiù zúgòu ràng wǒ dānyōu le.
examples.en: Just considering the cost of this project alone is enough to make me worry.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_光是就_guāng_shì_jiù_-_Justalone_20231230_光是考虑这个项目的成本就足够让我担忧了.mp3

examples.cn: 光是看你的笑脸，就让我感到开心。
examples.pinyin: Guāng shì kàn nǐ de xiàoliǎn, jiù ràng wǒ gǎndào kāixīn.
examples.en: Just seeing your smile alone makes me happy.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_光是就_guāng_shì_jiù_-_Justalone_20231230_光是看你的笑脸就让我感到开心.mp3

examples.cn: 光是你的一个吻，就足以让我忘记所有的烦恼。
examples.pinyin: Guāng shì nǐ de yī gè wěn, jiù zúyǐ ràng wǒ wàngjì suǒyǒu de fánnǎo.
examples.en: Just a single kiss from you alone is enough to make me forget all my worries.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_光是就_guāng_shì_jiù_-_Justalone_20231230_光是你的一个吻就足以让我忘记所有的烦恼.mp3

examples.cn: 光是你在我身边，就让我感到安全和满足。
examples.pinyin: Guāng shì nǐ zài wǒ shēnbiān, jiù ràng wǒ gǎndào ānquán hé mǎnzú.
examples.en: Just you being by my side alone makes me feel safe and content.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_光是就_guāng_shì_jiù_-_Justalone_20231230_光是你在我身边就让我感到安全和满足.mp3

title: 根本 (gēnběn) - At all, simply (used in the negative)
short_explanation: Used to emphasize the negation in a statement.
long_explanation: '根本 (gēnběn)' is a Mandarin Chinese adverb most frequently used in the negative to place emphasis on an absolute negation or denial. It is often translated as 'at all' or 'simply' in English. This term can be used with both actions and states, making it versatile and commonly used in everyday conversation. It is placed before the verb in a sentence.

examples.cn: 我根本不知道他在说什么。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ gēnběn bù zhīdào tā zài shuō shénme.
examples.en: I simply don't know what he's talking about.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根本_gēnběn_-_At_all_simply_used_in_the_negative_20231230_我根本不知道他在说什么.mp3

examples.cn: 他根本没有听我的话。
examples.pinyin: Tā gēnběn méiyǒu tīng wǒ de huà.
examples.en: He didn't listen to what I said at all.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根本_gēnběn_-_At_all_simply_used_in_the_negative_20231230_他根本没有听我的话.mp3

examples.cn: 你根本不了解我。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ gēnběn bù liǎojiě wǒ.
examples.en: You don't understand me at all.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根本_gēnběn_-_At_all_simply_used_in_the_negative_20231230_你根本不了解我.mp3

examples.cn: 我们根本没有时间去旅行。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen gēnběn méiyǒu shíjiān qù lǚxíng.
examples.en: We simply don't have time to travel.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根本_gēnběn_-_At_all_simply_used_in_the_negative_20231230_我们根本没有时间去旅行.mp3

title: 否定词 (fǒudìngcí) - Negative adverbs like 不 (bù) and 没 (méi)
short_explanation: 否定词 are words used to negate or show the negative of something.
long_explanation: 否定词, translated as 'negative adverbs' in English, are used in Mandarin Chinese to negate or show the negative of an action or condition. There are two main negative words 使用 in Chinese: 不 (bù) and 没 (méi). 不 (bù) is used to express a general negation or denial, while 没 (méi) is primarily used to express the non-existence or absence of something or to negate past actions.

examples.cn: 我不喜欢吃鱼，因为我对鱼过敏。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù xǐhuān chī yú, yīnwèi wǒ duì yú guòmǐn.
examples.en: I don't like to eat fish because I am allergic to fish.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_否定词_fǒudìngcí_-_Negative_adverbs_like_不_bù_and_没_méi_20231230_我不喜欢吃鱼因为我对鱼过敏.mp3

examples.cn: 他昨天没来学校，因为他生病了。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuótiān méi lái xuéxiào, yīnwèi tā shēngbìng le.
examples.en: He didn't come to school yesterday because he was sick.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_否定词_fǒudìngcí_-_Negative_adverbs_like_不_bù_and_没_méi_20231230_他昨天没来学校因为他生病了.mp3

examples.cn: 我不认为这是一个好主意。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù rènwéi zhè shì yīgè hǎo zhǔyì.
examples.en: I don't think this is a good idea.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_否定词_fǒudìngcí_-_Negative_adverbs_like_不_bù_and_没_méi_20231230_我不认为这是一个好主意.mp3

examples.cn: 我昨天没看电影，因为我太忙了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuótiān méi kàn diànyǐng, yīnwèi wǒ tài máng le.
examples.en: I didn't watch a movie yesterday because I was too busy.

title: 立刻 (lìkè) - Immediately, right away
short_explanation: This expression is used to denote immediacy or urgency, similar to the English expressions 'right away' or 'immediately'
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '立刻 (lìkè)' is an adverb which means 'immediately' or 'right away'. It indicates that an action or event will take place in the near future or should take place as soon as possible. This adverb is often used in contexts where urgency or immediacy is required.
formation: Subject + 立刻 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 如果你不立刻再读一遍这个语法点，你可能会忘记它的用法。
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ nǐ bù lìkè zài dú yī biàn zhège yǔfǎ diǎn, nǐ kěnéng huì wàngjì tā de yòngfǎ.
examples.en: If you don't read through this grammar point again right away, you might forget its usage.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_立刻_lìkè_-_Immediately_right_away_20231230_如果你不立刻再读一遍这个语法点你可能会忘记它的用法.mp3

examples.cn: 他立刻把地址告诉我，让我能准备前往那个地方。
examples.pinyin: Tā lìkè bǎ dìzhǐ gàosù wǒ, ràng wǒ néng zhǔnbèi qiánwǎng nàgè dìfāng.
examples.en: He gave me the address right away so that I could make preparations to head to that location.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_立刻_lìkè_-_Immediately_right_away_20231230_他立刻把地址告诉我让我能准备前往那个地方.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦你意识到自己做错了，你应该立刻道歉。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn nǐ yìshí dào zìjǐ zuò cuòle, nǐ yīnggāi lìkè dàoqiàn.
examples.en: Once you realize you've made a mistake, you should apologize immediately.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_立刻_lìkè_-_Immediately_right_away_20231230_一旦你意识到自己做错了你应该立刻道歉.mp3

examples.cn: 我妈妈要我立刻回家帮她做饭。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ māmā yào wǒ lìkè huí jiā bāng tā zuò fàn.
examples.en: My mother wants me to come home to help her cook right away.

title: 到处 (dàochù) - Everywhere
short_explanation: Used to mean 'everywhere' or 'all over'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '到处 (dàochù)' is used to express 'everywhere' or 'all over'. It is used when one wants to indicate that an action or a state applies to a wide area or multiple locations. It is used before verbs to express the scope or extent of an action.

examples.cn: 春天到了，公园里花儿到处开放。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān dàole, gōngyuán lǐ huā'er dàochù kāifàng.
examples.en: Spring is here, and flowers are blooming everywhere in the park.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_到处_dàochù_-_Everywhere_20231230_春天到了公园里花儿到处开放.mp3

examples.cn: 他到处找他的钥匙，但是找不到。
examples.pinyin: Tā dàochù zhǎo tā de yàoshi, dànshì zhǎo bù dào.
examples.en: He looked everywhere for his keys, but couldn't find them.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_到处_dàochù_-_Everywhere_20231230_他到处找他的钥匙但是找不到.mp3

examples.cn: 这个城市到处都是美食，我很享受。
examples.pinyin: Zhège chéngshì dàochù dōu shì měishí, wǒ hěn xiǎngshòu.
examples.en: This city has delicious food everywhere, and I'm enjoying it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_到处_dàochù_-_Everywhere_20231230_这个城市到处都是美食我很享受.mp3

examples.cn: 他是一个知名的音乐家，他的音乐到处都能听到。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yīgè zhīmíng de yīnyuèjiā, tā de yīnyuè dàochù dōu néng tīngdào.
examples.en: He is a well-known musician, and his music can be heard everywhere.

title: 以前 (yǐqián) - Before, in the past
short_explanation: Used to indicate that something happened or was true in the past.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '以前 (yǐqián)' is used to express a time prior to a certain point or situation, signifying that an event or condition occurred or existed 'before' or 'in the past.' It could refer to an earlier moment in time on a smaller scale (like earlier in the day) or on a larger scale (like years ago).
formation: Subject + 以前 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 以前我不懂得欣赏咖啡的味道，但现在我爱上了咖啡。
examples.pinyin: Yǐqián wǒ bù dǒngdé xīnshǎng kāfēi de wèidào, dàn xiànzài wǒ ài shàng le kāfēi.
examples.en: I did not understand the taste of coffee before, but now I have fallen in love with coffee.

examples.cn: 你以前有过养狗的经验吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yǐqián yǒu guò yǎng gǒu de jīngyàn ma?
examples.en: Do you have experience with raising dogs in the past?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以前_yǐqián_-_Before_in_the_past_20231230_你以前有过养狗的经验吗.mp3

examples.cn: 以前这里有一座桥，现在已经没了。
examples.pinyin: Yǐqián zhèlǐ yǒuyīzuò qiáo, xiànzài yǐjīng méile.
examples.en: There used to be a bridge here in the past, but now it's gone.

examples.cn: 他以前是一个老师，现在成了一个作家。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐqián shì yīgè lǎoshī, xiànzài chéngle yīgè zuòjiā.
examples.en: He was a teacher before, now he has become a writer.

title: 之后 (zhīhòu) - Afterward, after
short_explanation: Used to express a sequence of actions or events.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '之后 (zhīhòu)' is used to denote the sequence of actions or events. It corresponds to the English words 'after' or 'afterward'. It is often used to describe something that occurs after a certain event, action, or time. The element before '之后 (zhīhòu)' sets the reference point.

examples.cn: 吃完饭之后，我们去电影院看电影。
examples.pinyin: Chī wán fàn zhīhòu, wǒmen qù diànyǐngyuàn kàn diànyǐng.
examples.en: After finishing eating, we go to the cinema to watch a movie.

examples.cn: 考试之后，大家都去公园放松一下。
examples.pinyin: Kǎoshì zhīhòu, dàjiā dōu qù gōngyuán fàngsōng yīxià.
examples.en: After the exam, everyone goes to the park to relax.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_之后_zhīhòu_-_Afterward_after_20231230_考试之后大家都去公园放松一下.mp3

examples.cn: 上完课之后，我通常去图书馆复习。
examples.pinyin: Shàng wán kè zhīhòu, wǒ tōngcháng qù túshūguǎn fùxí.
examples.en: After finishing class, I usually go to the library to review.

title: 早已 (zǎoyǐ) - Long ago, for a long time
short_explanation: Used to indicate that an action or situation occurred long ago or for a long time.
long_explanation: '早已 (zǎoyǐ)' is a Mandarin Chinese phrase used to emphasize that something has happened for a long time or happened long ago. It is usually used to stress an extended period of time passing since an event or situation. The English equivalent would be 'long ago' or 'for a long time'.
formation: Subject + 早已 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 他早已习惯了单身生活，所以并不感到孤独。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǎoyǐ xíguànle dānshēn shēnghuó, suǒyǐ bìng bù gǎndào gūdú.
examples.en: He has long been accustomed to a single life, so he doesn't feel lonely.

examples.cn: 我早已对这个城市的繁华景象失去了兴趣。

examples.en: I have long lost interest in the bustling scene of this city.

examples.cn: 这本书早已在全球范围内销售超过一亿本。

title: 一切 (yíqiè) - Everything, every
short_explanation: '一切' is used to express 'everything' or 'every' in Mandarin Chinese.
long_explanation: '一切 (yíqiè)' is a Mandarin Chinese term that is commonly used to generalize or collectively refer to all things, persons or occurrences related to a particular subject. It can be translated as 'everything' or 'every' in English. It is utilized to deliver all-rounded, comprehensive views or actions concerning a topic.
formation: Subject + 一切 + Noun/Adjective (if '一切' is used as a pronoun, no noun follows)

examples.cn: 我会尽我所能去完成一切任务。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ huì jìn wǒ suǒ néng qù wánchéng yíqiè rènwù.
examples.en: I will do my best to complete every task.

title: 只有 (zhǐyǒu) - Only, solely
short_explanation: Used to express the conditionality of an event or situation.
long_explanation: '只有 (zhǐyǒu)' in Mandarin Chinese is used to indicate a condition that must be met for a result to happen, similar to 'only if' or 'only when' in English. It is usually used in the context of stating a condition that is essential or necessary for a certain result.

examples.cn: 只有通过努力学习，你才能掌握中文。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyǒu tōngguò nǔlì xuéxí, nǐ cáinéng zhǎngwò zhōngwén.
examples.en: Only through hard study can you master Chinese.

examples.en: Only when you understand the truth of the matter can you make the right decision.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只有_zhǐyǒu_-_Only_solely_20231230_只有明白事情的真相你才能做出正确的决定.mp3

title: 一边...一边... (yìbiān... yìbiān...) - Doing two actions simultaneously
short_explanation: Used to express two actions happening at the same time.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '一边...一边...' (yìbiān... yìbiān...) is used when expressing two actions or events that occur simultaneously. In English, the equivalent could be 'while...', 'at the same time...', 'as...' or 'doing something and doing something else at the same time' depending on the context.
formation: Subject + 一边 + Verb 1 + 一边 + Verb 2

examples.cn: 他一边听音乐一边做家务。

examples.cn: 她一边看电视一边吃晚饭。

title: 要是 (yàoshi) - If
short_explanation: Used to express a conditional or hypothetical situation, equivalent to 'if' in English.
long_explanation: The phrase '要是 (yàoshi)' in Mandarin Chinese is a conjunction used to represent 'if' or 'suppose' and is commonly used to begin hypothetical or conditional sentences. It suggests that the following clause is a condition for the subsequent clause to occur.

examples.cn: 要是我有足够的时间，我就去旅行。
examples.pinyin: Yàoshi wǒ yǒu zúgōu de shíjiān, wǒ jiù qù lǚxíng.
examples.en: If I have enough time, I will travel.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_要是_yàoshi_-_If_20231230_要是我有足够的时间我就去旅行.mp3

examples.cn: 要是他们不来，我们就开会了。
examples.pinyin: Yàoshi tāmen bù lái, wǒmen jiù kāihuì le.
examples.en: If they don't come, we'll start the meeting.

examples.cn: 要是我知道他的电话，我就告诉你。
examples.pinyin: Yàoshi wǒ zhīdào tā de diànhuà, wǒ jiù gàosù nǐ.
examples.en: If I knew his phone number, I would tell you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_要是_yàoshi_-_If_20231230_要是我知道他的电话我就告诉你.mp3

examples.cn: 要是下雨，我们就不去公园了。
examples.pinyin: Yàoshi xiàyǔ, wǒmen jiù bù qù gōngyuán le.

title: 无所谓 (wúsuǒwèi) - Doesn't matter, indifferent
short_explanation: Used to express indifference or lack of concern towards something.
long_explanation: The phrase '无所谓 (wúsuǒwèi)' in Mandarin Chinese is used to convey a sense of indifference or nonchalance towards a certain situation or outcome. It can be translated to 'it doesn't matter', 'I don’t care' or 'whatever' in English. It is used when the speaker does not have a strong preference or is unconcerned about the result.
formation: Subject + 无所谓 + (regarding...) + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 去哪里吃饭我都无所谓，你决定吧。
examples.pinyin: Qù nǎlǐ chīfàn wǒ dōu wúsuǒwèi, nǐ juédìng ba.
examples.en: I do not care where we eat, you decide.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无所谓_wúsuǒwèi_-_Doesnt_matter_indifferent_20231230_去哪里吃饭我都无所谓你决定吧.mp3

examples.cn: 我对他是怎么想的，我完全无所谓。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ duì tā shì zěnme xiǎng de, wǒ wánquán wúsuǒwèi.
examples.en: I don't care at all what he thinks of me.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无所谓_wúsuǒwèi_-_Doesnt_matter_indifferent_20231230_我对他是怎么想的我完全无所谓.mp3

examples.cn: 无论你选择什么，我都无所谓。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn nǐ xuǎnzé shénme, wǒ dōu wúsuǒwèi.
examples.en: Whatever you choose, I don't really care.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无所谓_wúsuǒwèi_-_Doesnt_matter_indifferent_20231230_无论你选择什么我都无所谓.mp3

examples.cn: 你今天穿哪套衣服我真的无所谓。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ jīntiān chuān nǎ tào yīfú wǒ zhēn de wúsuǒwèi.
examples.en: I truly don't care which outfit you wear today.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无所谓_wúsuǒwèi_-_Doesnt_matter_indifferent_20231230_你今天穿哪套衣服我真的无所谓.mp3

title: 正好 (zhènghǎo) - Just right, Just in time
short_explanation: Used to express something is just right or just in time.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '正好 (zhènghǎo)' is used when something is just right in terms of size, amount, time, etc., or happens by chance just in time. It can be used to describe a condition or situation that fits precisely with needs, preferences or timing. It is similar to 'just right' or 'just in time' in English.
formation: Subject + Verb + 正好 + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 你来得正好，我正打算找你。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ lái de zhènghǎo, wǒ zhèng dǎsuàn zhǎo nǐ.
examples.en: You came just in time, I was about to find you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正好_zhènghǎo_-_Just_right_Just_in_time_20231230_你来得正好我正打算找你.mp3

examples.cn: 我到家的那一刻，雨正好停了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ dào jiā de nà yīkè, yǔ zhènghǎo tíng le.
examples.en: The moment I arrived home, the rain just stopped.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正好_zhènghǎo_-_Just_right_Just_in_time_20231230_我到家的那一刻雨正好停了.mp3

examples.cn: 这件衣服正好适合我。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn yīfú zhènghǎo shìhé wǒ.
examples.en: This piece of clothing fits me just right.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正好_zhènghǎo_-_Just_right_Just_in_time_20231230_这件衣服正好适合我.mp3

examples.cn: 我走进教室的时候，老师正好开始上课。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǒu jìn jiàoshì de shíhòu, lǎoshī zhènghǎo kāishǐ shàngkè.
examples.en: When I walked into the classroom, the teacher just started the class.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正好_zhènghǎo_-_Just_right_Just_in_time_20231230_我走进教室的时候老师正好开始上课.mp3

title: 除非 (chúfēi) - Unless
short_explanation: Used to present a condition that must be fulfilled before something else can happen.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '除非 (chúfēi)' functions as a conjunction to present a prerequisite condition that must be met before an event or action can occur. It is equivalent to the English term 'unless'. This phrase is commonly used to indicate that something will only happen on the provision of another specific event or situation.

examples.cn: 除非你完成作业，否则你不能出去播放。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ wánchéng zuòyè, fǒuzé nǐ bùnéng chūqù bōfàng.
examples.en: Unless you finish your homework, you can't go out and play.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_20231230_除非你完成作业否则你不能出去播放.mp3

examples.cn: 除非她同意，我不会在周末去那个派对。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi tā tóngyì, wǒ bù huì zài zhōumò qù nàgè pàiduì.
examples.en: Unless she agrees, I won't go to that party this weekend.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_20231230_除非她同意我不会在周末去那个派对.mp3

examples.cn: 除非他道歉，我不会原谅他。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi tā dàoqiàn, wǒ bù huì yuánliàng tā.
examples.en: Unless he apologizes, I won't forgive him.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_20231230_除非他道歉我不会原谅他.mp3

examples.cn: 除非我失业，否则我不会搬回父母的家。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi wǒ shīyè, fǒuzé wǒ bù huì bān huí fùmǔ de jiā.
examples.en: Unless I lose my job, I won't move back into my parents' house.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_20231230_除非我失业否则我不会搬回父母的家.mp3

title: 其中 (qízhōng) - Among, within
short_explanation: Used to refer to a part or some of something in a group or a whole.
long_explanation: '其中 (qízhōng)' is a common word in Mandarin Chinese used to express the English equivalent of 'among' or 'within'. It points out a portion or member of a larger group or collection. It is often used in sentences to indicate that the subject is part of a larger group, or that something is contained within something else.

examples.cn: 我们学校有五百多个学生，其中有一半是外国人。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen xuéxiào yǒu wǔbǎi duō gè xuéshēng, qízhōng yǒu yībàn shì wàiguórén.
examples.en: Our school has more than 500 students, among them half are foreigners.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其中_qízhōng_-_Among_within_20231230_我们学校有五百多个学生其中有一半是外国人.mp3

examples.cn: 我买了一箱苹果，其中有三个是烂的。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le yī xiāng píngguǒ, qízhōng yǒu sān gè shì làn de.
examples.en: I bought a box of apples, among them three are rotten.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其中_qízhōng_-_Among_within_20231230_我买了一箱苹果其中有三个是烂的.mp3

examples.cn: 她收到了很多的份礼物，其中最喜欢的是这册画册。
examples.pinyin: Tā shōudào le hěnduō de fèn lǐwù, qízhōng zuì xǐhuān de shì zhè cè huàcè.
examples.en: She received many gifts, among them her favorite is this album of paintings.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其中_qízhōng_-_Among_within_20231230_她收到了很多的份礼物其中最喜欢的是这册画册.mp3

examples.cn: 我们公司有十个部门，其中财务部是最大的。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen gōngsī yǒu shí ge bùmén, qízhōng cáiwù bù shì zuì dà de.
examples.en: Our company has ten departments, among them the finance department is the largest.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其中_qízhōng_-_Among_within_20231230_我们公司有十个部门其中财务部是最大的.mp3

title: 以为 (yǐwéi) - To believe, to think (mistakenly)
short_explanation: Used to express a mistaken belief or incorrect assumption.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '以为 (yǐwéi)' is often used to express a belief or assumption that has turned out to be incorrect. It is quite versatile, and can be used in both past and present contexts to show that a previous understanding was incorrect. The structure is often: 'Subject + 以为 + Mistaken Belief', followed by the correction of that mistaken belief.

examples.cn: 他以为我是他妹妹，其实我是他的同学。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐwéi wǒ shì tā mèimei, qíshí wǒ shì tā de tóngxué.
examples.en: He mistakenly thought I was his sister, when in fact I am his classmate.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以为_yǐwéi_-_To_believe_to_think_mistakenly_20231230_他以为我是他妹妹其实我是他的同学.mp3

examples.cn: 我以为你明天才回来，没想到你今天就回来了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐwéi nǐ míngtiān cáihuí lái, méi xiǎngdào nǐ jīntiān jiù huílái le.
examples.en: I thought you were coming back tomorrow, I didn't expect that you would come back today.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以为_yǐwéi_-_To_believe_to_think_mistakenly_20231230_我以为你明天才回来没想到你今天就回来了.mp3

examples.cn: 她以为我不喜欢看电影，其实我很喜欢。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐwéi wǒ bù xǐhuān kàn diànyǐng, qíshí wǒ hěn xǐhuān.
examples.en: She mistakenly thought that I do not like watching movies, in fact, I really enjoy it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以为_yǐwéi_-_To_believe_to_think_mistakenly_20231230_她以为我不喜欢看电影其实我很喜欢.mp3

examples.cn: 他们以为我们已经离开，实际上我们还在等他们。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen yǐwéi wǒmen yǐjīng líkāi, shíjì shàng wǒmen hái zài děng tāmen.
examples.en: They thought that we had already left, but in reality, we were still waiting for them.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以为_yǐwéi_-_To_believe_to_think_mistakenly_20231230_他们以为我们已经离开实际上我们还在等他们.mp3

title: 以外 (yǐwài) - Beyond, except for
short_explanation: Used to express a concept of 'beyond a particular domain/subject' or 'besides', 'except for'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '以外 (yǐwài)' is often used to indicate the idea of 'beyond' or 'except for' in English. It is used to highlight a particular point or subject that stands out from a broader category, or to stress something being outside of a given domain or context.
formation: Noun + 以外，other parts of the sentence

examples.cn: 学习以外,我喜欢阅读和旅游。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxí yǐwài, wǒ xǐhuān yuèdú hé lǚyóu.
examples.en: Beyond studying, I like reading and traveling.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以外_yǐwài_-_Beyond_except_for_20231230_学习以外我喜欢阅读和旅游.mp3

examples.cn: 除了汉语以外,她还会说英语和法语。
examples.pinyin: Chúle Hànyǔ yǐwài, tā hái huì shuō Yīngyǔ hé Fǎyǔ.
examples.en: Except for Chinese, she can also speak English and French.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以外_yǐwài_-_Beyond_except_for_20231230_除了汉语以外她还会说英语和法语.mp3

examples.cn: 周末以外,我每天都去健身房锻炼。
examples.pinyin: Zhōumò yǐwài, wǒ měi tiān dōu qù jiànshēnfáng duànliàn.
examples.en: Besides weekends, I go to the gym every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以外_yǐwài_-_Beyond_except_for_20231230_周末以外我每天都去健身房锻炼.mp3

examples.cn: 午饭以外,你还需要吃些什么吗？
examples.pinyin: Wǔfàn yǐwài, nǐ hái xūyào chī xiē shénme ma?
examples.en: Beyond lunch, do you need to eat anything else?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以外_yǐwài_-_Beyond_except_for_20231230_午饭以外你还需要吃些什么吗.mp3

title: 根据 (gēnjù) - According to
short_explanation: Used to refer to some basis for a statement or action.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '根据 (gēnjù)' is used to refer to some basis, such as facts, information, or principles, for making a statement or taking an action. It is equivalent to the prepositional phrase 'according to' in English. This phrase is used to associate the subsequent statement or action with a certain source of information or basis.
formation: 根据 + Source of information + Statement or Action

examples.cn: 根据天气预报，明天将会下雨。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù tiānqì yùbào, míngtiān jiāng huì xiàyǔ.
examples.en: According to the weather forecast, it's going to rain tomorrow.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_20231230_根据天气预报明天将会下雨.mp3

examples.cn: 根据我妈妈的建议，我决定学习医学。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù wǒ māmā de jiànyì, wǒ juédìng xuéxí yīxué.
examples.en: According to my mother's advice, I decided to study medicine.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_20231230_根据我妈妈的建议我决定学习医学.mp3

examples.cn: 根据这本旅游指南，这个地方是一个必去的景点。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù zhè běn lǚyóu zhǐnán, zhège dìfāng shì yīgè bì qù de jǐngdiǎn.
examples.en: According to this travel guide, this place is a must-visit spot.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_20231230_根据这本旅游指南这个地方是一个必去的景点.mp3

examples.cn: 根据他的表情，我认为他非常开心。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù tā de biǎoqíng, wǒ rènwéi tā fēicháng kāixīn.
examples.en: According to his expression, I think he's very happy.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_20231230_根据他的表情我认为他非常开心.mp3

title: 由 (yóu) - Because of, due to
short_explanation: The word '由' is used to indicate the reason or cause of something, similar to 'because of' or 'due to' in English.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '由' is often used to express the cause, reason, or basis for something. It can be used in a wide range of situations where one wants to explain why something happened or will happen, why a state exists, or why a person behaves a certain way. As a preposition, '由' typically precedes the cause or reason in the sentence.
formation: 由 + Reason or Cause + Subject + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 由于天气原因，我们的野餐活动不得不取消。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú tiānqì yuányīn, wǒmen de yěcān huódòng bùdébù qǔxiāo.
examples.en: Due to the weather, we had to cancel our picnic.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由_yóu_-_Because_of_due_to_20231230_由于天气原因我们的野餐活动不得不取消.mp3

examples.cn: 由于他的家境贫寒，他必须努力工作来支持家庭。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú tā de jiājìng pínhán, tā bìxū nǔlì gōngzuò lái zhīchí jiātíng.
examples.en: Because of his poor family situation, he has to work hard to support his family.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由_yóu_-_Because_of_due_to_20231230_由于他的家境贫寒他必须努力工作来支持家庭.mp3

examples.cn: 这个项目的延迟由于供应商的延误。
examples.pinyin: Zhège xiàngmù de yánchí yóuyú gōngyìngshāng de yánwù.
examples.en: The delay of the project is due to the supplier's delay.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由_yóu_-_Because_of_due_to_20231230_这个项目的延迟由于供应商的延误.mp3

examples.cn: 她的成功由于她的毅力和坚定不移的决心。
examples.pinyin: Tā de chénggōng yóuyú tā de yìlì hé jiāndìng bùyí de juédìng.
examples.en: Her success is due to her perseverance and unwavering determination.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由_yóu_-_Because_of_due_to_20231230_她的成功由于她的毅力和坚定不移的决心.mp3

title: 至于 (zhìyú) - As for, regarding
short_explanation: Used to shift the topic to a new person or thing.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '至于 (zhìyú)' is used to shift the subject of the sentence to a new person or thing. In English, it is similar to 'As for' or 'Regarding'. This phrase is used when you want to talk about something or someone different from what has been previously discussed or mentioned.
formation: 至于 + Person/Thing + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我已经完成了我的任务，至于你的任务，你完成了吗？
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐjīng wánchéngle wǒ de rènwù, zhìyú nǐ de rènwù, nǐ wánchéngle ma?
examples.en: I have already completed my task, as for your task, have you finished it?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至于_zhìyú_-_As_for_regarding_20231230_我已经完成了我的任务至于你的任务你完成了吗.mp3

examples.cn: 至于他，我真的不想再跟他说话了。
examples.pinyin: Zhì yú tā, wǒ zhēn de bù xiǎng zài gēn tā shuōhuà le.
examples.en: As for him, I really don't want to talk to him anymore.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至于_zhìyú_-_As_for_regarding_20231230_至于他我真的不想再跟他说话了.mp3

examples.cn: 我喜欢看喜剧片，至于恐怖片，我一点都不喜欢。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān kàn xǐjù piān, zhìyú kǒngbù piān, wǒ yīdiǎn dōu bù xǐhuān.
examples.en: I like watching comedies, as for horror movies, I don't like them at all.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至于_zhìyú_-_As_for_regarding_20231230_我喜欢看喜剧片至于恐怖片我一点都不喜欢.mp3

examples.cn: 至于你的提议，我还需要考虑一下。
examples.pinyin: Zhì yú nǐ de tíyì, wǒ hái xūyào kǎolǜ yíxià.
examples.en: As for your proposal, I still need to think about it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至于_zhìyú_-_As_for_regarding_20231230_至于你的提议我还需要考虑一下.mp3

title: 为了 (wèile) - In order to, for the purpose of
short_explanation: Used to express the purpose, aim or goal of an action.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese preposition '为了 (wèile)' is used to indicate the purpose or goal of an action, emphasizing what one is aiming to achieve. It is equivalent to 'in order to' or 'for the purpose of' in English. It is typically followed by the intended outcome or goal, then the action taken to achieve this.

examples.cn: 为了保持健康，他每天都去跑步。
examples.pinyin: Wèile bǎochí jiànkāng, tā měi tiān dōu qù pǎobù.
examples.en: In order to stay healthy, he goes jogging every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_In_order_to_for_the_purpose_of_20231230_为了保持健康他每天都去跑步.mp3

examples.cn: 为了确保我们不迟到，我们应该提前一个小时出发。
examples.pinyin: Wèile quèbǎo wǒmen bù chídào, wǒmen yīnggāi tíqián yī gè xiǎoshí chūfā.
examples.en: In order to ensure that we are not late, we should set off an hour in advance.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_In_order_to_for_the_purpose_of_20231230_为了确保我们不迟到我们应该提前一个小时出发.mp3

examples.cn: 他为了学好中文，每天都在听、说、读、写。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèile xué hǎo Zhōngwén, měi tiān dōu zài tīng, shuō, dú, xiě.
examples.en: In order to learn Chinese well, he is listening, speaking, reading and writing every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_In_order_to_for_the_purpose_of_20231230_他为了学好中文每天都在听说读写.mp3

examples.cn: 我为了见到你，提前一个小时来到这里。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ wèile jiàn dào nǐ, tíqián yī gè xiǎoshí lái dào zhèlǐ.
examples.en: In order to see you, I came here an hour early.

title: 似的 (shìde) - Seems like, as if
short_explanation: Used to express that one thing is similar to or resembles another thing.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '似的 (shìde)' is employed to express similarity or resemblance between two things or situations. It is similar to 'seems like' or 'as if' in English, used for creating an analogy or metaphor. It is used between two components, the first being the reference and the second being what it is compared to.

examples.cn: 他笑起来像个孩子似的无忧无虑。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiào qǐlái xiàng gè háizi shì de wú yōu wú lǜ.
examples.en: When he laughs, he's carefree like a child.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_似的_shìde_-_Seems_like_as_if_20231230_他笑起来像个孩子似的无忧无虑.mp3

examples.cn: 他用力地跑，好像有什么东西在追他似的。
examples.pinyin: Tā yònglì de pǎo, hǎoxiàng yǒu shénme dōngxi zài zhuī tā shì de.
examples.en: He ran hard, as if something was chasing him.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_似的_shìde_-_Seems_like_as_if_20231230_他用力地跑好像有什么东西在追他似的.mp3

examples.cn: 她看着我，好像我是个陌生人似的。
examples.pinyin: Tā kàn zhe wǒ, hǎoxiàng wǒ shì gè mòshēng rén shì de.
examples.en: She looked at me as if I were a stranger.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_似的_shìde_-_Seems_like_as_if_20231230_她看着我好像我是个陌生人似的.mp3

examples.cn: 他学习中文，就像鱼儿得水似的，非常开心。
examples.pinyin: Tā xuéxí Zhōngwén, jiù xiàng yú er dé shuǐ shì de, fēicháng kāixīn.
examples.en: He is studying Chinese, and he's as happy as a fish in water.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_似的_shìde_-_Seems_like_as_if_20231230_他学习中文就像鱼儿得水似的非常开心.mp3

title: 甚至于 (shènzhìyú) - Even to the extent that
short_explanation: Used to express 'even to the extent that' or 'even to the point where', indicating a situation has reached an extreme degree.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '甚至于 (shènzhìyú)' is often used when you want to emphasize that a certain situation has reached a surprising or unexpected level or extent. The phrase is used to describe something that's not only true, but also to a surprising degree — much like the use of 'even to the extent that' or 'even to the point where' in English.
formation: Topic + Description + 甚至于 + Extreme Situation/Result

examples.cn: 他为了完成这个项目，甚至于夜夜不睡觉。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèile wánchéng zhège xiàngmù, shènzhìyú yèyè bù shuìjiào.
examples.en: In order to complete this project, he even went to the extent of not sleeping night after night.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_甚至于_shènzhìyú_-_Even_to_the_extent_that_20231230_他为了完成这个项目甚至于夜夜不睡觉.mp3

examples.cn: 他太喜欢吃甜食，甚至于把所有的零食都换成了巧克力。
examples.pinyin: Tā tài xǐhuān chī tiánshí, shènzhìyú bǎ suǒyǒu de língshí dōu huànchéng le qiǎokèlì.
examples.en: He likes sweet food so much that he even changed all his snacks to chocolate.

examples.cn: 她为了得到那份工作甚至于放弃了自己的毕业旅行。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèile dédào nà fèn gōngzuò shènzhìyú fàngqì le zìjǐ de bìyè lǚxíng.
examples.en: In order to get that job, she even gave up her graduation trip.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_甚至于_shènzhìyú_-_Even_to_the_extent_that_20231230_她为了得到那份工作甚至于放弃了自己的毕业旅行.mp3

examples.cn: 他追求健康生活，甚至于把所有肉类食品都换成了蔬菜。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhuīqiú jiànkāng shēnghuó, shènzhìyú bǎ suǒyǒu ròulèi shípǐn dōu huànchéng le shūcài.
examples.en: He pursues a healthy lifestyle, even to the extent that he has replaced all meat products with vegetables.

title: 除...之外 (chú...zhīwài) - Apart from, besides
short_explanation: Used to express 'apart from' or 'besides' in English.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '除...之外 (chú...zhīwài)' is used to denote the meaning of 'apart from' or 'besides' in English. It is a way of excluding something or someone from a certain group or range and is often followed by '都' or '也' to emphasize inclusiveness of the remaining part.
formation: 除 + Specific Thing + 之外， + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 除我之外，我们班上的其他学生都会说中文。
examples.pinyin: Chú wǒ zhīwài, wǒmen bān shàng de qítā xuéshēng dōu huì shuō Zhōngwén.
examples.en: Apart from me, all other students in our class can speak Chinese.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除之外_chúzhīwài_-_Apart_from_besides_20231230_除我之外我们班上的其他学生都会说中文.mp3

examples.cn: 除了这本书之外，我还买了一本词典和一本杂志。
examples.pinyin: Chúle zhè běn shū zhīwài, wǒ hái mǎile yī běn cídiǎn hé yī běn zázhì.
examples.en: Besides this book, I also bought a dictionary and a magazine.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除之外_chúzhīwài_-_Apart_from_besides_20231230_除了这本书之外我还买了一本词典和一本杂志.mp3

examples.cn: 他除了会说英语之外，还会说法语和西班牙语。
examples.pinyin: Tā chúle huì shuō Yīngyǔ zhīwài, hái huì shuō Fǎyǔ hé Xībānyáyǔ.
examples.en: Apart from English, he can also speak French and Spanish.

examples.cn: 除冰激凌之外，我也喜欢吃巧克力。
examples.pinyin: Chú bīngjīlíng zhīwài, wǒ yě xǐhuān chī qiǎokèlì.
examples.en: Besides ice cream, I also like to eat chocolate.

title: 反正 (fǎnzhèng) - Anyway, anyhow
short_explanation: Used to express the speaker's indifference or to suggest inevitability regardless of the circumstances.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '反正 (fǎnzhèng)' is used to convey a sense of indifference, suggesting that despite the circumstances, the result or conclusion remains the same. It is equivalent to 'anyway' or 'anyhow' in English. This word is commonly used when the speaker wants to express that the outcome doesn't matter or is inevitable, regardless of what happens.

examples.cn: 你现在就走吧，反正你明天还要回来。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xiànzài jiù zǒu ba, fǎnzhèng nǐ míngtiān hái yào huílái.
examples.en: You might as well leave now since you have to come back anyway tomorrow.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反正_fǎnzhèng_-_Anyway_anyhow_20231230_你现在就走吧反正你明天还要回来.mp3

examples.cn: 我今天没时间去游泳，但是反正我明天有空。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jīntiān méi shíjiān qù yóuyǒng, dànshì fǎnzhèng wǒ míngtiān yǒu kòng.
examples.en: I don't have time to swim today, but I'll have time anyway tomorrow.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反正_fǎnzhèng_-_Anyway_anyhow_20231230_我今天没时间去游泳但是反正我明天有空.mp3

examples.cn: 我不想去公园玩，反正它今天估计会下雨。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bùxiǎng qù gōngyuán wán, fǎnzhèng tā jīntiān gūjì huì xiàyǔ.
examples.en: I don't want to go to the park, because it's likely going to rain anyway today.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反正_fǎnzhèng_-_Anyway_anyhow_20231230_我不想去公园玩反正它今天估计会下雨.mp3

examples.cn: 不用担心考试，反正你已经准备得很好。
examples.pinyin: Bùyòng dānxīn kǎoshì, fǎnzhèng nǐ yǐjīng zhǔnbèi dé hěn hǎo.
examples.en: Don't worry about the exam, you've prepared well anyway.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反正_fǎnzhèng_-_Anyway_anyhow_20231230_不用担心考试反正你已经准备得很好.mp3

title: 总是 (zǒngshì) - Always
short_explanation: Used to express a continuous or usual action or state.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '总是 (zǒngshì)' is used to indicate an action or state that is continuous or occurs on a regular basis. It is equivalent to 'always' in English. It is often used to describe habitual actions or repeated occurrences. A negative variant of this term is '不总是', which can be translated to 'not always'.
formation: Subject + 总是 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我妈妈总是早早地起床准备早餐。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ māmā zǒngshì zǎo zǎo de qǐchuáng zhǔnbèi zǎocān.
examples.en: My mom always wakes up early to prepare breakfast.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_总是_zǒngshì_-_Always_20231230_我妈妈总是早早地起床准备早餐.mp3

examples.cn: 他总是忘记带钥匙，这很让人烦恼。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒngshì wàngjì dài yàoshi, zhè hěn ràng rén fánnǎo.
examples.en: He always forgets to bring his keys, this is very annoying.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_总是_zǒngshì_-_Always_20231230_他总是忘记带钥匙这很让人烦恼.mp3

examples.cn: 我总是在考试前一晚才开始复习，这个习惯需要改变。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǒngshì zài kǎoshì qián yī wǎn cái kāishǐ fùxí, zhège xíguàn xūyào gǎibiàn.
examples.en: I always only start to revise the night before an exam, this habit needs to change.

examples.cn: 为什么你们总是在我学习的时候制造噪音？
examples.pinyin: Wèishénme nǐmen zǒngshì zài wǒ xuéxí de shíhòu zhìzào zàoyīn?

title: 曾经 (céngjīng) - Once, previously
short_explanation: Used to express that something has happened in the past.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '曾经 (céngjīng)' is used to denote an action or situation that occurred in the past, corresponding to the English words 'once' or 'previously'. It is typically used with simple past tense verbs to indicate that the action is not occurring now. This word conveys a sense of nostalgia or recollection of past experiences.
formation: Subject + 曾经 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我曾经在北京住了五年。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ céngjīng zài Běijīng zhùle wǔ nián.
examples.en: I once lived in Beijing for five years.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_曾经_céngjīng_-_Once_previously_20231230_我曾经在北京住了五年.mp3

examples.cn: 他曾经是一位出色的运动员。
examples.pinyin: Tā céngjīng shì yī wèi chūsè de yùndòngyuán.
examples.en: He was once an outstanding athlete.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_曾经_céngjīng_-_Once_previously_20231230_他曾经是一位出色的运动员.mp3

examples.cn: 我们曾经一起去过长城。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen céngjīng yīqǐ qùguò Chángchéng.
examples.en: We once went to the Great Wall together.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_曾经_céngjīng_-_Once_previously_20231230_我们曾经一起去过长城.mp3

examples.cn: 你曾经吃过四川菜吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ céngjīng chīguò Sìchuān cài ma?
examples.en: Have you ever eaten Sichuan cuisine?

title: 好像 (hǎoxiàng) - Seem, be like
short_explanation: Used to express 'seems like', 'as if' or 'looks like'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '好像 (hǎoxiàng)' is used to describe a perceived similarity or apparent comparison between two things, actions or situations. It can translate as 'like', 'as if', 'it seems' or 'appears' in English. This term is used to describe a sense of something based on observations, speculations, or impression.
formation: Subject + 好像 + Rest of the sentence.

examples.cn: 你好像很喜欢那本书，是吗？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ hǎoxiàng hěn xǐhuān nà běn shū, shì ma?
examples.en: You seem to like that book a lot, don't you?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_好像_hǎoxiàng_-_Seem_be_like_20231230_你好像很喜欢那本书是吗.mp3

examples.cn: 他好像生病了，看起来状态不好。
examples.pinyin: Tā hǎoxiàng shēngbìng le, kàn qǐlai zhuàngtài bù hǎo.
examples.en: He seems to be ill, he doesn't look well.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_好像_hǎoxiàng_-_Seem_be_like_20231230_他好像生病了看起来状态不好.mp3

examples.cn: 外面好像要下雨，我们最好带伞出门。
examples.pinyin: Wàimiàn hǎoxiàng yào xià yǔ, wǒmen zuì hǎo dài sǎn chūmén.
examples.en: It looks like it's going to rain outside, we'd better bring an umbrella.

examples.cn: 我好像已经见过你，在哪儿我记不得了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hǎoxiàng yǐjīng jiàn guò nǐ, zài nǎ'er wǒ jì bùdé le.
examples.en: I seem to have seen you before, but I can't remember where.

title: 实际上 (shíjìshàng) - In fact, actually
short_explanation: This is used to indicate the real or true state of something, often revealing new or surprising information.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '实际上 (shíjìshàng)' is used to reveal the real, actual or true state or situation of something. It frequently introduces new information or a surprising fact that contrasts with what has previously been stated or believed. In English, it is similar in function to phrases like 'in fact,' 'actually,' or 'as a matter of fact.'

examples.cn: 他看起来很严肃，但实际上他有很好的幽默感。
examples.pinyin: Tā kànqǐlái hěn yánsù, dàn shíjìshàng tā yǒu hěn hǎo de yōumògǎn.
examples.en: He looks very serious, but in fact, he has a great sense of humor.

examples.cn: 这个问题看似简单，实际上却相当复杂。
examples.pinyin: Zhège wèntí kànshì jiǎndān, shíjìshàng què xiāngdāng fùzá.
examples.en: This problem seems simple, but in fact it's quite complex.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_实际上_shíjìshàng_-_In_fact_actually_20231230_这个问题看似简单实际上却相当复杂.mp3

examples.cn: 他们表面上看起来过得很幸福，实际上他们的婚姻并不和谐。

examples.en: They seem to be happy on the surface, but in fact their marriage is not harmonious.

examples.cn: 虽然我实际上可以自己动手做，但是我宁愿请个专业人士来处理。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán wǒ shíjìshàng kěyǐ zìjǐ dòngshǒu zuò, dànshì wǒ nìngyuàn qǐng gè zhuānyè rénshì lái chǔlǐ.
examples.en: Although I could actually do it myself, I would rather hire a professional to handle it.

title: 假如 (jiǎrú) - If, suppose
short_explanation: Used to propose a hypothetical situation or condition.
long_explanation: The expression '假如 (jiǎrú)' in Mandarin Chinese is used when you want to propose a hypothetical scenario, akin to saying 'if' or 'suppose' in English. It is used to describe a situation or condition that hasn't occurred but could, and the result that would follow if it does.

examples.cn: 假如你有一千万美元，你会怎么做？
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú nǐ yǒu yī qiān wàn měiyuán, nǐ huì zěnme zuò?
examples.en: If you had ten million dollars, what would you do?

examples.cn: 假如我明天有空，我能帮你学习汉语。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú wǒ míngtiān yǒu kòng, wǒ néng bāng nǐ xuéxí hànyǔ.
examples.en: If I have free time tomorrow, I can help you study Chinese.
