examples.cn: 假如我是你，我不会在那个公司工作。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú wǒ shì nǐ, wǒ bù huì zài nàgè gōngsī gōngzuò.
examples.en: If I were you, I would not work at that company.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假如_jiǎrú_-_If_suppose_20231230_假如我是你我不会在那个公司工作.mp3

examples.cn: 假如我有一辆汽车，我会驾驶去北京。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎrú wǒ yǒu yī liàng qìchē, wǒ huì jiàshǐ qù běijīng.
examples.en: If I had a car, I would drive to Beijing.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_假如_jiǎrú_-_If_suppose_20231230_假如我有一辆汽车我会驾驶去北京.mp3

title: 再说 (zàishuō) - Moreover, besides
short_explanation: Used to introduce additional point or reason.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '再说 (zàishuō)' is used to introduce an additional point or reason to a previous statement. It is equivalent to 'moreover,' 'besides,' or 'furthermore,' in English. This phrase is often used to add more weight to an argument or to put forward a secondary reason.

examples.cn: 我今天无法去购物，我有太多的工作要完成，再说，我也没有太多的钱。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jīntiān wúfǎ qù gòuwù, wǒ yǒu tài duō de gōngzuò yào wánchéng, zàishuō, wǒ yě méiyǒu tài duō de qián.
examples.en: I can't go shopping today, I have too much work to do, moreover, I don't have a lot of money.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_再说_zàishuō_-_Moreover_besides_20231230_我今天无法去购物我有太多的工作要完成再说我也没有太多的钱.mp3

examples.cn: 我们应该早点开始修这座桥，它已经有些老旧了，再说，这座桥对该城市的交通起着重要作用。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yīnggāi zǎo diǎn kāishǐ xiū zhè zuò qiáo, tā yǐjīng yǒuxiē lǎojiù le, zàishuō, zhè zuò qiáo duì gāi chéngshì de jiāotōng qǐzhe zhòngyào zuòyòng.
examples.en: We should start repairing this bridge sooner, it's getting old, besides, this bridge plays a vital role in the city's transportation.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_再说_zàishuō_-_Moreover_besides_20231230_我们应该早点开始修这座桥它已经有些老旧了再说这座桥对该城市的交通起着重要作用.mp3

examples.cn: 我不太喜欢看恐怖片，这些电影都太过暴力，再说，我也不喜欢被吓到。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù tài xǐhuān kàn kǒngbù piān, zhèxiē diànyǐng dōu tài guò bàolì, zàishuō, wǒ yě bù xǐhuān bèi xià dào.
examples.en: I don't really like watching horror movies, they're too violent, moreover, I don't like being scared.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_再说_zàishuō_-_Moreover_besides_20231230_我不太喜欢看恐怖片这些电影都太过暴力再说我也不喜欢被吓到.mp3

examples.cn: 我们不能只关注她的学习成绩，她的健康和幸福也很重要，再说，只有一个健康的身体才能有一个健康的心智。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bùnéng zhǐ guānzhù tā de xuéxí chéngjī, tā de jiànkāng hé xìngfú yě hěn zhòngyào, zàishuō, zhǐyǒu yīgè jiànkāng de shēntǐ cáinéng yǒu yīgè jiànkāng de xīnzhì.
examples.en: We can't just focus on her academic performance, her health and happiness are also important, furthermore, a healthy body makes a healthy mind.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_再说_zàishuō_-_Moreover_besides_20231230_我们不能只关注她的学习成绩她的健康和幸福也很重要再说只有一个健康的身体才能有一个健康的心智.mp3

title: 不过 (búguò) - However, but
short_explanation: Used to express contrast or introduce a concession.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '不过 (búguò)' is similar to the conjunctions 'however' or 'but' in English. It is used to connect contrasting ideas or statements, often to introduce a circumstance that might alter the perspective of the previous statement. It's often placed at the beginning of the second clause.

examples.cn: 他一直想去看电影，不过今天他很忙，没有时间。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīzhí xiǎng qù kàn diànyǐng, búguò jīntiān tā hěn máng, méiyǒu shíjiān.
examples.en: He always wants to go to the cinema, however, he is very busy today and doesn't have time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不过_búguò_-_However_but_20231230_他一直想去看电影不过今天他很忙没有时间.mp3

examples.cn: 我喜欢这款手机，不过价格有点贵。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān zhè kuǎn shǒujī, búguò jiàgé yǒudiǎn guì.
examples.en: I like this mobile phone, however, it's a bit expensive.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不过_búguò_-_However_but_20231230_我喜欢这款手机不过价格有点贵.mp3

examples.cn: 我知道他很聪明，不过他需要更努力地学习。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhīdào tā hěn cōngmíng, búguò tā xūyào gèng nǔlì de xuéxí.
examples.en: I know he is very intelligent, however, he needs to study harder.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不过_búguò_-_However_but_20231230_我知道他很聪明不过他需要更努力地学习.mp3

examples.cn: 这个馒头很好吃，不过有点儿太甜了。
examples.pinyin: Zhège màntou hěn hào chī, búguò yǒudiǎn er tài tián le.
examples.en: This bun is very delicious, but it's a bit too sweet.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不过_búguò_-_However_but_20231230_这个馒头很好吃不过有点儿太甜了.mp3

title: 而且 (érqiě) - Furthermore, and
short_explanation: Used to add more information or details to an initial statement.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese conjunction '而且 (érqiě)' is used to present additional information or details to a point that has already been made. It is the equivalent of saying 'furthermore', 'also', 'and' or 'moreover' in English. Using '而且' helps to add depth, complexity, and completeness to narratives or arguments.

examples.cn: 他是我最好的朋友，而且我们从小就一起玩。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì wǒ zuì hǎo de péngyǒu, érqiě wǒmen cóng xiǎo jiù yīqǐ wán.
examples.en: He is my best friend, and furthermore, we have been playing together since we were kids.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_而且_érqiě_-_Furthermore_and_20231230_他是我最好的朋友而且我们从小就一起玩.mp3

examples.cn: 这部电影很有趣，而且演员的表演非常出色。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng hěn yǒuqù, érqiě yǎnyuán de biǎoyǎn fēicháng chūsè.
examples.en: This movie is very interesting, and furthermore, the actors' performances are excellent.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_而且_érqiě_-_Furthermore_and_20231230_这部电影很有趣而且演员的表演非常出色.mp3

examples.cn: 我喜欢看书，而且我有一个很大的书架。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān kànshū, érqiě wǒ yǒu yīgè hěn dà de shūjià.
examples.en: I like reading books, and furthermore, I have a very large bookshelf.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_而且_érqiě_-_Furthermore_and_20231230_我喜欢看书而且我有一个很大的书架.mp3

examples.cn: 汉语是一种世界性的语言，而且汉字非常美。
examples.pinyin: Hànyǔ shì yī zhǒng shìjiè xìng de yǔyán, érqiě Hànzì fēicháng měi.
examples.en: Chinese is a global language, and furthermore, Chinese characters are very beautiful.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_而且_érqiě_-_Furthermore_and_20231230_汉语是一种世界性的语言而且汉字非常美.mp3

title: 好在 (hǎozài) - Fortunately, Luckily
short_explanation: Used to express relief or fortunate circumstances following a difficult or unfavorable situation.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '好在 (hǎozài)' is often used to express relief or point out a silver lining in a situation that was previously seen as unfavorable or problematic. It can be translated as 'fortunately' or 'luckily' in English, signifying that the speaker is grateful for a certain circumstance that helped alleviate the difficulty of the situation.
formation: 好在 + Positive Outcome or Helpful Circumstance

examples.cn: 好在我带了雨伞，所以并没有淋湿。
examples.pinyin: Hǎozài wǒ dài le yǔsǎn, suǒyǐ bìng méiyǒu lín shī.
examples.en: Fortunately, I brought an umbrella, so I didn't get wet.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_好在_hǎozài_-_Fortunately_Luckily_20231230_好在我带了雨伞所以并没有淋湿.mp3

examples.cn: 计划原本出了点问题，好在我们及时发现并作出了适当的调整。
examples.pinyin: Jìhuà yuánběn chū le diǎn wèntí, hǎozài wǒmen jíshí fāxiàn bìng zuòchū le shìdàng de tiáozhěng.
examples.en: There was initially a problem with the plan, but luckily, we discovered it in time and made appropriate adjustments.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_好在_hǎozài_-_Fortunately_Luckily_20231230_计划原本出了点问题好在我们及时发现并作出了适当的调整.mp3

examples.cn: 好在车票还没卖完，我们刚好可以赶上最后一班车。
examples.pinyin: Hǎozài chēpiào hái méi mài wán, wǒmen gānghǎo kěyǐ gǎnshàng zuìhòu yī bān chē.
examples.en: Fortunately, the tickets were not sold out, and we were just in time to catch the last bus.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_好在_hǎozài_-_Fortunately_Luckily_20231230_好在车票还没卖完我们刚好可以赶上最后一班车.mp3

examples.cn: 我忘记带钱包了，好在我妈妈愿意借我一些钱。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ wàngjì dài qiánbāo le, hǎozài wǒ māmā yuànyì jiè wǒ yīxiē qián.
examples.en: I forgot my wallet, but luckily, my mum is willing to lend me some money.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_好在_hǎozài_-_Fortunately_Luckily_20231230_我忘记带钱包了好在我妈妈愿意借我一些钱.mp3

title: 哪怕 (nǎpà) - Even if
short_explanation: Used to express 'even if' or 'even though' and present a hypothetical condition.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '哪怕 (nǎpà)' is used to express 'even if' or 'even though', indicating a hypothetical condition. It usually precedes a condition or event that has a low likelihood of occurring but introduces a more intense or extreme scenario. When you want to stress that no matter what happens or under any circumstances, specific actions or results will not change, you can use '哪怕'.

examples.cn: 哪怕下大雨，我也会去参加他的生日派对。
examples.pinyin: Nǎpà xià dàyǔ, wǒ yě huì qù cānjiā tā de shēngrì pàiduì.
examples.en: Even if it's pouring rain, I will still go to his birthday party.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_哪怕_nǎpà_-_Even_if_20231230_哪怕下大雨我也会去参加他的生日派对.mp3

examples.cn: 哪怕你忙碌，也要注意身体健康。
examples.pinyin: Nǎpà nǐ mánglù, yě yàozhù shēntǐ jiànkāng.
examples.en: Even if you're busy, you should still pay attention to your health.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_哪怕_nǎpà_-_Even_if_20231230_哪怕你忙碌也要注意身体健康.mp3

examples.cn: 哪怕她对我态度不好，我仍然尊重她。
examples.pinyin: Nǎpà tā duì wǒ tàidu bù hǎo, wǒ réngrán zūnzhòng tā.
examples.en: Even if she has a bad attitude toward me, I still respect her.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_哪怕_nǎpà_-_Even_if_20231230_哪怕她对我态度不好我仍然尊重她.mp3

examples.cn: 哪怕考试很难，我也不会放弃学习。
examples.pinyin: Nǎpà kǎoshì hěn nán, wǒ yě bú huì fàngqì xuéxí.
examples.en: Even if the test is very difficult, I won't give up studying.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_哪怕_nǎpà_-_Even_if_20231230_哪怕考试很难我也不会放弃学习.mp3

title: 何况 (hékuàng) - Let alone, moreover
short_explanation: Used to further emphasize a point or introduce an even stronger argument.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '何况 (hékuàng)' is a conjunction used to stress a point or proposition by introducing a stronger, more compelling argument, comparison, or condition. It is equivalent to 'let alone' or 'not to mention' in English. This phrase often follows a statement and precedes a more potent point to reinforce the initial statement.

examples.cn: 我连日常对话都说不好，何况在公众面前发表演讲。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ lián rìcháng duìhuà dōu shuō bù hǎo, hékuàng zài gōngzhòng miànqián fābiǎo yǎnjiǎng.
examples.en: I can't even speak well in daily conversations, let alone give a public speech.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_moreover_20231230_我连日常对话都说不好何况在公众面前发表演讲.mp3

examples.cn: 这道菜我都做不出来，何况他自称厨艺一般的他。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào cài wǒ dōu zuò bù chūlái, hékuàng tā zì chēng chúyì yībān de tā.
examples.en: I can't even cook this dish, not to mention him who claims his cooking skills are so-so.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_moreover_20231230_这道菜我都做不出来何况他自称厨艺一般的他.mp3

examples.cn: 小李的普通话水平比我好得多，何况是他的母语，他从小说到大。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo Lǐ de pǔtōnghuà shuǐpíng bǐ wǒ hǎo de duō, hékuàng shì tā de mǔyǔ, tā cóng xiǎo shuō dào dà.
examples.en: Xiao Li's Mandarin level is much better than mine, not to mention it's his mother tongue, which he has been speaking since he was a child.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_moreover_20231230_小李的普通话水平比我好得多何况是他的母语他从小说到大.mp3

examples.cn: 这种运动我都不能完成，何况已经疲惫不堪的你。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng yùndòng wǒ dōu bù néng wánchéng, hékuàng yǐjīng píbèi bùkān de nǐ.
examples.en: I can't even complete this sport, let alone you who are already exhausted.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékuàng_-_Let_alone_moreover_20231230_这种运动我都不能完成何况已经疲惫不堪的你.mp3

title: 即使 (jíshǐ) - Even if, even though
short_explanation: This is used to present hypothetical situations, illustrating that even if a certain condition holds, the result will remain unchanged.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese conjunctive adverb '即使 (jíshǐ)' is used to present hypothetical or extreme situations and emphasize that even if these conditions are true, the result will not be affected. It is similar in usage to 'even if' or 'even though' in English. The complete expression is usually followed by '也 (yě)' or '都 (dōu)', both meaning 'also' or 'even', which emphasizes the the outcome of the sentence.
formation: 即使 + Statement A, Statement B (可以 / 也 / 都) + Result

examples.cn: 即使我每天练习跑步，我也无法跑得比他快。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ wǒ měitiān liànxí pǎobù, wǒ yě wúfǎ pǎo de bǐ tā kuài.
examples.en: Even if I practice running every day, I still can't run faster than him.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使_jíshǐ_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即使我每天练习跑步我也无法跑得比他快.mp3

examples.cn: 即使他有很多钱，他也选择过简朴的生活。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ tā yǒu hěnduō qián, tā yě xuǎnzé guò jiǎnpǔ de shēnghuó.
examples.en: Even though he has a lot of money, he chooses to live a simple life.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使_jíshǐ_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即使他有很多钱他也选择过简朴的生活.mp3

examples.cn: 即使天气非常糟糕，我们仍然会按时到达。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ tiānqì fēicháng zāogāo, wǒmen réngrán huì ànshí dàodá.
examples.en: Even if the weather is really bad, we will still arrive on time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使_jíshǐ_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即使天气非常糟糕我们仍然会按时到达.mp3

examples.cn: 即使你不喜欢我做的饭，你都应该尝试一下。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ nǐ bù xǐhuān wǒ zuò de fàn, nǐ dōu yīnggāi chángshì yīxià.
examples.en: Even if you don't like the food I cook, you should still try it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使_jíshǐ_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即使你不喜欢我做的饭你都应该尝试一下.mp3

title: 其实 (qíshí) - Actually, in fact
short_explanation: Used to reveal the truth or facts that may be previously unknown or misunderstood.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '其实 (qíshí)' is primarily used to uncover or lay bare truths, realities or facts which were formerly unknown, unclear or misunderstood by one or more persons involved in a conversation. It is similar to the English words 'actually' or 'in fact'. Its usage often indicates a correction, contradiction or a surprising fact.

examples.cn: 我知道你以为我不喜欢爬山，但其实我非常喜欢。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhīdào nǐ yǐwéi wǒ bù xǐhuān páshān, dàn qíshí wǒ fēicháng xǐhuān.
examples.en: I know you think I don't like climbing mountains, but actually, I love it very much.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其实_qíshí_-_Actually_in_fact_20231230_我知道你以为我不喜欢爬山但其实我非常喜欢.mp3

examples.cn: 其实我不是学生，我是一名老师。
examples.pinyin: Qíshí wǒ bùshì xuéshēng, wǒ shì yī míng lǎoshī.
examples.en: Actually, I'm not a student, I'm a teacher.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其实_qíshí_-_Actually_in_fact_20231230_其实我不是学生我是一名老师.mp3

examples.cn: 他们看起来很忙，但其实他们只是做了一些无关紧要的事。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen kàn qǐlái hěn máng, dàn qíshí tāmen zhǐshì zuòle yīxiē wúguānjǐnyào de shì.
examples.en: They seem busy, but in fact, they're just doing some trivial things.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其实_qíshí_-_Actually_in_fact_20231230_他们看起来很忙但其实他们只是做了一些无关紧要的事.mp3

examples.cn: 她表面上看起来很强大，其实内心非常柔软。
examples.pinyin: Tā biǎomiàn shàng kàn qǐlái hěn qiángdà, qíshí nèixīn fēicháng róuruǎn.
examples.en: She looks very strong on the surface, but in fact, she is very soft inside.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其实_qíshí_-_Actually_in_fact_20231230_她表面上看起来很强大其实内心非常柔软.mp3

title: 仍然 (réng rán) - Still, Yet
short_explanation: Used to express continuity or persistence of a state or action.
long_explanation: '仍然 (réng rán)' is a temporal adverb in Mandarin Chinese used to indicate that a situation or state continues to exist or an action continues to happen. It is similar to the English 'still' or 'yet' when talking about a situation that has not changed or an action that is continuing.
formation: Subject + 仍然 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 虽然他已经移居国外多年，但他仍然保持着中国的生活习惯。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán tā yǐjīng yíjū guówài duōnián, dàn tā réng rán bǎochí zhe Zhōngguó de shēnghuó xíguàn.
examples.en: Although he has been living abroad for many years, he still maintains Chinese lifestyle habits.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_仍然_réng_rán_-_Still_Yet_20231230_虽然他已经移居国外多年但他仍然保持着中国的生活习惯.mp3

examples.cn: 我们虽然失去了比赛，但是我们仍然相信我们可以赢得下次比赛。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen suīrán shīqùle bǐsài, dànshì wǒmen réng rán xiāngxìn wǒmen kěyǐ yíngdé xià cì bǐsài.
examples.en: Although we lost the match, we still believe that we can win the next one.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_仍然_réng_rán_-_Still_Yet_20231230_我们虽然失去了比赛但是我们仍然相信我们可以赢得下次比赛.mp3

examples.cn: 她仍然记得他们第一次在公园相遇的情景。
examples.pinyin: Tā réng rán jìdé tāmen dì yī cì zài gōngyuán xiāngyù de qíngjǐng.
examples.en: She still remembers the scene of their first meeting in the park.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_仍然_réng_rán_-_Still_Yet_20231230_她仍然记得他们第一次在公园相遇的情景.mp3

examples.cn: 即使外面正在下大雨，小明仍然决定去参加足球训练。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ wàimiàn zhèngzài xià dàyǔ, Xiǎomíng réng rán juédìng qù cānjiā zúqiú xùnliàn.
examples.en: Even though it's raining heavily outside, Xiao Ming still decided to go to football training.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_仍然_réng_rán_-_Still_Yet_20231230_即使外面正在下大雨小明仍然决定去参加足球训练.mp3

title: 并且 (bìngqiě) - And, furthermore, moreover
short_explanation: Used to connect two related points or actions, and to introduce an additional point.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '并且 (bìngqiě)' is used to connect and introduce an additional point or action that is related to the previous one. It is equivalent to 'and', 'moreover', or 'furthermore' in English. This phrase helps add extra information or detail to make a statement more comprehensive or to deepen the understanding of a point.

examples.cn: 我会说英语，并且我也可以说一点中文。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ huì shuō Yīngyǔ, bìngqiě wǒ yě kěyǐ shuō yīdiǎn Zhōngwén.
examples.en: I can speak English, and furthermore, I can also speak a little Chinese.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_并且_bìngqiě_-_And_furthermore_moreover_20231230_我会说英语并且我也可以说一点中文.mp3

examples.cn: 他是我最好的朋友，并且他是我最信任的人。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì wǒ zuì hǎo de péngyǒu, bìngqiě tā shì wǒ zuì xìnrèn de rén.
examples.en: He is my best friend, and furthermore, he is the person I trust the most.

formation: Subject + 至少 + Verb + Number + Measure Word + Noun

title: 不然 (bùrán) - Otherwise, or else
short_explanation: It is used to express the consequences if action is not taken.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '不然 (bùrán)' is similar to 'otherwise' or 'or else' in English. It is used when expressing the potential negative or undesired outcome that may occur if a certain action is not performed. This expression gives a sense of urgency or importance to the preceding clause.
formation: Statement + 不然 + Result of Consequence

examples.cn: 你应该尽快完成作业，不然老师会生气的。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yīnggāi jǐnkuài wánchéng zuòyè, bùrán lǎoshī huì shēngqì de.
examples.en: You should finish your homework as soon as possible, otherwise the teacher will be angry.

examples.en: We should set off early, otherwise we might miss the train.

examples.pinyin: Nǐ zuì hǎo dài shàng yǔsǎn, bùrán rúguǒ xià yǔ nǐ huì lín shī de.
examples.en: You'd better bring an umbrella, otherwise if it rains, you'll get wet.

title: 虽说 (suīshuō) - Although, though
short_explanation: Used to express a concession or contrast between two statements.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '虽说 (suīshuō)' is a word used at the beginning of a sentence to express a concession or contrast. It can be translated as 'although', 'though' or 'even though' in English. This word is often used to indicate that while the first statement is true, it does not prevent the second statement from being true as well.

examples.cn: 虽说他的中文不好，但是他总是努力尝试与人交流。
examples.pinyin: Suīshuō tā de Zhōngwén bù hǎo, dànshì tā zǒngshì nǔlì chángshì yǔ rén jiāoliú.
examples.en: Though his Chinese is not good, he always tries hard to communicate with people.

examples.cn: 虽说这个电影很长，我还是看完了整个电影。

examples.en: Although this film is long, I still watched the whole film.

title: 难道 (nándào) - Used rhetorically to express surprise or disbelief
short_explanation: Used rhetorically to express surprise or disbelief when one's assumptions or expectations are not met.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '难道 (nándào)' is a rhetorical tool utilized to communicate surprise or disbelief, particularly when a situation unfolds contrary to one's expectations or assumptions. Its English equivalent can be likened to the phrases 'Could it be that...?' or 'Don't tell me that...'. '难道' is typically used in rhetorical questions and is often used to express a speaker's surprised or strong emotions.

examples.cn: 难道你不知道我是为你好吗？
examples.pinyin: Nándào nǐ bù zhīdào wǒ shì wèi nǐ hǎo ma?
examples.en: Could it be that you don't know I'm doing this for your own good?

examples.cn: 难道你还没完成作业吗？
examples.pinyin: Nándào nǐ hái méi wánchéng zuòyè ma?
examples.en: Don't tell me you still haven't finished your homework?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_难道_nándào_-_Used_rhetorically_to_express_surprise_or_disbelief_20231230_难道你还没完成作业吗.mp3

examples.pinyin: Nándào tā zhēn de qù le Měiguó ma?

title: 反之 (fǎnzhī) - On the contrary
short_explanation: Used to introduce a contrasting idea or situation in Mandarin Chinese.
long_explanation: 反之 (fǎnzhī) is a conjunctive phrase in Mandarin Chinese that is used to put forward a contrasting statement or idea to what has just been said. It is equivalent to 'on the contrary' or 'conversely' in English. It shows the inverse or the opposite situation of the first part of the statement.

examples.cn: 如果你不勤奋学习，你将不能通过这个考试，反之，如果你勤奋学习，你将可以通过这个考试。
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ nǐ bù qínfèn xuéxí, nǐ jiāng bù néng tōngguò zhège kǎoshì, fǎnzhī, rúguǒ nǐ qínfèn xuéxí, nǐ jiāng kěyǐ tōngguò zhège kǎoshì.
examples.en: If you don't study diligently, you will not be able to pass this exam, on the contrary, if you study diligently, you will be able to pass this exam.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反之_fǎnzhī_-_On_the_contrary_20231230_如果你不勤奋学习你将不能通过这个考试反之如果你勤奋学习你将可以通过这个考试.mp3

examples.cn: 如果你总是迟到的话，老师会对你感到不满，反之，如果你总是准时，老师会对你印象深刻。

examples.en: If you are always late, the teacher will be dissatisfied with you; on the contrary, if you are always on time, the teacher will be impressed by you.

examples.cn: 如果你吃的东西很健康，你会感到精力充沛，反之，如果你吃的东西很不健康，你会感到疲劳。

examples.en: If you eat very healthy foods, you will feel energetic, on the contrary, if you eat very unhealthy foods, you will feel tired.

examples.en: If you exercise every day, you will be healthier, on the contrary, if you are lazy and do not exercise, you may get sick.

title: 否则 (fǒuzé) - Otherwise, if not
short_explanation: 否则 is used to show a consequence or result if something is not done.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '否则 (fǒuzé)' signifies a condition or consequence that will happen or might be the case unless something is done or changes. It is equal to saying 'otherwise' or 'if not' in English. This term is generally used to express a conditional situation of 'if not... then...'.

examples.cn: 你要记得带雨伞，否则如果下雨你会淋湿的。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yào jìdé dài yǔsǎn, fǒuzé rúguǒ xià yǔ nǐ huì lín shī de.
examples.en: You must remember to bring an umbrella, otherwise if it rains you will get wet.

examples.cn: 我们需要尽快走，否则我们会错过电影的开始。

examples.en: We need to leave as soon as possible, otherwise we'll miss the start of the movie.

examples.cn: 我们应该现在就订酒店，否则我们可能找不到地方住。

examples.en: We should book the hotel now, otherwise we might not find a place to stay.

title: 或者 (huòzhě) - Or
short_explanation: Used to present alternatives or choices.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese conjunction '或者 (huòzhě)' is used to propose alternative options, ideas, or possibilities within a sentence. It carries the English equivalent of 'or' and can be used in various contexts. It is also used to indicate options in a question and can be found either between elements in a list or between clauses in a sentence.

examples.cn: 你想喝咖啡或者茶？
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xiǎng hē kāfēi huòzhě chá?
examples.en: Do you want to drink coffee or tea?

title: 于是 (yúshì) - Therefore, So
short_explanation: Used to express cause and effect or to indicate the result of something.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '于是 (yúshì)' is a conjunction used to indicate that something happened as a result of something else or to show the consequence of an action. It's equivalent to 'therefore' or 'so' in English. This word is often used to connect two clauses in a cause-effect relation.

examples.cn: 她晚上很晚才回家，于是第二天早上起床晚了。

examples.en: She went home very late at night, so she got up late the next morning.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_于是_yúshì_-_Therefore_So_20231230_她晚上很晚才回家于是第二天早上起床晚了.mp3

examples.en: He didn't bring an umbrella, so he got soaked in the rain.

examples.cn: 她看了看表，于是决定要走了。

title: 偶尔 (ǒu'ěr) - Occasionally
short_explanation: This term is used to describe an event or action that happens occasionally or once in a while.
long_explanation: '偶尔 (ǒu'ěr)' is a time-related adverb in Mandarin Chinese that expresses the occurrence of an event or action once in a while or occasionally. While English expressions like 'sometimes' or 'from time to time' could have multiple meanings depending on context, '偶尔' is more specific, only referring to frequency rather than probability.

examples.cn: 他偶尔会来这里吃饭。

examples.en: She occasionally reads one or two books over the weekend.

title: 尤其 (yóuqí) - Especially, particularly
short_explanation: Used to emphasize the degree or extent of a particular action or situation.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese adverb '尤其 (yóuqí)' is used to highlight a particular thing or aspect, making it stand out among others. It has a similar meaning to 'especially' or 'particularly' in English. It can be used to emphasize an action, an aspect of something, a time, a place, or even a person.

examples.cn: 我喜欢吃各种不同的水果，尤其是苹果。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān chī gèzhǒng bùtóng de shuǐguǒ, yóuqí shì píngguǒ.
examples.en: I like to eat all kinds of different fruits, especially apples.

examples.cn: 旅游时，我尤其喜欢探索当地的文化和历史。
examples.pinyin: Lǚyóu shí, wǒ yóuqí xǐhuān tànsuǒ dāngdì de wénhuà hé lìshǐ.
examples.en: When travelling, I particularly like to explore the local culture and history.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尤其_yóuqí_-_Especially_particularly_20231230_旅游时我尤其喜欢探索当地的文化和历史.mp3

examples.cn: 他对所有的科目都很在行，尤其是数学。
examples.pinyin: Tā duì suǒyǒu de kēmù dū hěn zàixíng, yóuqí shì shùxué.
examples.en: He is good at all subjects, especially mathematics.

examples.cn: 我喜欢听音乐，尤其在下雨的时候。

title: 当然 (dāngrán) - Of course
short_explanation: This is used to express agreement or that something is expected.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '当然 (dāngrán)' is used to indicate that something is obvious, natural, or to be expected. It's used when responding affirmatively to a statement or question and can be translated as 'of course', 'naturally', or 'surely'. You might use it when you want to emphasize the certainty or inevitability of the situation at hand.
formation: Subject + 当然 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 你喜欢旅游吗？当然，我非常喜欢。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xǐhuān lǚyóu ma? Dāngrán, wǒ fēicháng xǐhuān.
examples.en: Do you like traveling? Of course, I love it very much.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_当然_dāngrán_-_Of_course_20231230_你喜欢旅游吗当然我非常喜欢.mp3

examples.cn: 你可以帮我做晚饭吗？当然可以，我很愿意帮你。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kěyǐ bāng wǒ zuò wǎnfàn ma? Dāngrán kěyǐ, wǒ hěn yuànyì bāng nǐ.
examples.en: Can you help me make dinner? Of course, I am very willing to help you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_当然_dāngrán_-_Of_course_20231230_你可以帮我做晚饭吗当然可以我很愿意帮你.mp3

examples.cn: 你会去参加他们的婚礼吗？当然会，他们是我最好的朋友。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ huì qù cānjiā tāmen de hūnlǐ ma? Dāngrán huì, tāmen shì wǒ zuì hǎo de péngyǒu.
examples.en: Are you going to attend their wedding? Of course, they are my best friends.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_当然_dāngrán_-_Of_course_20231230_你会去参加他们的婚礼吗当然会他们是我最好的朋友.mp3

examples.cn: 你可以帮我修理这台电脑吗？当然，我是个电脑专家。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kěyǐ bāng wǒ xiūlǐ zhè tái diànnǎo ma? Dāngrán, wǒ shì gè diànnǎo zhuānjiā.
examples.en: Can you help me fix this computer? Of course, I am a computer expert.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_当然_dāngrán_-_Of_course_20231230_你可以帮我修理这台电脑吗当然我是个电脑专家.mp3

title: 既然 (jìrán) - Since/Now that
short_explanation: Used to introduce a presupposition or premise and infer a conclusion from that premise.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '既然 (jìrán)' denotes 'since' or 'now that' in English and is used to infer a certain conclusion based on a given premise. This connector word combines two facts or pieces of information, where the first fact (A) is an existing situation, and the second fact (B) is a result or conclusion drawn from the first fact.
formation: 既然 + Fact A (existing situation), (then/so) + Fact B (consequence or conclusion)

examples.cn: 既然你已经决定了，那我只好支持你。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán nǐ yǐjīng juédìngle, nà wǒ zhǐhǎo zhīchí nǐ.
examples.en: Since you've already decided, then I have no choice but to support you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since/Now_that_20231230_既然你已经决定了那我只好支持你.mp3

examples.cn: 既然他们都赞同这个计划，我们就开始吧。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán tāmen dōu zàntóng zhège jìhuà, wǒmen jiù kāishǐ ba.
examples.en: Now that they all agree with this plan, let's start.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since/Now_that_20231230_既然他们都赞同这个计划我们就开始吧.mp3

examples.cn: 既然今天天气这么好，我们为什么不去公园呢？
examples.pinyin: Jìrán jīntiān tiānqì zhème hǎo, wǒmen wèishénme bù qù gōngyuán ne?
examples.en: Since the weather is so nice today, why don't we go to the park?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since/Now_that_20231230_既然今天天气这么好我们为什么不去公园呢.mp3

examples.cn: 既然你不喜欢吃鱼，我就做牛肉给你吃。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán nǐ bù xǐhuān chī yú, wǒ jiù zuò niúròu gěi nǐ chī.
examples.en: Since you don't like eating fish, I’ll make beef for you to eat.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既然_jìrán_-_Since/Now_that_20231230_既然你不喜欢吃鱼我就做牛肉给你吃.mp3

title: 正如 (zhèngrú) - Just as, as
short_explanation: Used to indicate a comparison or likeness between two actions or states.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '正如 (zhèngrú)' is used to show a comparison or likeness between two actions or states. It's roughly equivalent to 'just as' or 'as' in English. This expression is typically used to make an analogy or a direct comparison, often explaining one thing in terms of another which may be more familiar or easier to understand.

examples.cn: 正如你在游戏中不断学习和进步，你也可以在现实生活中做到这一点。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú nǐ zài yóuxì zhōng bùduàn xuéxí hé jìnbù, nǐ yě kěyǐ zài xiànshí shēnghuó zhōng zuò dào zhè yīdiǎn.
examples.en: Just as you continually learn and improve in a game, you can do the same in real life.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_as_20231230_正如你在游戏中不断学习和进步你也可以在现实生活中做到这一点.mp3

examples.cn: 正如我们照顾自己的身体一样，我们也要照顾我们的心灵。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú wǒmen zhàogù zìjǐ de shēntǐ yīyàng, wǒmen yě yào zhàogù wǒmen de xīnlíng.
examples.en: Just as we take care of our physical bodies, we should also take care of our minds.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_as_20231230_正如我们照顾自己的身体一样我们也要照顾我们的心灵.mp3

examples.cn: 正如花需要阳光和水分一样，人也需要爱和关怀。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú huā xūyào yángguāng hé shuǐfèn yīyàng, rén yě xūyào ài hé guānhuái.
examples.en: Just as a flower needs sunlight and water, people also need love and care.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_as_20231230_正如花需要阳光和水分一样人也需要爱和关怀.mp3

examples.cn: 正如星星点亮夜空一样，你的支持点亮了我的人生。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngrú xīngxīng diǎnliàng yèkōng yīyàng, nǐ de zhīchí diǎnliàng le wǒ de rénshēng.
examples.en: Just as the stars light up the night sky, your support lights up my life.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正如_zhèngrú_-_Just_as_as_20231230_正如星星点亮夜空一样你的支持点亮了我的人生.mp3

title: 唯一 (wéiyī) - The only, sole
short_explanation: Used to indicate there is only one or it's unique.
long_explanation: The Chinese word '唯一 (wéiyī)' is used to emphasize the singularity or uniqueness of something or someone. In English, it can be translated as 'the only' or 'sole'. It is often used to highlight the fact that there is only one of something, or that a particular object, person, or situation is unique in some way.

examples.cn: 他是他们家唯一的孩子。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì tāmen jiā wéiyī de háizi.
examples.en: He is the only child in their family.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_唯一_wéiyī_-_The_only_sole_20231230_他是他们家唯一的孩子.mp3

examples.cn: 这是我唯一的选择。
examples.pinyin: Zhè shì wǒ wéiyī de xuǎnzé.
examples.en: This is my only choice.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_唯一_wéiyī_-_The_only_sole_20231230_这是我唯一的选择.mp3

examples.cn: 这辆自行车是我唯一的交通工具。
examples.pinyin: Zhè liàng zìxíngchē shì wǒ wéiyī de jiāotōng gōngjù.
examples.en: This bicycle is my only means of transport.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_唯一_wéiyī_-_The_only_sole_20231230_这辆自行车是我唯一的交通工具.mp3

examples.cn: 我唯一的愿望就是你能幸福。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ wéiyī de yuànwàng jiùshì nǐ néng xìngfú.
examples.en: My only wish is for you to be happy.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_唯一_wéiyī_-_The_only_sole_20231230_我唯一的愿望就是你能幸福.mp3

title: 越...越... (yuè...yuè...) - The more... the more...
short_explanation: Used to express that an increase in one quality, condition, or activity results in a simultaneous increase in another.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese grammatical pattern '越...越...' (yuè...yuè...) is used to show that as one situation or condition intensifies, another situation or condition intensifies simultaneously. It is equivalent to saying 'the more... the more...' in English. This phrase helps to link two changes that occur simultaneously and correspond with each other proportionately.
formation: Subj. + 越 + Verb/Adj. + Obj., 越 + Verb/Adj. + Obj.

examples.cn: 我越学汉语，我越喜欢它。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yuè xué Hànyǔ, wǒ yuè xǐhuan tā.
examples.en: The more I study Chinese, the more I like it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_越越_yuèyuè_-_The_more_the_more_20231230_我越学汉语我越喜欢它.mp3

examples.cn: 他越吃巧克力，他越觉得自己胖。
examples.pinyin: Tā yuè chī qiǎokèlì, tā yuè juéde zìjǐ pàng.
examples.en: The more he eats chocolate, the more he thinks he is fat.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_越越_yuèyuè_-_The_more_the_more_20231230_他越吃巧克力他越觉得自己胖.mp3

examples.cn: 时间越紧，她越担心。
examples.pinyin: Shíjiān yuè jǐn, tā yuè dānxīn.
examples.en: The tighter the time, the more she worries.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_越越_yuèyuè_-_The_more_the_more_20231230_时间越紧她越担心.mp3

examples.cn: 孩子们越大，问题越复杂。
examples.pinyin: Hái zi men yuè dà, wèn tí yuè fùzá.
examples.en: The older the children, the more complicated the problems.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_越越_yuèyuè_-_The_more_the_more_20231230_孩子们越大问题越复杂.mp3

title: 不但...而且... (búdàn...érqiě...) - Not only... but also...
short_explanation: This is used to express that not only is one condition true, but so is another.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '不但...而且...' (búdàn...érqiě...) means 'not only... but also...'. It is used to connect two clauses, emphasizing that both are true. The first clause presents a statement, and the second clause further adds to it or intensifies it.
formation: 不但 + Statement 1, 而且 + Statement 2

examples.cn: 他不但会说英语，而且会说法语和西班牙语。
examples.pinyin: Tā búdàn huì shuō Yīngyǔ, érqiě huì shuō Fǎyǔ hé Xībānyáyǔ.
examples.en: Not only does he speak English, but he also speaks French and Spanish.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不但而且_búdànérqiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_他不但会说英语而且会说法语和西班牙语.mp3

examples.cn: 她不但善良，而且非常聪明。
examples.pinyin: Tā búdàn shànliáng, érqiě fēicháng cōngmíng.
examples.en: She is not only kind, but also very intelligent.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不但而且_búdànérqiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_她不但善良而且非常聪明.mp3

examples.cn: 这个游戏不但对孩子们有教育意义，而且也十分有趣.
examples.pinyin: Zhège yóuxì búdàn duì háizimen yǒu jiàoyù yìyì, érqiě yě shífēn yǒuqù.
examples.en: This game is not only educational for children, but also very interesting.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不但而且_búdànérqiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_这个游戏不但对孩子们有教育意义而且也十分有趣.mp3

examples.cn: 我不但去过北京，而且还在那儿工作过。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ búdàn qùguò Běijīng, érqiě hái zài nà'er gōngzuòguò.
examples.en: Not only have I been to Beijing, but I have also worked there.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不但而且_búdànérqiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_我不但去过北京而且还在那儿工作过.mp3

title: 不仅...还... (bùjǐn...hái...) - Not only... but also...
short_explanation: Used to emphasize that in addition to the first point, there is a further point.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese structure '不仅...还...' (bùjǐn...hái...) equates to 'not only... but also...' in English. It is used to emphasize an additional point or element in a sentence in conjunction with the first point. This construct is frequently used when the speaker wants to accentuate and focus attention on multiple attributes, characteristics, or behaviors of a subject.
formation: Subject + 不仅 + Verb/Adjective + First Point，还 + Verb/Adjective + Further Point.

examples.cn: 这个电影不仅很精彩，还很有教育意义。
examples.pinyin: Zhège diànyǐng bùjǐn hěn jīngcǎi, hái hěn yǒu jiàoyù yìyì.
examples.en: This movie is not only very exciting, but also very educational.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅还_bùjǐnhái_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_这个电影不仅很精彩还很有教育意义.mp3

examples.cn: 他不仅会说法语，还会说西班牙语和德语。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùjǐn huì shuō fǎyǔ, hái huì shuō xībānyá yǔ hé dé yǔ.
examples.en: He can not only speak French, but also Spanish and German.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅还_bùjǐnhái_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_他不仅会说法语还会说西班牙语和德语.mp3

examples.cn: 她不仅聪明，还非常努力。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùjǐn cōngmíng, hái fēicháng nǔlì.
examples.en: She is not only smart, but also very hard-working.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅还_bùjǐnhái_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_她不仅聪明还非常努力.mp3

examples.cn: 这部手机不仅拍照清晰，还能防水。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù shǒujī bùjǐn pāizhào qīngxī, hái néng fángshuǐ.
examples.en: This phone not only takes clear photos, but is also waterproof.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅还_bùjǐnhái_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_这部手机不仅拍照清晰还能防水.mp3

title: 即便 (jíbiàn) - Even if, even though
short_explanation: Used to express the condition that, even given certain fact or circumstance
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '即便 (jíbiàn)' is used to express a hypothetical situation or a condition, often implying an adverse circumstance or difficult situation. It is equivalent to 'even if' or 'even though' in English. Usually used to introduce a clause, followed by the main clause, demonstrating the effect or result of the hypothetical situation.

examples.cn: 即便明天下雨，我们也要去爬山。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn míngtiān xià yǔ, wǒmen yě yào qù páshān.
examples.en: Even if it rains tomorrow, we will still go mountain climbing.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即便_jíbiàn_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即便明天下雨我们也要去爬山.mp3

examples.cn: 即便你不喜欢这个礼物，也不能这么直说。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn nǐ bù xǐhuān zhège lǐwù, yě bù néng zhème zhí shuō.
examples.en: Even if you do not like this gift, you cannot say so directly.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即便_jíbiàn_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即便你不喜欢这个礼物也不能这么直说.mp3

examples.cn: 即便他已经尽力了，结果还是失败了。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn tā yǐjīng jìnlì le, jiéguǒ háishì shībài le.
examples.en: Even though he tried his best, the result was still a failure.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即便_jíbiàn_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即便他已经尽力了结果还是失败了.mp3

examples.cn: 即便我很喜欢她，我还是不能告诉她。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn wǒ hěn xǐhuān tā, wǒ háishì bù néng gàosù tā.
examples.en: Even though I like her very much, I still can't tell her.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即便_jíbiàn_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即便我很喜欢她我还是不能告诉她.mp3

title: 尽管 (jǐnguǎn) - Despite, although
short_explanation: Used to express a contrastive or concessive clause.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '尽管 (jǐnguǎn)' is used to introduce a contrastive or concessive clause, similar to 'despite' or 'although' in English. It is often used to indicate that the action or state of the main clause happens regardless of the situation described in the sub-clause.
formation: 尽管 + Sub-clause (stating an opposing situation or condition), Main Clause (stating the primary action or state)

examples.cn: 尽管他们已经努力了，但还是没有赢得比赛。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tāmen yǐjīng nǔlì le, dàn háishì méiyǒu yíngdé bǐsài.
examples.en: Despite their effort, they still didn't win the match.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐnguǎn_-_Despite_although_20231230_尽管他们已经努力了但还是没有赢得比赛.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管外面下着大雨，他还是决定出去跑步。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn wàimiàn xiàzhe dàyǔ, tā háishì juédìng chūqù pǎobù.
examples.en: Although it's raining heavily outside, he still decided to go for a run.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐnguǎn_-_Despite_although_20231230_尽管外面下着大雨他还是决定出去跑步.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管他不喜欢吃蔬菜，但他为了健康开始改变饮食习惯。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tā bù xǐhuān chī shūcài, dàn tā wèile jiànkāng kāishǐ gǎibiàn yǐnshí xíguàn.
examples.en: Even though he doesn't like vegetables, he started changing his diet for the sake of his health.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐnguǎn_-_Despite_although_20231230_尽管他不喜欢吃蔬菜但他为了健康开始改变饮食习惯.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管他才十岁，他的数学能力却非常出色。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tā cái shísuì, tā de shùxué nénglì què fēicháng chūsè.
examples.en: Despite being only ten years old, his math skills are outstanding.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐnguǎn_-_Despite_although_20231230_尽管他才十岁他的数学能力却非常出色.mp3

title: 按照 (ànzhào) - According to, in accordance with
short_explanation: Used to express 'following a certain method, standard, or way of doing something'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese preposition '按照 (ànzhào)' can be translated as 'according to' or 'in accordance with' in English. It is used to indicate that someone or something is acting or behaving in a way that follows a certain method, standard, requirement, or rule. Usually, what follows '按照' is a plan, rule, arrangement, or similar kind of criterion that provides a standard or guideline for action.
formation: Subject + 按照 + Standard/Rules + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 按照规定，我们必须在十点之前完成所有的工作。
examples.pinyin: Ànzhào guīdìng, wǒmen bìxū zài shí diǎn zhīqián wánchéng suǒyǒu de gōngzuò.
examples.en: According to the rules, we must finish all work before ten o'clock.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_按照_ànzhào_-_According_to_in_accordance_with_20231230_按照规定我们必须在十点之前完成所有的工作.mp3

examples.cn: 他按照医生的建议开始进行健康饮食计划。
examples.pinyin: Tā ànzhào yīshēng de jiànyì kāishǐ jìnxíng jiànkāng yǐnshí jìhuà.
examples.en: He started a healthy eating plan according to the doctor's advice.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_按照_ànzhào_-_According_to_in_accordance_with_20231230_他按照医生的建议开始进行健康饮食计划.mp3

examples.cn: 我们会按照你的说明书来操作这台电脑。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen huì ànzhào nǐ de shuōmíngshū lái cāozuò zhè tái diànnǎo.
examples.en: We will operate this computer according to your instructions.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_按照_ànzhào_-_According_to_in_accordance_with_20231230_我们会按照你的说明书来操作这台电脑.mp3

examples.cn: 按照合同，你需要在一个月内支付租金。
examples.pinyin: Ànzhào hétóng, nǐ xūyào zài yīgè yuè nèi zhīfù zūjīn.
examples.en: According to the contract, you need to pay the rent within a month.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_按照_ànzhào_-_According_to_in_accordance_with_20231230_按照合同你需要在一个月内支付租金.mp3

title: 一般 (yìbān) - Generally, usually
short_explanation: Used to express an action or a state that often happens or is usual.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '一般 (yìbān)' is commonly used to express usual or common habits or states of being. This term can be translated into English as 'generally' or 'usually'. It reflects the regular or habitual nature of the action or state being referenced.
formation: Subject + 一般 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 妈妈一般上午去购物，因为这时候超市人不多。
examples.pinyin: Māmā yìbān shàngwǔ qù gòuwù, yīnwèi zhè shíhòu chāoshì rén bù duō.
examples.en: Mom usually goes shopping in the morning, as there are few people in the supermarket at this time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一般_yìbān_-_Generally_usually_20231230_妈妈一般上午去购物因为这时候超市人不多.mp3

examples.cn: 他一般晚上才开始做作业，因为他希望有安静的环境。
examples.pinyin: Tā yìbān wǎnshàng cái kāishǐ zuò zuòyè, yīnwèi tā xīwàng yǒu ānjìng de huánjìng.
examples.en: He usually starts doing homework at night because he wants a quiet environment.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一般_yìbān_-_Generally_usually_20231230_他一般晚上才开始做作业因为他希望有安静的环境.mp3

examples.cn: 我一般喜欢在早上跑步，这样可以让我一天都充满活力。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yìbān xǐhuān zài zǎoshang pǎobù, zhèyàng kěyǐ ràng wǒ yītiān dōu chōngmǎn huólì.
examples.en: I usually like to jog in the morning, which can make me energetic all day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一般_yìbān_-_Generally_usually_20231230_我一般喜欢在早上跑步这样可以让我一天都充满活力.mp3

examples.cn: 他一般不喝咖啡，除非他需要加班工作。
examples.pinyin: Tā yìbān bù hē kāfēi, chúfēi tā xūyào jiābān gōngzuò.
examples.en: He usually doesn't drink coffee unless he needs to work overtime.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一般_yìbān_-_Generally_usually_20231230_他一般不喝咖啡除非他需要加班工作.mp3

title: 相对 (xiāngduì) - Relative, comparatively
short_explanation: Used to express 'relative to' or 'compared to' in a situation.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '相对 (xiāngduì)' is used to show a comparison or contrast between two things. It can be understood as 'relative to', 'in relation to', or 'compared to'. This term is frequently used to express an idea that one thing is more or less in degree or amount when compared with another.

examples.cn: 相对于其他学生，我觉得你的中文进步得更快。
examples.pinyin: Xiāngduì yú qítā xuéshēng, wǒ juédé nǐ de zhōngwén jìnbù de gèng kuài.
examples.en: Compared to other students, I think your Chinese is improving faster.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_相对_xiāngduì_-_Relative_comparatively_20231230_相对于其他学生我觉得你的中文进步得更快.mp3

examples.cn: 相对于我们的预期，他的成绩并不理想。
examples.pinyin: Xiāngduì yú wǒmen de yùqì, tā de chéngjī bìng bù lǐxiǎng.
examples.en: Compared to our expectations, his results are not ideal.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_相对_xiāngduì_-_Relative_comparatively_20231230_相对于我们的预期他的成绩并不理想.mp3

examples.cn: 相对大城市来说，小城镇的生活节奏要慢很多。
examples.pinyin: Xiāngduì dà chéngshì lái shuō, xiǎo chéngzhèn de shēnghuó jiézòu yào màn hěn duō.
examples.en: Compared to big cities, the pace of life in small towns is much slower.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_相对_xiāngduì_-_Relative_comparatively_20231230_相对大城市来说小城镇的生活节奏要慢很多.mp3

examples.cn: 相对于去年，这一年他有很大的进步。
examples.pinyin: Xiāngduì yú qùnián, zhè yī nián tā yǒu hěn dà de jìnbù.
examples.en: Compared to last year, he has made great progress this year.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_相对_xiāngduì_-_Relative_comparatively_20231230_相对于去年这一年他有很大的进步.mp3

title: 连...都/也... (lián...dōu/yě...) - Even
short_explanation: This structure is used to emphasize the extreme extent of a situation.
long_explanation: '连...都/也... (lián...dōu/yě...)' is a grammar structure often used in Mandarin Chinese to emphasize an extreme situation or to express an unexpected outcome. The structure '连...都...' can be translated as 'even...' in English, implying that the situation described is unexpected or surprising, while '连...也...' usually suggests that the situation is such to the extent that even the item between '连...' and '也...' cannot escape from it.

examples.cn: 我连名字都忘了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ lián míngzì dōu wàngle.
examples.en: I even forgot the name.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_连都/也_liándōu/yě_-_Even_20231230_我连名字都忘了.mp3

examples.cn: 连我妹妹也觉得那场电影很无聊。
examples.pinyin: Lián wǒ mèimei yě juéde nà chǎng diànyǐng hěn wúliáo.
examples.en: Even my sister thinks that movie is very boring.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_连都/也_liándōu/yě_-_Even_20231230_连我妹妹也觉得那场电影很无聊.mp3

examples.cn: 他功课连最简单的都没完成。
examples.pinyin: Tā gōngkè lián zuì jiǎndān de dōu méi wánchéng.
examples.en: He didn't even complete the simplest homework assignment.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_连都/也_liándōu/yě_-_Even_20231230_他功课连最简单的都没完成.mp3

examples.cn: 这件衣服连我都不愿意穿。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn yīfu lián wǒ duō bú yuànyì chuān.
examples.en: Even I don't want to wear this piece of clothing.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_连都/也_liándōu/yě_-_Even_20231230_这件衣服连我都不愿意穿.mp3

title: 不如 (bùrú) - Not as good as, inferior to
short_explanation: It is used to make comparisons, indicating that something or someone is less than or not as good as another.
long_explanation: The term '不如 (bùrú)' in Mandarin Chinese is used to show a comparative relation between two things or persons, stating that one is less than or not as good as the other. It could be perceived as 'inferior to' or 'not as good as' in English. The first part of the sentence usually presents what is being compared, followed by 不如 and then the point of comparison.

examples.cn: 我发现我不如他跑的快。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ fāxiàn wǒ bùrú tā pǎo de kuài.
examples.en: I found that I'm not as fast as him in running.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_我发现我不如他跑的快.mp3

examples.cn: 这部电影不如预期的那么好看。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng bùrú yùqí de nàme hǎokàn.
examples.en: This movie is not as good as expected.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_这部电影不如预期的那么好看.mp3

examples.cn: 他们的新产品不如我们的创新。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen de xīn chǎnpǐn bùrú wǒmen de chuàngxīn.
examples.en: Their new product is not as innovative as ours.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_他们的新产品不如我们的创新.mp3

examples.cn: 我们的团队合作能力可能不如他们的团队高。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen de tuánduì hézuò nénglì kěnéng bùrú tāmen de tuánduì gāo.
examples.en: Our team's ability to collaborate may not be as high as their team.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_我们的团队合作能力可能不如他们的团队高.mp3

title: 无论 (wúlùn) - No matter, regardless of
short_explanation: Used to express 'regardless of', 'no matter what/who/where etc.'
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '无论 (wúlùn)' is a conjunction used to express 'regardless of', or 'no matter what', 'no matter who', 'no matter where', etc. It is equivalent to 'regardless of' or 'no matter' in English. It is typically used to talk about conditions where the outcome is the same.

examples.cn: 无论天气怎样，我们都要去旅行。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn tiānqì zěnyàng, wǒmen dōu yào qù lǚxíng.
examples.en: No matter what the weather is like, we will go traveling.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论_wúlùn_-_No_matter_regardless_of_20231230_无论天气怎样我们都要去旅行.mp3

examples.cn: 无论你多么疲倦，你也必须完成这个任务。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn nǐ duōme píjuàn, nǐ yě bìxū wánchéng zhège rènwu.
examples.en: No matter how tired you are, you must complete this task.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论_wúlùn_-_No_matter_regardless_of_20231230_无论你多么疲倦你也必须完成这个任务.mp3

examples.cn: 无论你在哪里，我都能找到你。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn nǐ zài nǎlǐ, wǒ dōu néng zhǎodào nǐ.
examples.en: No matter where you are, I can find you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论_wúlùn_-_No_matter_regardless_of_20231230_无论你在哪里我都能找到你.mp3

examples.cn: 无论我做什么，她总是对我很严格。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn wǒ zuò shénme, tā zǒngshì duì wǒ hěn yángé.
examples.en: No matter what I do, she is always very strict with me.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论_wúlùn_-_No_matter_regardless_of_20231230_无论我做什么她总是对我很严格.mp3

title: 即 (jí) - Namely, that is
short_explanation: Used to introduce a specification or explanation of a previously mentioned term or concept.
long_explanation: '即 (jí)' is a useful Chinese language expression that is used to add further specification, embellishment, or clarification to a concept or term mentioned before it in a sentence. In English, this would be equivalent to using the words 'namely' or 'that is'. The term '即' comes before the explanation or specification but does not typically end a sentence or stand alone.
formation: Term or concept + 即 + Further explanation or specification

examples.cn: 他是大明国王，即朱元璋。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì dàmíng guówáng, jí zhū yuánzhāng.
examples.en: He is the king of Ming Dynasty, that is, Zhu Yuanzhang.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即_jí_-_Namely_that_is_20231230_他是大明国王即朱元璋.mp3

examples.cn: 我最好的朋友，即小王，今天生日。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuì hǎo de péngyǒu, jí xiǎo wáng, jīntiān shēngrì.
examples.en: My best friend, namely Xiao Wang, has a birthday today.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即_jí_-_Namely_that_is_20231230_我最好的朋友即小王今天生日.mp3

examples.cn: 我最喜欢的食物是意面，即意大利面。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuì xǐhuān de shíwù shì yìmiàn, jí yìdàlì miàn.
examples.en: My favorite food is pasta, that is, Italian pasta.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即_jí_-_Namely_that_is_20231230_我最喜欢的食物是意面即意大利面.mp3

examples.cn: 我每天都做运动，即跑步和游泳。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měitiān dū zuò yùndòng, jí pǎobù hé yóuyǒng.
examples.en: I exercise every day, namely running and swimming.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即_jí_-_Namely_that_is_20231230_我每天都做运动即跑步和游泳.mp3

title: 既...又... (jì...yòu...) - Both... and...
short_explanation: This is used to show that two or more qualities or actions apply to a subject at the same time.
long_explanation: The phrase '既...又...' (jì...yòu...) in Mandarin Chinese is used to express two or more characteristics or actions of the same subject. It is similar to the English construction 'both...and...', allowing the speaker to attribute multiple qualities or actions to the same subject concurrently. It is usually used in more formal or literary contexts.
formation: Subject + 既 + Description 1 + 又 + Description 2

examples.cn: 这部电影既有趣又激动人心，我非常喜欢。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng jì yǒuqù yòu jīdòng rénxīn, wǒ fēicháng xǐhuān.
examples.en: This film is both interesting and exciting, I like it very much.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既又_jìyòu_-_Both_and_20231230_这部电影既有趣又激动人心我非常喜欢.mp3

examples.cn: 我的朋友既聪明又善良，我们都很尊重她。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de péngyǒu jì cōngmíng yòu shàntiāng, wǒmen dōu hěn zūnzhòng tā.
examples.en: My friend is both intelligent and kind, we all respect her.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既又_jìyòu_-_Both_and_20231230_我的朋友既聪明又善良我们都很尊重她.mp3

examples.cn: 中国菜既美味又健康，我常常烹饪和食用。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó cài jì měiwèi yòu jiànkāng, wǒ chángcháng pēngrèn hé shíyòng.
examples.en: Chinese cuisine is both delicious and healthy, I often cook and eat it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既又_jìyòu_-_Both_and_20231230_中国菜既美味又健康我常常烹饪和食用.mp3

examples.cn: 这个公园既宁静又美丽，是城市中的一片绿洲。
examples.pinyin: Zhège gōngyuán jì níngjìng yòu měilì, shì chéngshì zhōng de yīpiàn lǜzhōu.
examples.en: This park is both quiet and beautiful, it is an oasis in the city.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_既又_jìyòu_-_Both_and_20231230_这个公园既宁静又美丽是城市中的一片绿洲.mp3

title: 首先 (shǒuxiān) - First of all, firstly
short_explanation: Used to indicate the first point or step in a series.
long_explanation: The phrase '首先 (shǒuxiān)' in Mandarin Chinese is used to denote the initial step or point which comes before others in a sequence of events or arguments. It translates to 'firstly' or 'first of all' in English and usually is employed when outlining a process or arguing a point in order.

examples.cn: 首先，我想感谢所有的在场人员，然后我再分享我的计划。
examples.pinyin: Shǒuxiān, wǒ xiǎng gǎnxiè suǒyǒu de zàichǎng rényuán, ránhòu wǒ zài fēnxiǎng wǒ de jìhuà.
examples.en: First of all, I would like to thank everyone present, and then I will share my plan.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_首先_shǒuxiān_-_First_of_all_firstly_20231230_首先我想感谢所有的在场人员然后我再分享我的计划.mp3

examples.cn: 报道一件事情首先要了解所有的事实。
examples.pinyin: Bàodào yī jiàn shìqíng shǒuxiān yào liǎojiě suǒyǒu de shìshí.
examples.en: To report on a matter, one must first of all understand all the facts.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_首先_shǒuxiān_-_First_of_all_firstly_20231230_报道一件事情首先要了解所有的事实.mp3

examples.cn: 首先，他检查了患者的体温，然后听诊了他的心脏。
examples.pinyin: Shǒuxiān, tā jiǎnchá le huànzhě de tǐwēn, ránhòu tīngzhěn le tā de xīnzàng.
examples.en: First of all, he checked the patient's temperature, then listened to his heartbeats.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_首先_shǒuxiān_-_First_of_all_firstly_20231230_首先他检查了患者的体温然后听诊了他的心脏.mp3

examples.cn: 写论文时，首先你应该构想清楚你的主题。
examples.pinyin: Xiě lùnwén shí, shǒuxiān nǐ yīnggāi gòuxiǎng qīngchu nǐ de zhǔtí.
examples.en: When writing a paper, you should first of all clearly conceive your topic.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_首先_shǒuxiān_-_First_of_all_firstly_20231230_写论文时首先你应该构想清楚你的主题.mp3

title: 最后 (zuìhòu) - Finally, lastly
short_explanation: Used to refer to the final or last occurrence of something.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '最后 (zuìhòu)' is used to denote the final or last instance of something. It can refer to the last item in a series, the last action in a sequence, or the conclusion or end of a certain event. It is equivalent to 'finally' or 'lastly' in English, indicating the concluding part or action.
formation: Subject + Verb/Adjective + 最后 + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 最后，我决定注销我的社交媒体账号，因为我想专心学习。
examples.pinyin: Zuìhòu, wǒ juédìng zhùxiāo wǒ de shèjiāo méitǐ zhǎnghào, yīnwèi wǒ xiǎng zhuānxīn xuéxí.
examples.en: Finally, I decided to deactivate my social media accounts because I want to focus on studying.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_最后_zuìhòu_-_Finally_lastly_20231230_最后我决定注销我的社交媒体账号因为我想专心学习.mp3

examples.cn: 他最后放弃了吃肉，选择了成为一个素食者。
examples.pinyin: Tā zuìhòu fàngqìle chī ròu, xuǎnzéle chéngwéi yīgè sùshí zhě.
examples.en: He finally gave up eating meat and chose to become a vegetarian.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_最后_zuìhòu_-_Finally_lastly_20231230_他最后放弃了吃肉选择了成为一个素食者.mp3

examples.cn: 最后我选择了宝蓝色的裙子，因为这是我的最喜欢的颜色。
examples.pinyin: Zuìhòu wǒ xuǎnzéle bǎolánsè de qúnzi, yīnwèi zhè shì wǒ de zuì xǐhuān de yánsè.
examples.en: In the end, I chose the sapphire blue dress because it's my favorite color.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_最后_zuìhòu_-_Finally_lastly_20231230_最后我选择了宝蓝色的裙子因为这是我的最喜欢的颜色.mp3

examples.cn: 他在演讲的最后向所有的支持者表示感谢。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài yǎnjiǎng de zuìhòu xiàng suǒyǒu de zhīchí zhě biǎoshì gǎnxiè.
examples.en: He thanked all of his supporters at the end of his speech.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_最后_zuìhòu_-_Finally_lastly_20231230_他在演讲的最后向所有的支持者表示感谢.mp3

title: 只要...就... (zhǐyào...jiù...) - As long as... then...
short_explanation: Used to express the condition and result relationship.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '只要...就...' (zhǐyào...jiù...) is used to illustrate a conditional relationship wherein a certain outcome (expressed after '就' in the sentence) is guaranteed given a specified condition (expressed after '只要' in the sentence). It translates to 'as long as... then...' in English.

examples.cn: 只要你努力学习，就会取得成功。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào nǐ nǔlì xuéxí, jiù huì qǔdé chénggōng.
examples.en: As long as you study hard, you will achieve success.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyàojiù_-_As_long_as_then_20231230_只要你努力学习就会取得成功.mp3

examples.cn: 只要我们早点出发，就可以避免交通堵塞。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào wǒmen zǎodiǎn chūfā, jiù kěyǐ bìmiǎn jiāotōng dǔsè.
examples.en: As long as we set off early, we can avoid traffic jams.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyàojiù_-_As_long_as_then_20231230_只要我们早点出发就可以避免交通堵塞.mp3

examples.cn: 只要提前准备，就不会感到紧张。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào tíqián zhǔnbèi, jiù bù huì gǎndào jǐnzhāng.
examples.en: As long as you prepare in advance, you won't feel nervous.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyàojiù_-_As_long_as_then_20231230_只要提前准备就不会感到紧张.mp3

examples.cn: 只要天气好，我们就去野餐。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào tiānqì hǎo, wǒmen jiù qù yěcān.
examples.en: As long as the weather is good, we will go for a picnic.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只要就_zhǐyàojiù_-_As_long_as_then_20231230_只要天气好我们就去野餐.mp3

title: 只有...才... (zhǐyǒu...cái...) - Only if... then...
short_explanation: This construction is used to indicate that only under a certain condition will a certain result happen.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '只有...才...' (zhǐyǒu...cái...) is used for emphasis and expresses the meaning of 'only if... then...', placing strong emphasis on the condition and result relationship. The clause before '才' is the necessary condition, while the clause after '才' is the result that can only be produced when the condition is met.

examples.cn: 只有努力学习，你才能通过HSK考试。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyǒu nǔlì xuéxí, nǐ cái néng tōngguò HSK kǎoshì.
examples.en: Only if you study hard, then can you pass the HSK exam.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只有才_zhǐyǒucái_-_Only_if_then_20231230_只有努力学习你才能通过HSK考试.mp3

examples.cn: 只有多做运动，才能更健康。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyǒu duō zuò yùndòng, cái néng gèng jiànkāng.
examples.en: Only if you exercise more, then can you be healthier.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只有才_zhǐyǒucái_-_Only_if_then_20231230_只有多做运动才能更健康.mp3

examples.cn: 只有早起，你才能赶上第一班车。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyǒu zǎo qǐ, nǐ cái néng gǎnshàng dì yī bān chē.
examples.en: Only if you rise early, can you catch the first bus.

examples.cn: 只有多练习写中文，你才能写的更好。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyǒu duō liànxí xiě Zhōngwén, nǐ cái néng xiě de gèng hǎo.
examples.en: Only if you practice writing Chinese more, can you write it better.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_只有才_zhǐyǒucái_-_Only_if_then_20231230_只有多练习写中文你才能写的更好.mp3

title: 就算 (jiùsuàn) - Even if, granted that
short_explanation: Used to express a hypothetical condition and its contrastive results.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '就算 (jiùsuàn)' is used to convey the meaning of 'even if' or 'granted that', introducing an assumption or hypothetical condition. This grammatical structure helps to highlight contrast between hypothetical conditions and their consequences. It's primarily used when the speaker wants to emphasize that even under certain circumstances or conditions, the outcome will remain unchanged.
formation: (就算 / 即使 / 哪怕) + Hypothetical Condition + 主句

examples.cn: 就算你没有时间，你也要抽空完成这个任务。
examples.pinyin: Jiùsuàn nǐ méiyǒu shíjiān, nǐ yě yào chōukōng wánchéng zhège rènwù.
examples.en: Even if you don't have time, you have to make time to complete this task.

examples.cn: 就算我最好的朋友对我不好，我仍然会对她好。
examples.pinyin: Jiùsuàn wǒ zuì hǎo de péngyǒu duì wǒ bù hǎo, wǒ réngrán huì duì tā hǎo.
examples.en: Even if my best friend does not treat me well, I will still treat her well.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_就算_jiùsuàn_-_Even_if_granted_that_20231230_就算我最好的朋友对我不好我仍然会对她好.mp3

examples.cn: 就算他再富有，他也不会购买那辆奢侈的车。
examples.pinyin: Jiùsuàn tā zài fùyǒu, tā yě bù huì gòumǎi nà liàng shēchǐ de chē.
examples.en: Even if he is richer, he would not buy that luxury car.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_就算_jiùsuàn_-_Even_if_granted_that_20231230_就算他再富有他也不会购买那辆奢侈的车.mp3

examples.cn: 就算明天下雨，我们的野餐计划还是会进行。
examples.pinyin: Jiùsuàn míngtiān xià yǔ, wǒmen de yěcān jìhuà háishì huì jìnxíng.
examples.en: Even if it rains tomorrow, our picnic plans will still go on.

title: 反而 (fǎn'ér) - On the contrary, instead
short_explanation: Used to express an unexpected outcome or a situation that is contrary to what one might expect.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese adverb '反而 (fǎn'ér)' is used to indicate a result or situation that is contrary to what was expected. It is akin to the English terms 'on the contrary' or 'instead'. This adverb is commonly used when one thing doesn't happen or isn't true, but another thing happens or is true instead.

examples.cn: 这部电影我不觉得无聊，反而我觉得非常有意思。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng wǒ bù juédé wúliáo, fǎn'ér wǒ juédé fēicháng yǒuyìsi.
examples.en: I don't find this movie boring, on the contrary, I find it very interesting.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_这部电影我不觉得无聊反而我觉得非常有意思.mp3

examples.cn: 他没有变得更快乐，反而变得更痛苦。
examples.pinyin: Tā méiyǒu biàn dé gèng kuàilè, fǎn'ér biàn dé gèng tòngkǔ.
examples.en: He did not become happier, on the contrary, he became more painful.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_他没有变得更快乐反而变得更痛苦.mp3

examples.cn: 减分政策并没有降低车祸率，反而使之上升。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎnfēn zhèngcè bìng méiyǒu jiàngdī chēhuǒ lǜ, fǎn'ér shǐ zhī shàngshēng.
examples.en: The points deduction policy did not reduce the accident rate, on the contrary, it made it rise.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反而_fǎnér_-_On_the_contrary_instead_20231230_减分政策并没有降低车祸率反而使之上升.mp3

examples.cn: 我没有感到困，反而感到很清醒。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ méiyǒu gǎndào kùn, fǎn'ér gǎndào hěn qīngxǐng.
examples.en: I didn't feel sleepy, on the contrary, I felt very awake.

title: 光是 (guāngshì) - Merely, just
short_explanation: Used to highlight that the mentioned item or consideration, on its own, is already significant.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '光是 (guāngshì)' is used to underscore a particular point or item, indicating that it alone is already significant, abundant, or constitutes a major part or consideration of something. This phrase is typically used before subjects or conditions and is equivalent to the English expressions 'merely', 'just', or 'only'.
formation: 光是 + Object/Condition + 就/便/也 + Comment

examples.cn: 光是去那儿的路就要走一个小时。
examples.pinyin: Guāngshì qù nà'er de lù jiù yào zǒu yīgè xiǎoshí.
examples.en: Just the journey there already takes an hour.

examples.cn: 光是他的工资就足以支持整个家庭的生活。
examples.pinyin: Guāngshì tā de gōngzī jiù zúyǐ zhīchí zhěnggè jiātíng de shēnghuó.
examples.en: His salary alone is enough to support the whole family.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_光是_guāngshì_-_Merely_just_20231230_光是他的工资就足以支持整个家庭的生活.mp3

examples.cn: 光是听到你的声音，我就感到非常安慰。
examples.pinyin: Guāngshì tīng dào nǐ de shēngyīn, wǒ jiù gǎndào fēicháng ānwèi.
examples.en: Merely hearing your voice, I already feel very comforted.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_光是_guāngshì_-_Merely_just_20231230_光是听到你的声音我就感到非常安慰.mp3

examples.cn: 光是考虑这个问题就给我带来了很大的压力。
examples.pinyin: Guāngshì kǎolǜ zhège wèntí jiù gěi wǒdài lái le hěn dà de yālì.
examples.en: Just considering this issue already gives me a lot of stress.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_光是_guāngshì_-_Merely_just_20231230_光是考虑这个问题就给我带来了很大的压力.mp3

title: 以便 (yǐbiàn) - So that, In order to
short_explanation: Used to express the purpose of an action or plan.
long_explanation: The Chinese phrase '以便 (yǐbiàn)' functions as a conjunction denoting the purpose or intention behind an action, similar to 'so that' or 'in order to' in English. It indicates that the action in the main clause is for achieving the goal described in the following clause.

examples.cn: 我早点起来以便有足够的时间准备早餐。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǎodiǎn qǐlái yǐbiàn yǒu zúgòu de shíjiān zhǔnbèi zǎocān.
examples.en: I get up early so that I have enough time to prepare breakfast.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以便_yǐbiàn_-_So_that_In_order_to_20231230_我早点起来以便有足够的时间准备早餐.mp3

examples.cn: 他把所有的资料都整理好以便随时可以查阅。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ suǒyǒu de zīliào dōu zhěnglǐ hǎo yǐbiàn suíshí kěyǐ cháyuè.
examples.en: He has organized all the materials so that he can access them at any time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以便_yǐbiàn_-_So_that_In_order_to_20231230_他把所有的资料都整理好以便随时可以查阅.mp3

examples.cn: 她提前预定了酒店以便保证有一个好的住处。
examples.pinyin: Tā tíqián yùdìng le jiǔdiàn yǐbiàn bǎozhèng yǒu yīgè hǎo de zhùchù.
examples.en: She booked a hotel in advance so that she is guaranteed a good place to stay.

examples.cn: 我将这个问题记录下来以便以后进行讨论。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jiāng zhège wèntí jìlù xiàlai yǐbiàn yǐhòu jìnxíng tǎolùn.
examples.en: I'm writing down this question so that we can discuss it later.

title: 除非...否则... (chúfēi...fǒuzé...) - Unless... otherwise...
short_explanation: This is used to express a conditional relationship between two clauses.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '除非...否则...' is a compound conjunction used to indicate a situation or condition, followed by the consequence if that condition is not met. This is conceptually similar to 'unless... otherwise...' in English. When expressed in a sentence, 除非 (chúfēi) initiates the condition, and 否则 (fǒuzé) introduces the outcome or the consequence.
formation: 除非 + Condition, 否则 + Consequence

examples.cn: 除非你努力学习，否则你就无法通过HSK考试。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ nǔlì xuéxí, fǒuzé nǐ jiù wúfǎ tōngguò HSK kǎoshì.
examples.en: Unless you study hard, you cannot pass the HSK exam.

examples.cn: 除非她给我打电话，否则我不会去她的生日派对。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi tā gěi wǒ dǎ diànhuà, fǒuzé wǒ bú huì qù tā de shēngrì pàiduì.
examples.en: Unless she calls me, I won't go to her birthday party.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēifǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非她给我打电话否则我不会去她的生日派对.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你提前完成这个项目，否则你将不可以在本周休假。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ tíqián wánchéng zhège xiàngmù, fǒuzé nǐ jiāng bú kěyǐ zài běn zhōu xiūjià.
examples.en: Unless you finish this project in advance, you won't be able to take a vacation this week.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非否则_chúfēifǒuzé_-_Unless_otherwise_20231230_除非你提前完成这个项目否则你将不可以在本周休假.mp3

examples.cn: 除非我们很早离开，否则我们会错过火车。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi wǒmen hěn zǎo líkāi, fǒuzé wǒmen huì cuòguò huǒchē.
examples.en: Unless we leave very early, we will miss the train.

title: 虽然...但是... (suīrán...dànshì...) - Although... but...
short_explanation: Used to express contrast or contradiction in a statement.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '虽然...但是... (suīrán...dànshì...)' is used to indicate contrast or contradiction within a particular statement. It's equivalent to 'although' and 'but' in English. This format is often used to offer nuanced observations or explanations.
formation: 虽然 + Statement 1 + 但是 + Statement 2

examples.cn: 虽然他很努力学习，但是他还没有通过最后的考试。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán tā hěn nǔlì xuéxí, dànshì tā hái méiyǒu tōngguò zuìhòu de kǎoshì.
examples.en: Although he studies very hard, he has not passed the final exam yet.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽然但是_suīrándànshì_-_Although_but_20231230_虽然他很努力学习但是他还没有通过最后的考试.mp3

examples.cn: 虽然他比我年轻，但是他比我有经验。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán tā bǐ wǒ niánqīng, dànshì tā bǐ wǒ yǒu jīngyàn.
examples.en: Although he is younger than me, he is more experienced than I am.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽然但是_suīrándànshì_-_Although_but_20231230_虽然他比我年轻但是他比我有经验.mp3

examples.cn: 虽然我很饿，但是我没有时间吃午饭。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán wǒ hěn è , dànshì wǒ méiyǒu shíjiān chī wǔfàn.
examples.en: Although I am very hungry, I don't have time for lunch.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽然但是_suīrándànshì_-_Although_but_20231230_虽然我很饿但是我没有时间吃午饭.mp3

examples.cn: 虽然天气很冷，但是我必须出去购物。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán tiānqì hěn lěng, dànshì wǒ bìxū chūqù gòuwù.
examples.en: Although the weather is very cold, I must go out to shop.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽然但是_suīrándànshì_-_Although_but_20231230_虽然天气很冷但是我必须出去购物.mp3

title: 与其...不如... (yǔqí...bùrú...) - Rather than... it's better to...
short_explanation: This structure is used to express a preference toward one thing or action over another.
long_explanation: 与其...不如... is an important comparative structure in Mandarin Chinese. It signals a decision or preference, suggesting that rather than the first option, it would be better to choose the second one. It directly compares two alternatives and expresses a clear preference for the latter part. This is akin to using 'rather than' in English.
formation: 与其 + Negative Option + 不如 + Preferred Option

examples.cn: 与其在家里看电视，不如出去走走。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí zài jiālǐ kàn diànshì, bù rú chūqù zǒu zǒu.
examples.en: Rather than watching TV at home, it's better to go out for a walk.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqíbùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其在家里看电视不如出去走走.mp3

examples.cn: 与其花钱买这个，不如把钱省下来。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí huā qián mǎi zhège, bù rú bǎ qián shěng xiàlái.
examples.en: Rather than spending money on this, it's better to save the money.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqíbùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其花钱买这个不如把钱省下来.mp3

examples.cn: 与其吃快餐，不如自己做饭。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí chī kuàicān, bùrú zìjǐ zuò fàn.
examples.en: Rather than eating fast food, it's better to cook yourself.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与其不如_yǔqíbùrú_-_Rather_than_its_better_to_20231230_与其吃快餐不如自己做饭.mp3

examples.cn: 与其抱怨，不如采取行动来改变。
examples.pinyin: Yǔqí bàoyuàn, bùrú cǎiqǔ xíngdòng lái gǎibiàn.
examples.en: Rather than complaining, it's better to take action to change.

title: 不止 (bùzhǐ) - More than, not limited to
short_explanation: This phrase is used to express that a quantity or degree is more than a particular number or standard.
long_explanation: '不止 (bùzhǐ)' in Mandarin Chinese is used to describe a situation or quantity that surpasses a certain known limit or standard. It emphasizes that the quantity, amount, or time span isn't limited to the stated amount but is often more than what is indicated.

examples.cn: 这个汉字我复习了不止五遍。
examples.pinyin: Zhè ge Hànzì wǒ fùxí le bùzhǐ wǔ biàn.
examples.en: I've reviewed this Chinese character more than five times.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不止_bùzhǐ_-_More_than_not_limited_to_20231230_这个汉字我复习了不止五遍.mp3

examples.cn: 他读了不止一百本书。
examples.pinyin: Tā dú le bùzhǐ yībǎi běn shū.
examples.en: He's read more than a hundred books.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不止_bùzhǐ_-_More_than_not_limited_to_20231230_他读了不止一百本书.mp3

examples.cn: 我等你等了不止一个小时。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ děng nǐ děng le bùzhǐ yī gè xiǎoshí.
examples.en: I've been waiting for you for more than an hour.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不止_bùzhǐ_-_More_than_not_limited_to_20231230_我等你等了不止一个小时.mp3

examples.cn: 他在这家公司工作了不止十年。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài zhè jiā gōngsī gōngzuò le bùzhǐ shí nián.
examples.en: He's worked at this company for more than ten years.

title: 并不 (bìngbù) - Not at all, not really
short_explanation: Used to negate something strongly in a sentence.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '并不 (bìngbù)' is used to strongly deny or refute something in a sentence. This phrase helps to convey the sense that something is not the case, even though it might seem or be expected to be so. It is more emphatic than simply saying '不 (bù)', which stands for 'not'.

examples.cn: 我并不觉得他是个坏人，只是他的行为让我很困扰。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bìngbù juédé tā shì gè huàirén, zhǐshì tā de xíngwéi ràng wǒ hěn kùnrǎo.
examples.en: I don't really think he's a bad person, it's just his behavior that troubles me.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_并不_bìngbù_-_Not_at_all_not_really_20231230_我并不觉得他是个坏人只是他的行为让我很困扰.mp3

examples.cn: 他并不喜欢足球，他只是在看比赛的时候才会看。
examples.pinyin: Tā bìngbù xǐhuān zúqiú, tā zhǐshì zài kàn bǐsài de shíhòu cái huì kàn.
examples.en: He doesn't really like football, he only watches it during matches.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_并不_bìngbù_-_Not_at_all_not_really_20231230_他并不喜欢足球他只是在看比赛的时候才会看.mp3

examples.cn: 这个问题并不难，你只要用点心就能解决。
examples.pinyin: Zhège wèntí bìngbù nán, nǐ zhǐyào yòng diǎn xīn jiù néng jiějué.
examples.en: This question is not really hard, you just need to put in a little effort and it can be solved.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_并不_bìngbù_-_Not_at_all_not_really_20231230_这个问题并不难你只要用点心就能解决.mp3

examples.cn: 虽然她说话很大声，但其实她并不生气。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán tā shuōhuà hěn dà shēng, dàn qíshí tā bìngbù shēngqì.
examples.en: Although she speaks very loudly, she is not actually angry.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_并不_bìngbù_-_Not_at_all_not_really_20231230_虽然她说话很大声但其实她并不生气.mp3

title: 甚至 (shènzhì) - Even, to the extent that
short_explanation: Used to express 'even' or 'to the extent that' in Mandarin Chinese.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '甚至 (shènzhì)' is used to highlight the extreme degree or extent of an action or situation. In English, it is equivalent to 'even' or 'to the extent that'. It is generally used in conjunction with two related statements to emphasize the extremity of the latter statement.

examples.cn: 他是一个非常善良的人，甚至他会帮助并不熟悉的人。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yīgè fēicháng shànliáng de rén, shènzhì tā huì bāngzhù bìng bù shúxī de rén.
examples.en: He is a very kind person, he would even help people he's not familiar with.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_甚至_shènzhì_-_Even_to_the_extent_that_20231230_他是一个非常善良的人甚至他会帮助并不熟悉的人.mp3

examples.cn: 他的工作非常繁忙，甚至连周末也没有休息的时间。
examples.pinyin: Tā de gōngzuò fēicháng fánmáng, shènzhì lián zhōumò yě méiyǒu xiūxí de shíjiān.
examples.en: His work is so busy that he doesn't even have time to rest on the weekends.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_甚至_shènzhì_-_Even_to_the_extent_that_20231230_他的工作非常繁忙甚至连周末也没有休息的时间.mp3

examples.cn: 我很喜欢读书，甚至可以在没有任何干扰的情况下连续读几个小时的书。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hěn xǐhuān dúshū, shènzhì kěyǐ zài méiyǒu rènhé gānraǎn de qíngkuàng xià liánxù dú jǐ gè xiǎoshí de shū.
examples.en: I love reading books, I can even read for several hours at a stretch without any interruptions.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_甚至_shènzhì_-_Even_to_the_extent_that_20231230_我很喜欢读书甚至可以在没有任何干扰的情况下连续读几个小时的书.mp3

examples.cn: 他非常富有，甚至他可以买下整个小镇。
examples.pinyin: Tā fēicháng fùyǒu, shènzhì tā kěyǐ mǎi xià zhěng gè xiǎozhèn.
examples.en: He's so rich that he could even buy an entire town.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_甚至_shènzhì_-_Even_to_the_extent_that_20231230_他非常富有甚至他可以买下整个小镇.mp3

title: 与 (yǔ) - And, with
short_explanation: Used to connect two or more nouns, or express 'with' in the sense of being together or interacting.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese conjunction '与 (yǔ)' functions as the equivalent of 'and' when connecting two or more nouns together, indicating a cooperative or united relationship between them. It can also mean 'with' when referring to being together in a action or interaction. It is a formal expression than '和'

examples.cn: 我与我的家人在周五通常会去公园散步。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǔ wǒ de jiārén zài zhōu wǔ tōngcháng huì qù gōngyuán sànbù.
examples.en: I and my family usually go for a walk in the park on Fridays.

examples.cn: 智慧与才能都是成功的关键。
examples.pinyin: Zhìhuì yǔ cáinéng dōu shì chénggōng de guānjiàn.
examples.en: Wisdom and talent are both keys to success.

examples.cn: 跟上科技的发展与人们的需求是我们公司的目标。
examples.pinyin: Gēn shàng kējì de fāzhǎn yǔ rénmen de xūqiú shì wǒmen gōngsī de mùbiāo.
examples.en: Keeping up with technological developments and people's needs is our company's goal.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_与_yǔ_-_And_with_20231230_跟上科技的发展与人们的需求是我们公司的目标.mp3

examples.pinyin: Tā yǔ gōngsī de suǒyǒu yuángōng dōu xiāngchǔ de fēicháng hǎo.
examples.en: She gets along very well with all the employees of the company.
