title: 早已 (zǎoyǐ) - Long ago, for a long time
short_explanation: Used to describe an action or event that has happened a long time ago or for a long time.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '早已 (zǎoyǐ)' is used to express something that has been ongoing or happened long ago. It carries the meaning of 'already' but significantly emphasizes the long duration or early occurrence of an event or action. It is typically used to illustrate a sense of time in the past. The subject of the sentence comes before '早已', and what follows is the action or the situation that has been happpening for long or happened long ago.

examples.cn: 我早已知道你要来北京。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǎoyǐ zhīdào nǐ yào lái Běijīng.
examples.en: I knew long ago that you were coming to Beijing.

examples.cn: 他早已习惯了这种生活方式。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǎoyǐ xíguàn le zhè zhǒng shēnghuó fāngshì.
examples.en: He has long been accustomed to this way of life.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_早已_zǎoyǐ_-_Long_ago_for_a_long_time_20231230_他早已习惯了这种生活方式.mp3

examples.pinyin: Zhègè wèntí zǎoyǐ dédào le jiějué.
examples.en: This problem has been solved long ago.

examples.cn: 她早已放弃了这个梦想。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǎoyǐ fàngqì le zhège mèngxiǎng.
examples.en: She gave up this dream long ago.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_早已_zǎoyǐ_-_Long_ago_for_a_long_time_20231230_她早已放弃了这个梦想.mp3

title: 反过来 (fǎnguòlái) - Conversely, on the other hand
short_explanation: Used to introduce an opposing or contrastive statement.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '反过来 (fǎnguòlái)' often comes after an action or a thought, and it is used to introduce a contrasting or idiomatic expression which shows the opposed or converse direction of the initial action or thought. This phrase is equivalent to 'conversely' or 'on the other hand' in English.

examples.cn: 学习中文很难，反过来看，它也有很多有趣的方面。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxí Zhōngwén hěn nán, fǎnguòlái kàn, tā yěyǒu hěnduō yǒuqù de fāngmiàn.
examples.en: Learning Chinese is difficult, on the other hand, it also has many interesting aspects.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反过来_fǎnguòlái_-_Conversely_on_the_other_hand_20231230_学习中文很难反过来看它也有很多有趣的方面.mp3

examples.cn: 这个电影开始的时候很无聊，但是反过来看，结尾部分上升到高潮，变得非常刺激。
examples.pinyin: Zhègè diànyǐng kāishǐ dí shíhou hěn wúliáo, dànshì fǎnguòlái kàn, jiéwěi bùfèn shàngshēng dào gāocháo, biàn dé fēicháng cìjī.
examples.en: The beginning of this movie was boring, but on the other hand, the ending part rose to a climax, becoming very exciting.

examples.cn: 我原本觉得他很聪明，反过来看，他在处理问题时常常行为冲动，不足为智。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yuánběn juédé tā hěn cōngmíng, fǎnguòlái kàn, tā zài chǔlǐ wèntí shí chángcháng xíngwéi chōngdòng, bùzú wéi zhì.
examples.en: I originally thought he was very smart, but on the other hand, he often behaves impulsively when dealing with issues, which is not smart.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反过来_fǎnguòlái_-_Conversely_on_the_other_hand_20231230_我原本觉得他很聪明反过来看他在处理问题时常常行为冲动不足为智.mp3

examples.en: You might think this plan has completely failed, but conversely, perhaps we can learn something from it.

title: 以至于 (yǐzhìyú) - So that, to the extent that
short_explanation: Used to show the result or effect of something or to an extent of something.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '以至于 (yǐzhìyú)' is primarily used to indicate a consequence or result that derives from a certain action or condition. It's roughly equivalent to 'so that' or 'to the extent that' in English. This phrase effectively communicates the substantial impact or significant after-effects of an initial event or circumstance.

examples.cn: 他工作很忙，以至于没有时间陪伴家人。
examples.pinyin: Tā gōngzuò hěn máng, yǐzhìyú méiyǒu shíjiān péibàn jiārén.
examples.en: He is so busy with his work that he doesn't have time to accompany his family.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以至于_yǐzhìyú_-_So_that_to_the_extent_that_20231230_他工作很忙以至于没有时间陪伴家人.mp3

examples.cn: 他失败了好多次，以至于开始怀疑自己的能力。
examples.pinyin: Tā shībài le hǎoduō cì, yǐzhìyú kāishǐ huáiyí zìjǐ de nénglì.
examples.en: He has failed so many times that he started doubting his own abilities.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以至于_yǐzhìyú_-_So_that_to_the_extent_that_20231230_他失败了好多次以至于开始怀疑自己的能力.mp3

examples.cn: 这部电影非常感人，以至于我看完后哭了起来。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng fēicháng gǎnrén, yǐzhìyú wǒ kàn wán hòu kū le qǐlái.
examples.en: The movie was so touching that I started crying after watching it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以至于_yǐzhìyú_-_So_that_to_the_extent_that_20231230_这部电影非常感人以至于我看完后哭了起来.mp3

examples.cn: 我们班的同学都非常团结，以至于老师非常骄傲。

examples.en: The students in our class are so united that the teacher is very proud.

title: 就此 (jiùcǐ) - Thus, henceforth
short_explanation: Used to indicate that something will continue as it is from this point on.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '就此 (jiùcǐ)' is used as an adverb to mean 'thus', 'henceforth', or 'from this point on'. It expresses the idea that a certain situation or condition will remain as it is, or a certain action or behavior will continue from this time forward. It is often used in formal or literary contexts.

examples.cn: 在那次会议之后，我们就此决定了开发新产品的计划。
examples.pinyin: Zài nà cì huìyì zhīhòu, wǒmen jiùcǐ juédìng le kāifā xīn chǎnpǐn de jìhuà.
examples.en: After that meeting, we thus decided on the plan to develop a new product.

examples.cn: 他就此决定放弃他的音乐事业，成为一名电脑程序员。

examples.en: He henceforth decided to give up his music career and become a computer programmer.

examples.cn: 我父母并不支持我的决定，但我已经就此决定要去留学。

examples.cn: 他就此决定改变他的生活方式，更健康地生活。

title: 并非 (bìngfēi) - Not, not really
short_explanation: Used to express denial or contradiction, meaning 'it's not really' or 'it's not actually'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '并非 (bìngfēi)' is used to state or emphasize a negative. It is a formal way to say 'not' or 'not really', often suggesting a contradiction to what might have been assumed. '并非' can be used before adjectives, verbs, or even another full comment.

examples.cn: 虽然这道题很难，但并非不能解决。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán zhè dào tí hěn nán, dàn bìngfēi bùnéng jiějué.
examples.en: Although this question is difficult, it is not really impossible to solve.

title: 可是 (kěshì) - But, However
short_explanation: Used to introduce a contrasting statement or idea.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '可是 (kěshì)' functions as a conjunction used to introduce a contrasting statement or idea, similar to 'but' or 'however' in English. It is typically used to connect two contrasting clauses or sentences, conveying a sense of contradiction or opposition between the linked ideas.

examples.cn: 我想去公园玩，可是今天下雨了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xiǎng qù gōngyuán wán, kěshì jīntiān xià yǔ le.
examples.en: I want to go to the park, but it's raining today.

examples.cn: 我本来想吃披萨，可是餐厅已经关门了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ běnlái xiǎng chī pīsà, kěshì cāntīng yǐjīng guānmén le.

title: 趁 (chèn) - To take advantage of, while
short_explanation: Used to express 'to take advantage of' or 'while' when afternoon opportunity.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '趁 (chèn)' suggests taking advantage of a particular situation, event, or time. Its usage is akin to the conjunction 'while' in English, denoting action taken during a specific context or circumstance. This phrase informs that the action was executed taking into consideration the advantage offered by the situation or time.

examples.cn: 趁着周末，我们去海边玩吧。
examples.pinyin: Chènzhe zhōumò, wǒmen qù hǎibiān wán ba.
examples.en: Let's go to the beach this weekend, taking advantage of the time off.

examples.en: While he was not at home, I put the gift on his table.

examples.pinyin: Chèn zhe tiān hái liàng, ràng wǒmen qù sànbù.
examples.en: Let's go for a walk while it's still light outside.

examples.cn: 趁老板不在，我们开个小型的庆祝会。
examples.pinyin: Chèn lǎobǎn bú zài, wǒmen kāi gè xiǎoxíng de qìngzhù huì.

title: 由于 (yóuyú) - Due to, because of
short_explanation: This is used to explain cause or reasons in Mandarin Chinese.
long_explanation: '由于 (yóuyú)' is a conjunction used in Mandarin Chinese to introduce the cause or reason for a certain situation or event. It is generally equivalent to 'due to' or 'because of' in English. It is used to provide context for the outcome mentioned in the main clause of the sentence.
formation: '由于 + Cause/Reason, Main Clause.' Or it can be 'Main clause + 由于 + Cause/Reason'

examples.cn: 由于下雨，我们的球赛被取消了。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú xià yǔ, wǒmen de qiú sài bèi qǔxiāo le.
examples.en: Due to the rain, our match was cancelled.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由于_yóuyú_-_Due_to_because_of_20231230_由于下雨我们的球赛被取消了.mp3

examples.cn: 我迟到了，由于我错过了公交车。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ chídào le, yóuyú wǒ cuòguò le gōngjiāochē.
examples.en: I was late because I missed the bus.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由于_yóuyú_-_Due_to_because_of_20231230_我迟到了由于我错过了公交车.mp3

examples.cn: 由于她的良好表现，他升职了。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú tā de liánghǎo biǎoxiàn, tā shēngzhí le.
examples.en: He got promoted due to her good performance.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由于_yóuyú_-_Due_to_because_of_20231230_由于她的良好表现他升职了.mp3

examples.cn: 他因为感冒没来上课。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīnwèi gǎnmào méi lái shàngkè.
examples.en: He didn't come to class because of a cold.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_由于_yóuyú_-_Due_to_because_of_20231230_他因为感冒没来上课.mp3

title: 至于 (zhìyú) - As for, regarding
short_explanation: Used to shift the topic to another aspect of an issue or to another matter entirely.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese conjunction '至于 (zhìyú)' is used to switch the topic of a conversation to a different subject or aspect. It's equivalent to the English phrases 'as for' or 'regarding'. This is often used to tackle more than one subject within the same context or to give interesting details about different parts of a single topic.
formation: Part of conversation about subject A + 至于 + Subject B + Statement about subject B

examples.cn: 我喜欢吃饺子，至于我哥哥，他更喜欢吃包子。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān chī jiǎozi, zhìyú wǒ gēgē, tā gèng xǐhuān chī bāozi.
examples.en: I like eating dumplings, as for my brother, he prefers eating buns.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至于_zhìyú_-_As_for_regarding_20231230_我喜欢吃饺子至于我哥哥他更喜欢吃包子.mp3

examples.cn: 我决定明年去北美旅游，至于南美，我可能在未来几年会去。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ juédìng míngnián qù běi měi lǚyóu, zhìyú nán měi, wǒ kěnéng zài wèilái jǐ nián huì qù.
examples.en: I decided to travel to North America next year, as for South America, I might go in the next few years.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至于_zhìyú_-_As_for_regarding_20231230_我决定明年去北美旅游至于南美我可能在未来几年会去.mp3

examples.cn: 他的英文非常好，至于我，只能说几句简单的英文。
examples.pinyin: Tā de Yīngwén fēicháng hǎo, zhìyú wǒ, zhǐ néng shuō jǐ jù jiǎndān de Yīngwén.
examples.en: His English is very good, as for me, I can only speak a few simple English sentences.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至于_zhìyú_-_As_for_regarding_20231230_他的英文非常好至于我只能说几句简单的英文.mp3

examples.cn: 至于你的问题,我会在会议结束后与你详细讨论。
examples.pinyin: Zhìyú nǐ de wèntí, wǒ huì zài huìyì jiéshù hòu yǔ nǐ xiángxì tǎolùn.
examples.en: As for your question, I'll discuss it in detail with you after the meeting.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_至于_zhìyú_-_As_for_regarding_20231230_至于你的问题我会在会议结束后与你详细讨论.mp3

title: 反正 (fǎnzhèng) - Anyway, in any case
short_explanation: Used to express a conclusion or a kind of resolution regardless of other circumstances.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '反正 (fǎnzhèng)' is generally used in conversation as a transition phrase when the speaker wants to express a certain conclusion or determination, regardless of other circumstances. It's equivalent to expressing 'anyway' or 'in any case' in English. Often, it depicts a somewhat casual or dismissive attitude towards other possible or considered factors.
formation: 反正 + the rest of the sentence.

examples.cn: 反正你也不听我说，我干嘛还要解释?
examples.pinyin: Fǎnzhèng nǐ yě bù tīng wǒ shuō, wǒ gàn mā hái yào jiěshì?
examples.en: Anyway, you're not listening to me, why should I bother to explain?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反正_fǎnzhèng_-_Anyway_in_any_case_20231230_反正你也不听我说我干嘛还要解释.mp3

examples.cn: 反正我已经决定明年要去中国学习中文。
examples.pinyin: Fǎnzhèng wǒ yǐjīng juédìng míngnián yào qù Zhōngguó xuéxí Zhōngwén.
examples.en: Anyway, I have already decided to go China to learn Chinese next year.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反正_fǎnzhèng_-_Anyway_in_any_case_20231230_反正我已经决定明年要去中国学习中文.mp3

examples.cn: 反正天也快黑了，我们就在这里安营扎寨吧。
examples.pinyin: Fǎnzhèng tiān yě kuài hēi le, wǒmen jiù zài zhèlǐ ānyíng zhāzhài ba.
examples.en: It's getting dark anyway, let's just camp here.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反正_fǎnzhèng_-_Anyway_in_any_case_20231230_反正天也快黑了我们就在这里安营扎寨吧.mp3

examples.cn: 反正我很享受这个过程，所以我不担心结果。
examples.pinyin: Fǎnzhèng wǒ hěn xiǎngshòu zhège guòchéng, suǒyǐ wǒ bù dānxīn jiéguǒ.
examples.en: Anyway, I enjoy the process so I am not worried about the result.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_反正_fǎnzhèng_-_Anyway_in_any_case_20231230_反正我很享受这个过程所以我不担心结果.mp3

title: 以前 (yǐqián) - Before, previously
short_explanation: Used to express a point in time that is in the past.
long_explanation: The term '以前 (yǐqián)' is used in Mandarin Chinese to refer to a previous point in time, or something that was true in the past but may not be true now. It can be utilized similarly to the English terms 'before' or 'previously'. This expression can be used to refer to both the recent and the distant past based on the context.

examples.cn: 我以前在北京工作，但现在我在上海工作。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǐqián zài Běijīng gōngzuò, dàn xiànzài wǒ zài Shànghǎi gōngzuò.
examples.en: I used to work in Beijing, but now I work in Shanghai.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以前_yǐqián_-_Before_previously_20231230_我以前在北京工作但现在我在上海工作.mp3

examples.cn: 你以前吃过中国菜吗？ 我以前从来没有吃过。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yǐqián chīguò Zhōngguó cài ma? Wǒ yǐqián cónglái méiyǒu chīguò.
examples.en: Have you ever eaten Chinese food before? I've never eaten it before.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以前_yǐqián_-_Before_previously_20231230_你以前吃过中国菜吗_我以前从来没有吃过.mp3

examples.cn: 以前他不喜欢喝咖啡，但现在他每天都要喝。
examples.pinyin: Yǐqián tā bù xǐhuān hē kāfēi, dàn xiànzài tā měitiān dōu yào hē.
examples.en: He didn't used to like coffee, but now he drinks it every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以前_yǐqián_-_Before_previously_20231230_以前他不喜欢喝咖啡但现在他每天都要喝.mp3

examples.cn: 我们以前住在城市，现在搬到了乡村。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yǐqián zhù zài chéngshì, xiànzài bāndào le xiāngcūn.
examples.en: We used to live in the city, but now we moved to the countryside.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以前_yǐqián_-_Before_previously_20231230_我们以前住在城市现在搬到了乡村.mp3

title: 以后 (yǐhòu) - After, Afterwards
short_explanation: Used to indicate actions or events happening after a certain point in time.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '以后 (yǐhòu)' is used to describe the period of time following a certain event or action. It's equivalent to the usage of 'after' or 'afterwards' in English. This phrase often expresses the idea of things that will happen in the future or the state of affairs after certain events.
formation: Time/Event + 以后 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence.

examples.cn: 吃完饭以后，我们去散步。
examples.pinyin: Chī wán fàn yǐhòu, wǒmen qù sànbù.
examples.en: After finishing the meal, we went for a walk.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以后_yǐhòu_-_After_Afterwards_20231230_吃完饭以后我们去散步.mp3

examples.cn: 考完试以后我打算去旅行。
examples.pinyin: Kǎo wán shì yǐhòu wǒ dǎsuàn qù lǚxíng.
examples.en: After the exam, I plan to travel.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以后_yǐhòu_-_After_Afterwards_20231230_考完试以后我打算去旅行.mp3

examples.cn: 他结婚以后就搬到了美国。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiéhūn yǐhòu jiù bān dào le Měiguó.
examples.en: After he got married, he moved to the United States.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以后_yǐhòu_-_After_Afterwards_20231230_他结婚以后就搬到了美国.mp3

examples.cn: 我们放学以后去图书馆学习。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen fàng xué yǐhòu qù túshūguǎn xuéxí.
examples.en: After school we go to the library to study.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以后_yǐhòu_-_After_Afterwards_20231230_我们放学以后去图书馆学习.mp3

title: 为了 (wèile) - For the sake of, in order to
short_explanation: Used to express the purpose or intended goal of an action.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '为了 (wèile)' is used to indicate purpose or to express the intended result of a particular action or event. It's equivalent to 'for the sake of' or 'in order to' in English. The addition of this term can provide insight into why a certain action was performed.
formation: 为了 + Goal + Subject + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 为了保护环境，我们应该减少用塑料袋。
examples.pinyin: Wèile bǎohù huánjìng, wǒmen yīnggāi jiǎnshǎo yòng sùliào dài.
examples.en: In order to protect the environment, we should reduce the use of plastic bags.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_For_the_sake_of_in_order_to_20231230_为了保护环境我们应该减少用塑料袋.mp3

examples.cn: 他为了学好中文，每天都去图书馆学习。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèile xué hǎo Zhōngwén, měitiān dōu qù túshūguǎn xuéxí.
examples.en: For the sake of learning Chinese well, he goes to the library to study every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_For_the_sake_of_in_order_to_20231230_他为了学好中文每天都去图书馆学习.mp3

examples.cn: 为了健康，你应该多吃蔬菜和水果。
examples.pinyin: Wèile jiànkāng, nǐ yīnggāi duō chī shūcài hé shuǐguǒ.
examples.en: For the sake of health, you should eat more vegetables and fruits.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_For_the_sake_of_in_order_to_20231230_为了健康你应该多吃蔬菜和水果.mp3

examples.cn: 为了明天的考试，我昨天晚上复习到深夜。
examples.pinyin: Wèile míngtiān de kǎoshì, wǒ zuótiān wǎnshàng fùxí dào shēnyè.
examples.en: In order to prepare for tomorrow's exam, I reviewed until late last night.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为了_wèile_-_For_the_sake_of_in_order_to_20231230_为了明天的考试我昨天晚上复习到深夜.mp3

title: 起来 (qǐlái) - Beginning or continuing an action (suffix)
short_explanation: Used as a suffix to indicate the beginning or continuation of an action.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '起来 (qǐlái)' is used as a complement of potential or directional complement for verbs. It could mean start doing something or appear to be something. This phrase signifies the beginning or continuation of an action. It can also be used after a verb to indicate an upward movement or the completion of an action.

examples.cn: 太阳升起来了，我们可以开始工作了。
examples.pinyin: Tàiyáng shēng qǐlái le, wǒmen kěyǐ kāishǐ gōngzuò le.
examples.en: The sun has risen, and we can start working.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_起来_qǐlái_-_Beginning_or_continuing_an_action_suffix_20231230_太阳升起来了我们可以开始工作了.mp3

examples.cn: 我早上五点钟就醒起来了，准备复习我的中文考试。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zǎoshang wǔ diǎnzhōng jiù xǐng qǐlái le, zhǔnbèi fùxí wǒ de Zhōngwén kǎoshì.
examples.en: I woke up at five in the morning to review for my Chinese exam.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_起来_qǐlái_-_Beginning_or_continuing_an_action_suffix_20231230_我早上五点钟就醒起来了准备复习我的中文考试.mp3

examples.cn: 当我看到这个美丽的视景，我就感觉开心起来。
examples.pinyin: Dāng wǒ kàn dào zhè gè měilì de shìjǐng, wǒ jiù gǎnjué kāixīn qǐlái.
examples.en: When I saw this beautiful view, I started to feel happy.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_起来_qǐlái_-_Beginning_or_continuing_an_action_suffix_20231230_当我看到这个美丽的视景我就感觉开心起来.mp3

examples.cn: 他拿起电话来，准备打电话给他的朋友。
examples.pinyin: Tā ná qǐ diànhuà lái, zhǔnbèi dǎ diànhuà gěi tā de péngyǒu.
examples.en: He picked up the phone to call his friend.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_起来_qǐlái_-_Beginning_or_continuing_an_action_suffix_20231230_他拿起电话来准备打电话给他的朋友.mp3

title: 掉 (diào) - To fall, to drop (verb suffix)
short_explanation: Used to express the action of falling or dropping something.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '掉 (diào)' is a verb suffix used to indicate the action of something falling off or being dropped. When attached after a verb, it illustrates the resultant change caused by the verb's action. This grammar point illustrates a transformation or a conclusion. The connection to physical falling or dropping is a conceptual one, considering that the resultant change often involves a removal or a loss.

examples.cn: 他不小心把花瓶打掉了。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù xiǎoxīn bǎ huāpíng dǎ diào le.
examples.en: He accidentally knocked over the vase.

examples.cn: 我的钱包丢掉了，我现在一分钱都没有。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de qiánbāo diū diào le, wǒ xiànzài yīfēn qián dōu méiyǒu.
examples.en: I lost my wallet, I am now penniless.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_掉_diào_-_To_fall_to_drop_verb_suffix_20231230_我的钱包丢掉了我现在一分钱都没有.mp3

examples.cn: 你的眼镜掉在地板上了。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ de yǎnjìng diào zài dìbǎn shàng le.
examples.en: Your glasses have fallen on the floor.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_掉_diào_-_To_fall_to_drop_verb_suffix_20231230_你的眼镜掉在地板上了.mp3

examples.cn: 我在公园里跑步时，把钥匙弄掉了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài gōngyuán lǐ pǎobù shí, bǎ yàoshi nòng diào le.
examples.en: I dropped my keys while I was running in the park.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_掉_diào_-_To_fall_to_drop_verb_suffix_20231230_我在公园里跑步时把钥匙弄掉了.mp3

title: 比如 (bǐrú) - For example, for instance
short_explanation: Used to provide examples regarding the subject.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '比如 (bǐrú)' is utilized when providing an illustration or a case in point related to a subject matter, opinion or concept discussed. It is similar to saying 'for example' or 'for instance' in English. It sets up instances that can substantiate or explicate a certain fact or idea.

examples.cn: 我们可以去很多有趣的地方，比如长城，故宫等等。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen kěyǐ qù hěnduō yǒuqù de dìfāng, bǐrú Chángchéng, Gùgōng děng děng.
examples.en: We can go to many interesting places, for example, the Great Wall, the Forbidden City, etc.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_比如_bǐrú_-_For_example_for_instance_20231230_我们可以去很多有趣的地方比如长城故宫等等.mp3

examples.cn: 我喜欢吃各种各样的水果，比如苹果，香蕉，橙子。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān chī gèzhǒng gèyàng de shuǐguǒ, bǐrú píngguǒ, xiāngjiāo, chéngzi.
examples.en: I like eating all sorts of fruits, for instance, apples, bananas, oranges.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_比如_bǐrú_-_For_example_for_instance_20231230_我喜欢吃各种各样的水果比如苹果香蕉橙子.mp3

examples.cn: 他善于各种运动，比如篮球，乒乓球，游泳。
examples.pinyin: Tā shànyú gèzhǒng yùndòng, bǐrú lánqiú, pīngpāngqiú, yóuyǒng.
examples.en: He is good at various sports, for example, basketball, ping pong, swimming.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_比如_bǐrú_-_For_example_for_instance_20231230_他善于各种运动比如篮球乒乓球游泳.mp3

examples.cn: 我喜欢听不同类型的音乐，比如古典音乐，流行音乐，摇滚音乐等。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān tīng bùtóng lèixíng de yīnyuè, bǐrú gǔdiǎn yīnyuè, liúxíng yīnyuè, yáogǔn yīnyuè děng.
examples.en: I like listening to different types of music, for instance, classical music, pop music, rock music, etc.

title: 不得不 (bùdébù) - Have to, can't help but
short_explanation: Used to express that something is inevitable or unavoidable.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '不得不 (bùdébù)' is used when expressing the idea that one has no choice but to do something, or that something is unavoidable or inevitable. In other words, it is equivalent to 'have to' or 'can't help but' in English. It implies a kind of necessity or pressure to carry out the action specified.
formation: Subject + 不得不 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 由于天气变冷，我不得不穿上我的冬季大衣。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú tiānqì biàn lěng, wǒ bùdébù chuānshàng wǒ de dōngjì dàyī.
examples.en: Due to the cold weather, I have to put on my winter coat.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不得不_bùdébù_-_Have_to_cant_help_but_20231230_由于天气变冷我不得不穿上我的冬季大衣.mp3

examples.cn: 考试在明天，我不得不今晚彻夜复习。

examples.en: The exam is tomorrow, I have to study all night tonight.

title: 除了...之外 (chúle...zhīwài) - Apart from, besides
short_explanation: Used to express 'apart from' or 'besides' something in Mandarin Chinese.
long_explanation: The phrase '除了...之外 (chúle...zhīwài)' in Mandarin Chinese is a compound preposition that is used to express 'apart from' or 'besides'. When this phrase appears in a sentence, it implies that in addition to the thing mentioned, there are other things involved too. The structure is commonly used in Chinese to express the concept of exception as well as addition.
formation: 除了 + sth/sb + 之外, rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 除了科学之外，他还对音乐有很大的兴趣。
examples.pinyin: Chúle kēxué zhīwài, tā hái duì yīnyuè yǒu hěn dà de xìngqù.
examples.en: Apart from science, he also has a great interest in music.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除了之外_chúlezhīwài_-_Apart_from_besides_20231230_除了科学之外他还对音乐有很大的兴趣.mp3

examples.cn: 除了你之外，没有人知道这个秘密。
examples.pinyin: Chúle nǐ zhīwài, méiyǒu rén zhīdào zhège mìmì.
examples.en: No one knows this secret, apart from you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除了之外_chúlezhīwài_-_Apart_from_besides_20231230_除了你之外没有人知道这个秘密.mp3

examples.cn: 除了这些香蕉之外，我也买了一些苹果。
examples.pinyin: Chúle zhèxiē xiāngjiāo zhīwài, wǒ yě mǎi le yīxiē píngguǒ.
examples.en: Apart from these bananas, I also bought some apples.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除了之外_chúlezhīwài_-_Apart_from_besides_20231230_除了这些香蕉之外我也买了一些苹果.mp3

examples.cn: 除了上班之外，她还需要负责照顾她的儿子。

examples.en: Besides working, she also needs to take care of her son.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除了之外_chúlezhīwài_-_Apart_from_besides_20231230_除了上班之外她还需要负责照顾她的儿子.mp3

title: 根据 (gēnjù) - According to, based on
short_explanation: Used to express that something is done according to a certain rule, principle, data or fact.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '根据 (gēnjù)' is used to indicate that the subsequent action, result or conclusion is based on the previous premise, principle, data, fact, or any mentioned reference point. This phrase is equivalent to saying 'according to' or 'based on' in English. It is often used to show the basis or foundation on which a decision or action was made.
formation: 根据 + Rule/Principle/Fact/Data + Rest of the sentence.

examples.cn: 根据天气预报，明天会下雨。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù tiānqì yùbào, míngtiān huì xià yǔ.
examples.en: According to the weather forecast, it will rain tomorrow.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_based_on_20231230_根据天气预报明天会下雨.mp3

examples.cn: 根据我的计划，我将在次年结束我的学习。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù wǒ de jìhuà, wǒ jiāng zài cì nián jiéshù wǒ de xuéxí.
examples.en: Based on my plan, I will finish my studies next year.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_based_on_20231230_根据我的计划我将在次年结束我的学习.mp3

examples.cn: 根据她的经验，这种方法最有效。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù tā de jīngyàn, zhè zhǒng fāngfǎ zuì yǒuxiào.
examples.en: According to her experience, this method is most effective.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_based_on_20231230_根据她的经验这种方法最有效.mp3

examples.cn: 根据最新的研究，每天吃多一些蔬菜可以提高你的健康。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù zuìxīn de yánjiū, měitiān chī duō yīxiē shūcài kěyǐ tígāo nǐ de jiànkāng.
examples.en: Based on the latest research, eating more vegetables every day can improve your health.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_根据_gēnjù_-_According_to_based_on_20231230_根据最新的研究每天吃多一些蔬菜可以提高你的健康.mp3

title: 之前 (zhīqián) - Before, prior to
short_explanation: Used to indicate that something happened before a certain point in time.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '之前 (zhīqián)' is used to refer to a time before or prior to a certain event or point in time. It is equivalent to saying 'before' in English. Bear in mind, it always comes after the time reference.

examples.cn: 晚饭之前，我需要完成我的家庭作业。
examples.pinyin: Wǎnfàn zhīqián, wǒ xūyào wánchéng wǒ de jiātíng zuòyè.
examples.en: Before dinner, I need to finish my homework.

examples.cn: 他月球之前是个航天员。
examples.pinyin: Tā yuèqiú zhīqián shìgè hángtiān yuán.
examples.en: He was an astronaut before the moon.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_之前_zhīqián_-_Before_prior_to_20231230_他月球之前是个航天员.mp3

examples.cn: 下雨之前，我们应该回家。
examples.pinyin: Xià yǔ zhīqián, wǒmen yīnggāi huíjiā.
examples.en: We should go home before it rains.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_之前_zhīqián_-_Before_prior_to_20231230_下雨之前我们应该回家.mp3

examples.cn: 我在你生日派对之前已经买了礼物。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài nǐ shēngrì pàiduì zhīqián yǐjīng mǎi le lǐwù.
examples.en: I bought the gift before your birthday party.

title: 之后 (zhīhòu) - After, Afterwards
short_explanation: Used to indicate the chronological order of events.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '之后 (zhīhòu)' is used to represent the chronological sequence of events, indicating that one event occurred 'after' or 'afterwards' compared to another event. When using '之后 (zhīhòu)', it's implied that the event or action in the phrase was the subsequent action to the one previously stated.

examples.cn: 我们吃完饭之后去电影院看电影。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen chī wán fàn zhīhòu qù diànyǐngyuàn kàn diànyǐng.

examples.cn: 我做完早晨的锻炼之后，喝了一杯热咖啡。

examples.en: I drank a hot cup of coffee after completing my morning workout.

title: 似乎 (sìhū) - It seems, as if
short_explanation: Used to express speculation or uncertainty, similar to English expressions 'it seems' or 'as if'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '似乎 (sìhū)' is used to express an observation, speculation or presumption about something. It adds an aspect of uncertainty and is equivalent to saying 'it seems' or 'as if' in English. It is often used when the speaker wants to make a vague or tentative statement.
formation: Subject + 似乎 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 他似乎很喜欢那部电影，因为他看完之后眼里充满了泪水。
examples.pinyin: Tā sìhū hěn xǐhuān nà bù diànyǐng, yīnwèi tā kàn wán zhīhòu yǎnlǐ chōngmǎnle lèishuǐ.
examples.en: He seems to really like that movie, as he had tears in his eyes after watching it.

examples.en: During my trip, I seemed to see your friend in Beijing, but I'm not completely certain.

examples.cn: 他似乎对学习日语很感兴趣，因为他总是在找日语学习资料。

examples.en: He seems to be interested in learning Japanese, as he is always looking for Japanese study materials.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_似乎_sìhū_-_It_seems_as_if_20231230_他似乎对学习日语很感兴趣因为他总是在找日语学习资料.mp3

examples.cn: 天空似乎要下雨，我们应该带上雨伞。

title: 好像 (hǎoxiàng) - To seem like, as if
short_explanation: Used to express that something appears to be the case or someone seems to do or be something.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '好像 (hǎoxiàng)' is used when you want to state that something seems, looks like, or appears to be in a certain way or condition. It can be likened to the use of 'as if' or 'seem like' in English. It is often utilized in vague situations or when making speculative observations.

examples.cn: 她好像很喜欢那款手机，我看到她经常拿着它看。
examples.pinyin: Tā hǎoxiàng hěn xǐhuān nà kuǎn shǒujī, wǒ kàn dào tā jīngcháng ná zhe tā kàn.
examples.en: She seems to really like that model of phone, I often see her holding it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_好像_hǎoxiàng_-_To_seem_like_as_if_20231230_她好像很喜欢那款手机我看到她经常拿着它看.mp3

examples.cn: 外面好像要下雨，云看起来很暗。
examples.pinyin: Wàimiàn hǎoxiàng yào xià yǔ, yún kàn qǐlái hěn àn.
examples.en: It looks like it's going to rain outside, the clouds are very dark.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_好像_hǎoxiàng_-_To_seem_like_as_if_20231230_外面好像要下雨云看起来很暗.mp3

examples.cn: 他好像在为今天的考试感到紧张，一直在复习。
examples.pinyin: Tā hǎoxiàng zài wèi jīntiān de kǎoshì gǎndào jǐnzhāng, yīzhí zài fùxí.

title: 总之 (zǒngzhī) - In short, in a word
short_explanation: Used to summarize or conclude a discussion or speech.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '总之 (zǒngzhī)' is utilized to summarize or conclude a previous statement, discussion, or speech. It's the equivalent of saying 'in short', 'in a word', or 'in conclusion' in the English language. This word is generally placed at the start of a sentence to indicate a summary of information already presented.
formation: 总之 + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 总之，我想我需要更多的时间来做决定。
examples.pinyin: Zǒngzhī, wǒ xiǎng wǒ xūyào gèngduō de shíjiān lái zuò juédìng.
examples.en: In short, I think I need more time to make a decision.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_总之_zǒngzhī_-_In_short_in_a_word_20231230_总之我想我需要更多的时间来做决定.mp3

examples.cn: 总之，我们都为他的成功感到骄傲。
examples.pinyin: Zǒngzhī, wǒmen dōu wèi tā de chénggōng gǎndào jiāo'ào.
examples.en: In a word, we are all proud of his success.

examples.cn: 总之，这个项目需要我们全体员工的努力和投入。

title: 由 (yóu) - By, via
short_explanation: Used to indicate the agent of an action in passive sentences, or to show the method or path.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '由 (yóu)' is used in various contexts to indicate the agent of an action in passive sentences, much like 'by' in English. It shows who or what is responsible for an action. It can also be used to indicate the method, means or path something is done or achieved.

examples.cn: 这个决定是由我做的。
examples.pinyin: Zhège juédìng shì yóu wǒ zuò de.
examples.en: This decision was made by me.

examples.cn: 这个项目是由团队成员们共同完成的。

examples.en: This project was completed by the team members together.

title: 要不然 (yàobùrán) - Otherwise, or else
short_explanation: Used to express the consequence of not fulfilling a condition.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '要不然 (yàobùrán)' is an adverbial conjunction that indicates the possible undesirable consequence if a condition is not met, similar to 'otherwise' or 'or else' in English. This phrase is often used when giving advice or warnings to highlight what could happen if a specific action is not taken.

examples.cn: 你应该现在开始学习，要不然你可能会不及格。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yīnggāi xiànzài kāishǐ xuéxí, yàobùrán nǐ kěnéng huì bù jígé.
examples.en: You should start studying now, otherwise you might fail.

examples.en: We must hurry up and leave, otherwise we will miss the train.

examples.cn: 你要多喝水，要不然你的身体会脱水的。

examples.en: I'm too busy with work, otherwise I would definitely attend your birthday party.

title: 还是 (háishì) - Or (in questions), still
short_explanation: Used to express a choice between two alternatives in questions, or to indicate continuation of a state up to a certain point.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '还是 (háishì)' is a conjunction serving dual functions. Firstly, it is used to present two options or alternatives in a question, similar to 'or' in English. On the other hand, it can denote the continuity of an action or a state, conveying the meaning of 'still' in English. It's important to identify which context '还是 (háishì)' is used in by its position in the sentence and other surrounding words.
formation: For 'Or' usage: Subject + Option A + 还是 + Option B?, For 'Still' usage: Subject + Time + 还是 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 你要喝咖啡还是茶？我要喝茶。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yào hē kāfēi háishì chá? Wǒ yào hē chá.
examples.en: Do you want to drink coffee or tea? I want to drink tea.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_还是_háishì_-_Or_in_questions_still_20231230_你要喝咖啡还是茶我要喝茶.mp3

examples.cn: 你还是喜欢吃苹果吗？是的，我还是很喜欢。

examples.en: Do you still like to eat apples? Yes, I still really like them.

examples.cn: 你去购物还是去看电影？我去看电影。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ qù gòuwù háishì qù kàn diànyǐng? Wǒ qù kàn diànyǐng.
examples.en: Are you going shopping or to see a movie? I am going to see a movie.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_还是_háishì_-_Or_in_questions_still_20231230_你去购物还是去看电影我去看电影.mp3

examples.cn: 她还是在家等你呢，你怎么还不走？
examples.pinyin: Tā háishì zài jiā děng nǐ ne, nǐ zěnme hái bù zǒu?
examples.en: She is still waiting for you at home, why don't you go yet?

title: 除非 (chúfēi) - Unless, only if
short_explanation: Used to denote a condition which must be fulfilled for a certain result.
long_explanation: '除非 (chúfēi)' is a conjunction in Mandarin Chinese which is similar to the English 'unless' or 'only if'. It is used to express a condition that must be fulfilled in order for a certain result or action to take place, implying that if the condition is not met, the result will not be achieved.

examples.cn: 除非你努力学习，否则你无法通过这个考试。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ nǔlì xuéxí, fǒuzé nǐ wúfǎ tōngguò zhège kǎoshì.
examples.en: Unless you study hard, you won't be able to pass this examination.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_only_if_20231230_除非你努力学习否则你无法通过这个考试.mp3

examples.cn: 除非有重大的变故，我会按计划赴美学习。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi yǒu zhòngdà de biàngù, wǒ huì àn jìhuà fù Měi xuéxí.
examples.en: Unless there’s a major incident, I will go to the US to study as planned.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_only_if_20231230_除非有重大的变故我会按计划赴美学习.mp3

examples.cn: 除非我赢得了彩票，否则我无法负担这辆豪华汽车。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi wǒ yíngdéle cǎipiào, fǒuzé wǒ wúfǎ fùdān zhè liàng háohuá qìchē.
examples.en: I can't afford this luxury car unless I win the lottery.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_only_if_20231230_除非我赢得了彩票否则我无法负担这辆豪华汽车.mp3

examples.cn: 除非你能证明你的清白，否则我不再信任你。
examples.pinyin: Chúfēi nǐ néng zhèngmíng nǐ de qīngbái, fǒuzé wǒ bù zài xìnrèn nǐ.
examples.en: Unless you can prove your innocence, I will no longer trust you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_除非_chúfēi_-_Unless_only_if_20231230_除非你能证明你的清白否则我不再信任你.mp3

title: 为此 (wèicǐ) - For this reason, for this purpose
short_explanation: Used to present the reason or purpose of an action.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '为此 (wèicǐ)' is used to express the reason or purpose for doing something. It is equivalent to the English expressions 'for this reason' or 'for this purpose'. This phrase is often used to create coherence between sentences and convey a cause-effect relationship.
formation: 为此 + Phrase (describing action or event)

examples.cn: 为此，她决定补习一年的中文课程，以便能更好地了解中国文化。
examples.pinyin: Wèi cǐ, tā juédìng bǔxí yī nián de Zhōngwén kèchéng, yǐbiàn néng gèng hǎo dì liǎojiě Zhōngguó wénhuà.
examples.en: For this reason, she decided to take a year of Chinese classes in order to better understand Chinese culture.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为此_wèicǐ_-_For_this_reason_for_this_purpose_20231230_为此她决定补习一年的中文课程以便能更好地了解中国文化.mp3

examples.cn: 为此，我们需要在数学课上花费更多的时间来全力以赴研究公式和方法。
examples.pinyin: Wèi cǐ, wǒmen xūyào zài shùxué kè shàng huāfèi gèng duō de shíjiān lái quánlìyǐfù yánjiū gōngshì hé fāngfǎ.
examples.en: For this purpose, we need to spend more time in math class to fully study the formulas and methods.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为此_wèicǐ_-_For_this_reason_for_this_purpose_20231230_为此我们需要在数学课上花费更多的时间来全力以赴研究公式和方法.mp3

examples.cn: 为此，他绞尽脑汁，终于找到了解决问题的新方法。
examples.pinyin: Wèi cǐ, tā jiǎojìnnǎozhī, zhōngyú zhǎodào le jiějué wèntí de xīn fāngfǎ.
examples.en: For this reason, he racked his brains and finally found a new way to solve the problem.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为此_wèicǐ_-_For_this_reason_for_this_purpose_20231230_为此他绞尽脑汁终于找到了解决问题的新方法.mp3

examples.cn: 为此，公司决定采取新的战略来提高销售收入。
examples.pinyin: Wèi cǐ, gōngsī juédìng cǎiqǔ xīn de zhànlüè lái tígāo xiāoshòu shōurù.
examples.en: For this purpose, the company decided to adopt a new strategy to increase sales revenue.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为此_wèicǐ_-_For_this_reason_for_this_purpose_20231230_为此公司决定采取新的战略来提高销售收入.mp3

title: 不过 (búguò) - However, but
short_explanation: Used to express a contrast or contradiction.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '不过 (búguò)' is used to express contrast or contradiction of a previously mentioned statement. It is similar to the English words 'however', 'but', or 'yet' when used in a sentence to show a contradiction or an exception. It is usually used after the subject and before the verb in a sentence.

examples.cn: 我很想去北京旅游，不过我没有足够的钱。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hěn xiǎng qù běijīng lǚyóu, búguò wǒ méiyǒu zúgòu de qián.
examples.en: I really want to travel to Beijing, however, I don't have enough money.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不过_búguò_-_However_but_20231230_我很想去北京旅游不过我没有足够的钱.mp3

examples.cn: 我每天都喜欢听音乐，不过我不会唱歌。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ měitiān dōu xǐhuān tīng yīnyuè, búguò wǒ bù huì chànggē.
examples.en: I enjoy listening to music every day, but I can't sing.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不过_búguò_-_However_but_20231230_我每天都喜欢听音乐不过我不会唱歌.mp3

examples.cn: 明天是我的生日，不过我不打算庆祝。
examples.pinyin: Míngtiān shì wǒ de shēngrì, búguò wǒ bù dǎsuàn qìngzhù.
examples.en: Tomorrow is my birthday, but I am not planning to celebrate.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不过_búguò_-_However_but_20231230_明天是我的生日不过我不打算庆祝.mp3

examples.cn: 我喜欢跑步，不过我不擅长运动。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān pǎobù, búguò wǒ bù shàncháng yùndòng.
examples.en: I like running, however, I'm not good at sports.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不过_búguò_-_However_but_20231230_我喜欢跑步不过我不擅长运动.mp3

title: 即使 (jíshǐ) - Even if, even though
short_explanation: Used to introduce a hypothetical or adverse condition.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '即使 (jíshǐ)' is used to introduce a hypothetical situation or an adverse condition. Despite that condition, the action in the main clause would still happen. It is equivalent to 'even if' or 'even though' in English. In Mandarin Chinese sentences, it is often followed by '也 (yě)', which acts like 'still' in English.
formation: 即使 + Condition/Adverse Situation, Main Clause

examples.cn: 即使下雨，我们也要出去跑步。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ xià yǔ, wǒmen yě yào chūqù pǎobù.
examples.en: Even if it rains, we will still go out jogging.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使_jíshǐ_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即使下雨我们也要出去跑步.mp3

examples.cn: 即使我再努力，我也可能无法顺利通过HSK语言考试。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ wǒ zài nǔlì, wǒ yě kěnéng wúfǎ shùnlì tōngguò HSK yǔyán kǎoshì.
examples.en: Even if I try harder, I might not be able to pass the HSK language exam smoothly.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使_jíshǐ_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即使我再努力我也可能无法顺利通过HSK语言考试.mp3

examples.cn: 即使他的电影票已经卖完了，我也还想去电影院试试看。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ tā de diànyǐng piào yǐjīng màiwánle, wǒ yě hái xiǎng qù diànyǐngyuàn shì shì kàn.
examples.en: Even though the tickets for his movie have already sold out, I still want to try my luck at the cinema.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使_jíshǐ_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即使他的电影票已经卖完了我也还想去电影院试试看.mp3

examples.cn: 即使你不喜欢我做的饭，我也会继续尝试做的更好。
examples.pinyin: Jíshǐ nǐ bù xǐhuān wǒ zuò de fàn, wǒ yě huì jìxù chángshì zuò de gèng hǎo.
examples.en: Even if you do not like the food I make, I will continue to try to do better.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_即使_jíshǐ_-_Even_if_even_though_20231230_即使你不喜欢我做的饭我也会继续尝试做的更好.mp3

title: 到底 (dàodǐ) - At last, finally
short_explanation: A word used in questions to press for a clear or specific answer, showing uncertainty or impatience.
long_explanation: The word '到底 (dàodǐ)' is often used in Mandarin Chinese questions to express a stronger tone of questioning, indicating impatience, or a need for a more concise and specific answer. When translated to English, it could mean 'at last', 'finally', or 'in the end', but it is often omitted in English translations as there is not always a direct equivalent expression.
formation: 到底 + rest of the question

examples.cn: 你到底想去哪里度假？我想去海滩。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ dàodǐ xiǎng qù nǎlǐ dùjià? Wǒ xiǎng qù hǎitān.
examples.en: Where do you really want to go on vacation? I want to go to the beach.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_到底_dàodǐ_-_At_last_finally_20231230_你到底想去哪里度假我想去海滩.mp3

examples.cn: 他们到底何时会到达？他们一小时后会到达。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen dàodǐ héshí huì dàodá? Tāmen yīxiǎoshí hòu huì dàodá.
examples.en: When are they going to arrive at last? They'll arrive in an hour.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_到底_dàodǐ_-_At_last_finally_20231230_他们到底何时会到达他们一小时后会到达.mp3

examples.cn: 你到底喜欢哪个？我喜欢红色的那个。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ dàodǐ xǐhuān nǎgè? Wǒ xǐhuān hóngsè de nàgè.
examples.en: Which one do you like, at last? I like the red one.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_到底_dàodǐ_-_At_last_finally_20231230_你到底喜欢哪个我喜欢红色的那个.mp3

examples.cn: 这个问题到底有多难？这个问题的难度中等。
examples.pinyin: Zhège wèntí dàodǐ yǒu duō nán? Zhège wèntí de nándù zhōngděng.
examples.en: How difficult is this question really? The difficulty of this question is moderate.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_到底_dàodǐ_-_At_last_finally_20231230_这个问题到底有多难这个问题的难度中等.mp3

title: 另外 (lìngwài) - In addition, furthermore
short_explanation: Used to introduce additional information or facts, similar to 'in addition', 'moreover', or 'furthermore' in English.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '另外 (lìngwài)' is a transitional phrase used to engage the reader or listener with additional thought or idea which is associated with or leads on from the previous one. Its meaning is akin to saying 'in addition', 'moreover' or 'furthermore' in English, and it is often used to supplement information or add emphasis.
formation: 另外, + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 另外,我还想告诉你，我明天不能来上班。
examples.pinyin: Lìngwài, wǒ hái xiǎng gàosù nǐ, wǒ míngtiān bù néng lái shàngbān.
examples.en: Additionally, I want to let you know that I can't come to work tomorrow.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_另外_lìngwài_-_In_addition_furthermore_20231230_另外我还想告诉你我明天不能来上班.mp3

examples.cn: 她不仅要应付工作，另外还要照顾两个孩子。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùjǐn yào yìngfù gōngzuò, lìngwài hái yào zhàogù liǎng gè háizi.
examples.en: Not only does she have to handle work, but she also has to take care of two children.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_另外_lìngwài_-_In_addition_furthermore_20231230_她不仅要应付工作另外还要照顾两个孩子.mp3

examples.cn: 我喜欢读英语和中文书籍，另外我也喜欢旅行。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān dú Yīngyǔ hé Zhōngwén shūjí, lìngwài wǒ yě xǐhuān lǚxíng.
examples.en: I like reading books in English and Chinese, furthermore, I also like to travel.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_另外_lìngwài_-_In_addition_furthermore_20231230_我喜欢读英语和中文书籍另外我也喜欢旅行.mp3

examples.cn: 另外，请记住，这个项目的截止日期是下个星期一。
examples.pinyin: Lìngwài, qǐng jì zhù, zhège xiàngmù de jiézhǐ rìqī shì xià gè xīngqī yī.
examples.en: In addition, please remember that the deadline for this project is next Monday.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_另外_lìngwài_-_In_addition_furthermore_20231230_另外请记住这个项目的截止日期是下个星期一.mp3

title: 一旦 (yīdàn) - Once, in case
short_explanation: One used to express 'once' or 'in case' something happens.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '一旦 (yīdàn)' is a conjunction used to emphasize that a certain condition could cause a specific result. It translates to 'once' or 'in case' in English and is often used at the beginning of the sentence to express hypothetical or future scenarios. It usually follows the structure of '一旦' + Condition, Result.

examples.cn: 一旦你决定了，就要坚持到底。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn nǐ juédìngle, jiù yào jiānchí dàodǐ.
examples.en: Once you make a decision, you have to stick to it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yīdàn_-_Once_in_case_20231230_一旦你决定了就要坚持到底.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦你明白了中文语法，你的写作将会提高。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn nǐ míngbái le Zhōngwén yǔfǎ, nǐ de xiězuò jiāng huì tígāo.
examples.en: Once you understand Chinese grammar, your writing will improve.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yīdàn_-_Once_in_case_20231230_一旦你明白了中文语法你的写作将会提高.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦雨里下雪，我们就建雪人。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn yǔ lǐ xià xuě, wǒmen jiù jiàn xuě rén.
examples.en: Once it snows in the rain, we make a snowman.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一旦_yīdàn_-_Once_in_case_20231230_一旦雨里下雪我们就建雪人.mp3

examples.cn: 一旦他认真起来，没有什么能阻挡他。
examples.pinyin: Yīdàn tā rènzhēn qǐlái, méiyǒu shénme néng zǔdǎng tā.
examples.en: Once he gets serious, nothing can stop him.

title: 不如 (bùrú) - Not as good as, inferior to
short_explanation: Used to express comparison, indicating that one person or thing is considered not as good as another.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '不如 (bùrú)' is used to express a comparative degree between two items or people, indicating that the first one is not as good as or inferior to the second one. This phrase essentially puts forward a comparison based on less desirable qualities or less good results.
formation: Subject + 不如 + Object + in certain quality or action

examples.cn: 我不如她跑得快。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bùrú tā pǎo de kuài.
examples.en: I am not as fast as her in running.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_我不如她跑得快.mp3

examples.cn: 你的普通话不如我好。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ de pǔtōnghuà bùrú wǒ hǎo.
examples.en: Your Mandarin is not as good as mine.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_你的普通话不如我好.mp3

examples.cn: 他的成绩不如我好，所以我获得了奖学金。
examples.pinyin: Tā de chéngjī bùrú wǒ hǎo, suǒyǐ wǒ huòdéle jiǎngxuéjīn.
examples.en: His grades are not as good as mine, so I got the scholarship.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_他的成绩不如我好所以我获得了奖学金.mp3

examples.cn: 这家餐厅的食物不如那家好。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng de shíwù bùrú nà jiā hǎo.
examples.en: The food at this restaurant is not as good as that one.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不如_bùrú_-_Not_as_good_as_inferior_to_20231230_这家餐厅的食物不如那家好.mp3

title: 尽管如此 (jǐnguǎn rúcǐ) - Nevertheless, nonetheless
short_explanation: Used to indicate that the situation or factual condition does not change the successors.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '尽管如此 (jǐnguǎn rúcǐ)' is often used to connect two contrasting ideas or facts. The phrase essentially means 'despite that' or 'however,' and is used when the speaker wants to indicate that even though a certain situation or condition exists, it does not change or impact the latter part of the sentence.
formation: Situation + ，尽管如此，+ Contrasting fact or idea

examples.cn: 天气很冷，尽管如此，他还是决定出去跑步。
examples.pinyin: Tiānqì hěn lěng, jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, tā háishì juédìng chūqù pǎobù.
examples.en: The weather is very cold, nevertheless, he still decided to go out for a run.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Nevertheless_nonetheless_20231230_天气很冷尽管如此他还是决定出去跑步.mp3

examples.cn: 他知道这个计划很危险，尽管如此，他还是决定继续。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhīdào zhège jìhuà hěn wēixiǎn, jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, tā háishì juédìng jìxù.
examples.en: He knows this plan is very dangerous, nonetheless, he still decided to continue.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Nevertheless_nonetheless_20231230_他知道这个计划很危险尽管如此他还是决定继续.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管如此，我还是觉得我们应该尝试一下。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, wǒ háishì juédé wǒmen yīnggāi chángshì yīxià.
examples.en: Nevertheless, I still think we should give it a try.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Nevertheless_nonetheless_20231230_尽管如此我还是觉得我们应该尝试一下.mp3

examples.cn: 我知道你很忙，尽管如此，请你帮我一下。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhīdào nǐ hěn máng, jǐnguǎn rúcǐ, qǐng nǐ bāng wǒ yīxià.
examples.en: I know you are very busy, nonetheless, please help me.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管如此_jǐnguǎn_rúcǐ_-_Nevertheless_nonetheless_20231230_我知道你很忙尽管如此请你帮我一下.mp3

title: 为何 (wèihé) - Why, for what reason
short_explanation: Used to ask the reason behind an occurrence, action, or event.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '为何 (wèihé)' functions similar to '为什么', both meaning 'why' in English. The phrase is used in both spoken and written language to seek understanding or clarity about the rationale or reason behind an action or a particular event. It is more formal and less commonly used in colloquial conversations as compared to '为什么'.
formation: Subject + 为何 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence?

examples.cn: 为何你总是来晚了？
examples.pinyin: Wèihé nǐ zǒng shì lái wǎn le?
examples.en: Why are you always late?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为何_wèihé_-_Why_for_what_reason_20231230_为何你总是来晚了.mp3

examples.cn: 为何她不愿意参加我们的晚会？
examples.pinyin: Wèihé tā bù yuànyì cānjiā wǒmen de wǎnhuì?
examples.en: Why doesn't she want to join our party?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为何_wèihé_-_Why_for_what_reason_20231230_为何她不愿意参加我们的晚会.mp3

examples.cn: 为何今天的天气这么冷了？
examples.pinyin: Wèihé jīntiān de tiānqì zhème lěng le?
examples.en: Why is the weather so cold today?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为何_wèihé_-_Why_for_what_reason_20231230_为何今天的天气这么冷了.mp3

examples.cn: 为何你总是这么快乐？
examples.pinyin: Wèihé nǐ zǒng shì zhème kuàilè?
examples.en: Why are you always so happy?
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_为何_wèihé_-_Why_for_what_reason_20231230_为何你总是这么快乐.mp3

title: 不止一次 (bù zhǐ yī cì) - More than once
short_explanation: Used to indicate that something happened or will happen more than once.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '不止一次 (bù zhǐ yī cì)' is used to express that an action or event occurred or will occur more than one time. The phrase relays frequency and directly translates to 'not only once' in English. This phrase adds emphasis on the recurring nature of the event or action.

examples.cn: 我不止一次告诉你了，你需要收拾你的房间。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bùzhǐ yīcì gàosù nǐle, nǐ xūyào shōushí nǐ de fángjiān.
examples.en: I have told you more than once, you need to clean your room.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不止一次_bù_zhǐ_yī_cì_-_More_than_once_20231230_我不止一次告诉你了你需要收拾你的房间.mp3

examples.cn: 他不止一次考试失败了，但他没有放弃。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùzhǐ yīcì kǎoshì shībài le, dàn tā méiyǒu fàngqì.
examples.en: He has failed the exam more than once, but he has not given up.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不止一次_bù_zhǐ_yī_cì_-_More_than_once_20231230_他不止一次考试失败了但他没有放弃.mp3

examples.cn: 不止一次，我都想要放弃我的饮食计划。
examples.pinyin: Bù zhǐ yī cì, wǒ dū xiǎng yào fàngqì wǒ de yǐnshí jìhuà.
examples.en: More than once, I wanted to give up my diet plan.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不止一次_bù_zhǐ_yī_cì_-_More_than_once_20231230_不止一次我都想要放弃我的饮食计划.mp3

examples.cn: 他不止一次承诺要改变，但总是老样子。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùzhǐ yīcì chéngnuò yào gǎibiàn, dàn zǒng shì lǎo yàngzi.
examples.en: He has promised to change more than once, but he is always the same.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不止一次_bù_zhǐ_yī_cì_-_More_than_once_20231230_他不止一次承诺要改变但总是老样子.mp3

title: 正好 (zhènghǎo) - Just in time, just right
short_explanation: This is used to express that something is just right or occurs just in time.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '正好 (zhènghǎo)' is used to convey a situation that perfectly meets a condition, right on point or happens in perfect timing. It is equivalent to 'just right' or 'just in time' in English. This phrase is often used when something happens exactly as you need or want it to in terms of conditions, size, timing, quantity, and so on.
formation: Subject + 正好 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence?

examples.cn: 我们到电影院的时候，正好电影开始。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen dào diànyǐngyuàn de shíhou, zhènghǎo diànyǐng kāishǐ.
examples.en: When we arrived at the cinema, the movie just started.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正好_zhènghǎo_-_Just_in_time_just_right_20231230_我们到电影院的时候正好电影开始.mp3

examples.cn: 他去找你的时候，你正好出门了。
examples.pinyin: Tā qù zhǎo nǐ de shíhou, nǐ zhènghǎo chūmén le.
examples.en: He went to look for you, and you just left.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正好_zhènghǎo_-_Just_in_time_just_right_20231230_他去找你的时候你正好出门了.mp3

examples.cn: 这张桌子的大小正好适合我们的客厅。
examples.pinyin: Zhèi zhāng zhuōzi de dàxiǎo zhènghǎo shìhé wǒmen de kètīng.
examples.en: This table's size is just right for our living room.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正好_zhènghǎo_-_Just_in_time_just_right_20231230_这张桌子的大小正好适合我们的客厅.mp3

examples.cn: 你来的正好，我正想跟你谈这个问题。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ lái de zhènghǎo, wǒ zhèng xiǎng gēn nǐ tán zhège wèntí.
examples.en: Your arrival is just in time, I was about to discuss this problem with you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_正好_zhènghǎo_-_Just_in_time_just_right_20231230_你来的正好我正想跟你谈这个问题.mp3

title: 无论如何 (wúlùn rúhé) - No matter what, anyhow
short_explanation: Used to express the idea of regardless or anyway.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '无论如何 (wúlùn rúhé)' is an adverbial clause that signifies the idea of 'no matter what', 'regardless', or 'anyway'. It's used to show determination or the inevitability of a certain outcome or situation, despite whatever factors or circumstances may come into play.
formation: 无论如何 + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 无论如何，我都必须依靠自己去完成这个任务。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, wǒ dōu bìxū yīkào zìjǐ qù wánchéng zhège rènwù.
examples.en: No matter what, I must rely on myself to complete this task.

examples.cn: 无论如何，我都会按时到达那里。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, wǒ dū huì ànshí dàodá nàlǐ.
examples.en: No matter what, I will arrive there on time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论如何_wúlùn_rúhé_-_No_matter_what_anyhow_20231230_无论如何我都会按时到达那里.mp3

examples.cn: 无论如何，我都不会放弃我的梦想。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, wǒ dōu bù huì fàngqì wǒ de mèngxiǎng.
examples.en: No matter what, I will not give up my dreams.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论如何_wúlùn_rúhé_-_No_matter_what_anyhow_20231230_无论如何我都不会放弃我的梦想.mp3

examples.cn: 无论如何，你都不能放弃尝试。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, nǐ dōu bùnéng fàngqì chángshì.
examples.en: No matter what, you cannot give up trying.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_无论如何_wúlùn_rúhé_-_No_matter_what_anyhow_20231230_无论如何你都不能放弃尝试.mp3

title: 以至 (yǐzhì) - To the extent that
short_explanation: Used to indicate the degree or extent of a situation or action, showing a result or consequence.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '以至 (yǐzhì)' is employed to outline the extent or degree of a certain situation or action, indicating the result or consequence. It's equivalent to the English phrase 'to the extent that.' Naturally, this phrase is used after a given situation or action, followed by the result or consequence, indicating a cause and effect relationship in the sentence structure.
formation: Clause 1 + 以至 + Clause 2 (Result or Consequence)

examples.cn: 他用功学习以至忘记了吃饭和睡觉。
examples.pinyin: Tā yònggōng xuéxí yǐzhì wàngjì le chīfàn hé shuìjiào.
examples.en: He studied so hard to the extent that he forgot to eat and sleep.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以至_yǐzhì_-_To_the_extent_that_20231230_他用功学习以至忘记了吃饭和睡觉.mp3

examples.cn: 她的中文说得非常好，以至于我们都以为她是中国人。
examples.pinyin: Tā de Zhōngwén shuō dé fēicháng hǎo, yǐzhì wǒmen dōu yǐwéi tā shì Zhōngguó rén.
examples.en: She speaks Chinese so well to the extent that we all thought she was Chinese.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以至_yǐzhì_-_To_the_extent_that_20231230_她的中文说得非常好以至于我们都以为她是中国人.mp3

examples.cn: 他们的产品质量差以至于没有人愿意买。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen de chǎnpǐn zhìliàng chà yǐzhì yú méiyǒu rén yuànyì mǎi.
examples.en: The quality of their products is so poor to the extent that no one is willing to buy them.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以至_yǐzhì_-_To_the_extent_that_20231230_他们的产品质量差以至于没有人愿意买.mp3

examples.cn: 这部电影非常有趣，以至于我看了两次。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng fēicháng yǒuqù, yǐzhì yú wǒ kànle liǎng cì.
examples.en: The movie was so interesting to the extent that I watched it twice.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_以至_yǐzhì_-_To_the_extent_that_20231230_这部电影非常有趣以至于我看了两次.mp3

title: 突然 (tūrán) - Suddenly, unexpectedly
short_explanation: Used to describe an action or event that occurs unexpectedly or all of a sudden.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese adverb '突然 (tūrán)' is used to indicate that something happens suddenly or unexpectedly. It is similar to 'suddenly' or 'unexpectedly' in English. This word can be used to describe a swift change in a situation or a sudden occurrence of an event.
formation: 突然 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我正在做作业，突然听到一个大响声。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhèngzài zuò zuòyè, tūrán tīngdào yīgè dà xiǎngshēng.
examples.en: I was doing my homework, and suddenly I heard a loud noise.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_突然_tūrán_-_Suddenly_unexpectedly_20231230_我正在做作业突然听到一个大响声.mp3

examples.cn: 突然下起了大雨，我们只好取消了烧烤计划。
examples.pinyin: Tūrán xià qǐle dàyǔ, wǒmen zhǐhǎo qǔxiāo le shāokǎo jìhuà.
examples.en: It suddenly started to rain heavily, so we had to cancel our barbecue plans.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_突然_tūrán_-_Suddenly_unexpectedly_20231230_突然下起了大雨我们只好取消了烧烤计划.mp3

examples.cn: 她正在讲话，突然哭了起来。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhèngzài jiǎnghuà, tūrán kū le qǐlái.
examples.en: She was speaking and suddenly started crying.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_突然_tūrán_-_Suddenly_unexpectedly_20231230_她正在讲话突然哭了起来.mp3

examples.cn: 我正在睡觉，突然觉得有人在摇我。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhèngzài shuìjiào, tūrán juédé yǒu rén zài yáo wǒ.
examples.en: I was sleeping, and suddenly I felt someone shaking me.

title: 倘若 (tǎngruò) - If, supposing
short_explanation: Used to express a condition or suppose a situation that leads to a certain result.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '倘若 (tǎngruò)' is mainly used to hypothesize a situation, implying a specific outcome or result if that condition is met. It is quite formal and equivalent to saying 'if' or 'supposing' in English. It can be used in both positive and negative sentences.
formation: 倘若 + condition clause + result clause

examples.cn: 倘若你不能来，他就取代你的位置。
examples.pinyin: Tǎngruò nǐ bùnéng lái, tā jiù qǔdài nǐ de wèizhì.
examples.en: If you can't come, he will take your place.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_倘若_tǎngruò_-_If_supposing_20231230_倘若你不能来他就取代你的位置.mp3

examples.cn: 倘若他知道真相，他一定会非常生气。
examples.pinyin: Tǎngruò tā zhīdào zhēnxiàng, tā yídìng huì fēicháng shēngqì.
examples.en: If he knew the truth, he would be very angry.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_倘若_tǎngruò_-_If_supposing_20231230_倘若他知道真相他一定会非常生气.mp3

examples.cn: 倘若我们现在出发，我们可以在晚饭前达到。
examples.pinyin: Tǎngruò wǒmen xiànzài chūfā, wǒmen kěyǐ zài wǎnfàn qián dádào.
examples.en: If we set off now, we could reach before dinner.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_倘若_tǎngruò_-_If_supposing_20231230_倘若我们现在出发我们可以在晚饭前达到.mp3

examples.cn: 倘若她申请这项工作，我相信她会得到它。
examples.pinyin: Tǎngruò tā shēnqǐng zhèxiàng gōngzuò, wǒ xiāngxìn tā huì dédào tā.
examples.en: If she applies for this job, I believe she will get it.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_倘若_tǎngruò_-_If_supposing_20231230_倘若她申请这项工作我相信她会得到它.mp3

title: 何况 (hékùang) - Let alone, moreover
short_explanation: Used to add more weight or emphasis to a situation or statement.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '何况 (hékùang)' is a conjunction usually translated as 'let alone', 'even more' or 'moreover'. It is used to make comparisons and to strengthen a previous statement or argument, showing a greater degree or extent. It is similar to the use of 'let alone' in English, where the phrase is often used to illustrate that a lesser condition is already true, so a greater one must also be true.

examples.cn: 他连初级的课程都不能通过，何况高级的课程。
examples.pinyin: Tā lián chūjí de kèchéng dōu bùnéng tōngguò, hékuàng gāojí de kèchéng.
examples.en: He can't even pass the beginner's course, let alone the advanced course.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékùang_-_Let_alone_moreover_20231230_他连初级的课程都不能通过何况高级的课程.mp3

examples.cn: 我在一天内不能完成这项任务，何况一小时内。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài yītiān nèi bùnéng wánchéng zhè xiàng rènwù, hékuàng yīxiǎoshí nèi.
examples.en: I can't finish this task in a day, let alone an hour.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékùang_-_Let_alone_moreover_20231230_我在一天内不能完成这项任务何况一小时内.mp3

examples.cn: 他连自己的事情都处理不好，何况别人的事情。
examples.pinyin: Tā lián zìjǐ de shìqíng dōu chǔlǐ bù hǎo, hékuàng biérén de shìqíng.
examples.en: He can't even handle his own business, let alone other people's.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_何况_hékùang_-_Let_alone_moreover_20231230_他连自己的事情都处理不好何况别人的事情.mp3

examples.cn: 如果你连简单的问题都不能回答，何况复杂的问题。
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ nǐ lián jiǎndān de wèntí dōu bùnéng huídá, hékuàng fùzá de wèntí.
examples.en: If you can't even answer simple questions, let alone complicated ones.

title: 再三 (zàisān) - Over and over again, repeatedly
short_explanation: Used to describe doing something multiple times or repeatedly.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '再三 (zàisān)' is often used to indicate that something has been done or is being done over and over again, or repeatedly. It is equivalent to the phrases 'repeatedly', 'over and over', or 'again and again' in English. This term is frequently used to express the notion that an action is performed many times, usually more than twice.

examples.cn: 我再三叮嘱他不要晚回家，他还是没听。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zàisān dīngzhù tā bùyào wǎn huíjiā, tā háishì méi tīng.
examples.en: I repeatedly told him not to come home late, but he still didn’t listen.

examples.cn: 医生再三强调要按时服药。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng zàisān qiángdiào yào ànshí fú yào.
examples.en: The doctor emphasized over and over again that we should take the medicine on time.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_再三_zàisān_-_Over_and_over_again_repeatedly_20231230_医生再三强调要按时服药.mp3

examples.cn: 他再三向我道歉，但我仍然无法原谅他。
examples.pinyin: Tā zàisān xiàng wǒ dàoqiàn, dàn wǒ réngrán wúfǎ yuánliàng tā.
examples.en: He apologized to me over and over again, but I still can't forgive him.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_再三_zàisān_-_Over_and_over_again_repeatedly_20231230_他再三向我道歉但我仍然无法原谅他.mp3

examples.cn: 妈妈再三叮嘱我早点睡觉，但我总是来不及。
examples.pinyin: Māmā zàisān dīngzhù wǒ zǎodiǎn shuìjiào, dàn wǒ zǒng shì láibují.
examples.en: My mother repeatedly told me to go to bed earlier, but I always couldn't make it.

title: 于是 (yúshì) - So, Therefore
short_explanation: Used to express the consequence or result following a cause.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '于是 (yúshì)' is a conjunction used to show the result, consequence, or action that follows after a reason or cause. It could be translated as 'so' or 'therefore' in English. It is typically used between two clauses, with the first clause presenting the cause or reason, and the second introducing the consequence or result.
formation: Reason or Cause + 于是 + Result or Consequence

examples.cn: 我们饿了，于是决定去吃晚饭。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen è le, yúshì juédìng qù chī wǎnfàn.
examples.en: We were hungry, so we decided to go have dinner.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_于是_yúshì_-_So_Therefore_20231230_我们饿了于是决定去吃晚饭.mp3

examples.cn: 她失业了，于是开始创办自己的公司。
examples.pinyin: Tā shīyè le, yúshì kāishǐ chuàngbàn zìjǐ de gōngsī.
examples.en: She lost her job, so she started her own company.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_于是_yúshì_-_So_Therefore_20231230_她失业了于是开始创办自己的公司.mp3

examples.cn: 他没带伞，于是在雨中淋湿了。
examples.pinyin: Tā méi dài sǎn, yúshì zài yǔ zhōng línshī le.
examples.en: He didn't bring an umbrella, so he got wet in the rain.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_于是_yúshì_-_So_Therefore_20231230_他没带伞于是在雨中淋湿了.mp3

examples.cn: 我觉得孤单，于是打给了我的好朋友。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ juédé gūdān, yúshì dǎ gěi le wǒ de hǎo péngyǒu.
examples.en: I felt lonely, so I called my good friend.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_于是_yúshì_-_So_Therefore_20231230_我觉得孤单于是打给了我的好朋友.mp3

title: 尽量 (jǐnliàng) - As much as possible
short_explanation: Used to express the idea of doing something to the best of one's ability or as much as possible.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese adverb '尽量 (jǐnliàng)' is used to indicate that someone is trying to do something to the highest degree or as much as possible. It conveys an idea of maximizing effort or capacity, and is similar in meaning to the English expression 'as much as possible'.
formation: Subject + 尽量 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我会尽量减少我看电视的时间，因为我希望有更多的时间学习中文。

examples.en: I will try to minimize my TV watching time, because I want more time to study Chinese.

examples.en: I know you're busy, but can you try to finish this report within this week?

examples.en: She always tries to finish her work as early as possible so she can get home to care for her children earlier.

examples.cn: 我们应该尽量节约我们使用的水，以保护我们的环境。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yīnggāi jǐnliàng jiéyuē wǒmen shǐyòng de shuǐ, yǐ bǎohù wǒmen de huánjìng.
examples.en: We should try to conserve the water we use as much as possible, to protect our environment.

title: 仍然 (réng rán) - Still, yet
short_explanation: Used to indicate that a certain condition or situation continues to exist.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '仍然 (réng rán)' is used to express that a certain condition, action, or state continues to be in effect or exist. It is equivalent to the English word 'still' or 'yet'. This term is commonly used to highlight the continuation of an action or state beyond the expected or normal time.

examples.cn: 虽然他已经毕业两年了，但他仍然没有找到满意的工作。
examples.pinyin: Suīrán tā yǐjīng bìyè liǎng nián le, dàn tā réng rán méiyǒu zhǎodào mǎnyì de gōngzuò.
examples.en: Although he has graduated for two years, he still hasn't found a satisfying job.

examples.cn: 尽管我们尝试了多种方法，问题仍然存在。

examples.en: Despite our various attempts, the problem still exists.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_仍然_réng_rán_-_Still_yet_20231230_尽管我们尝试了多种方法问题仍然存在.mp3

examples.cn: 她已经离开了他们，但是他们的心中仍然有她的位置。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng líkāi le tāmen, dànshì tāmen de xīn zhōng réng rán yǒu tā de wèizhì.
examples.en: She has already left them, but they still hold a place for her in their hearts.

examples.cn: 我读完了这本书，但我仍然没有理解它的主题。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ dú wán le zhè běn shū, dàn wǒ réng rán méiyǒu lǐjiě tā de zhǔtí.
examples.en: I have finished reading this book, but I still don't understand its main theme.

title: 其实 (qí shí) - Actually, in fact
short_explanation: Used to indicate that the speaker is about to reveal some truth or fact, often contrary to what has previously been accepted or understood.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '其实 (qí shí)' is an adverb equivalent to 'actually' or 'in fact' in English. It is used to express an actual situation or to reveal some fact, often one that is contrary to previous statements or assumptions. This phrase is often used to introduce a contrasting fact, correct a misconception, or explain the true nature of a situation.

examples.cn: 其实，我不想去那个聚会，但是我不想让他们失望。
examples.pinyin: Qí shí, wǒ bùxiǎng qù nàgè jùhuì, dànshì wǒ bùxiǎng ràng tāmen shīwàng.
examples.en: Actually, I don't want to go to that party, but I don't want to disappoint them.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其实_qí_shí_-_Actually_in_fact_20231230_其实我不想去那个聚会但是我不想让他们失望.mp3

examples.cn: 他看起来很浪漫，但其实他是个非常实际的人。
examples.pinyin: Tā kàn qǐlái hěn làngmàn, dàn qí shí tā shì gè fēicháng shíjì de rén.
examples.en: He seems very romantic, but in fact, he is a very practical person.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其实_qí_shí_-_Actually_in_fact_20231230_他看起来很浪漫但其实他是个非常实际的人.mp3

examples.cn: 你以为我不知道你的计划，其实我一早就知道了。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yǐwéi wǒ bù zhīdào nǐ de jìhuà, qí shí wǒ yī zǎo jiù zhīdào le.
examples.en: You think I don't know about your plan, but actually, I knew it long ago.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其实_qí_shí_-_Actually_in_fact_20231230_你以为我不知道你的计划其实我一早就知道了.mp3

examples.cn: 其实他并不讨厌你，他只是害羞，不善于表达情感。
examples.pinyin: Qí shí tā bìng bù tǎoyàn nǐ, tā zhǐshì hàixiū, bù shàn yú biǎodá qínggǎn.
examples.en: In fact, he doesn't dislike you, he is just shy and not good at expressing emotions.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_其实_qí_shí_-_Actually_in_fact_20231230_其实他并不讨厌你他只是害羞不善于表达情感.mp3

title: 相反 (xiāng fǎn) - On the contrary, opposite
short_explanation: Used to express a contrasting or opposite viewpoint or outcome.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '相反 (xiāng fǎn)' is used to indicate a contrast or opposition to a previously stated point, view, or outcome. It is similar to using 'on the contrary' or 'opposite' in English. This term can be used to express disagreement, or highlight a different perspective or result.
formation: Subject + Verb/Adjective + 相反 + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 你认为这部电影很无聊，相反，我觉得它很有趣。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ rènwéi zhè bù diànyǐng hěn wúliáo, xiāng fǎn, wǒ juédé tā hěn yǒuqù.
examples.en: You think this movie is very boring, on the contrary, I find it very interesting.

examples.cn: 他不是激励我，相反，他让我灰心丧气。

examples.en: He did not motivate me, on the contrary, he made me discouraged.

examples.cn: 我原来认为他们会生气，相反，他们很高兴我说出实话。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yuánlái rènwéi tāmen huì shēngqì, xiāng fǎn, tāmen hěn gāoxìng wǒ shuō chū shíhuà.
examples.en: I initially thought they would be angry, on the contrary, they were happy that I spoke the truth.

title: 相当 (xiāng dāng) - Quite, rather
short_explanation: Used to express a high degree or extent of a certain quality or characteristic.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '相当 (xiāng dāng)' is used to indicate a significant degree or extent of a certain characteristic, quality, or condition. It can be loosely translated as 'quite', 'rather', or 'fairly' in English, and is commonly used to describe a superior or noticeable level of a certain quality.

examples.cn: 这本书相当有趣，我看了一遍又一遍。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn shū xiāng dāng yǒuqù, wǒ kàn le yī biàn yòu yī biàn.
examples.en: This book is quite interesting, I read it over and over again.

examples.cn: 他的中文水平相当高，他可以流利地讲一口中文。
examples.pinyin: Tā de Zhōngwén shuǐpíng xiāng dāng gāo, tā kěyǐ liúlì de jiǎng yīkǒu Zhōngwén.
examples.en: His Chinese level is quite high, he can speak Chinese fluently.

examples.cn: 我的老板相当忙，他每天都要工作到深夜。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de lǎobǎn xiāng dāng máng, tā měi tiān dū yào gōngzuò dào shēnyè.

title: 不然 (bù rán) - Otherwise, or else
short_explanation: Used to express a consequence that may happen if a certain condition is not met.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, '不然 (bù rán)' is used to show a possible negative result if a suggested action is not taken or a condition is not fulfilled. It can be translated to 'otherwise' or 'or else' in English. It typically follows a suggested or hypothetical situation and it is often used to highlight the potential consequences of not following through with that suggestion.

examples.cn: 我们必须早点出发，不然会错过火车。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bìxū zǎo diǎn chūfā，bùrán huì cuòguò huǒchē.
examples.en: We must leave early, otherwise we will miss the train.

examples.cn: 我需快点完成这个任务，不然老板会生我的气。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xū kuài diǎn wánchéng zhè ge rènwù，bùrán lǎobǎn huì shēng wǒ de qì.
examples.en: I need to finish this task quickly, or else my boss will be angry with me.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不然_bù_rán_-_Otherwise_or_else_20231230_我需快点完成这个任务不然老板会生我的气.mp3

examples.cn: 你应该先把作业做完，不然老师会批评你。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yīnggāi xiān bǎ zuòyè zuò wán，bùrán lǎoshī huì pīpíng nǐ.
examples.en: You should finish your homework first, otherwise the teacher will criticize you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不然_bù_rán_-_Otherwise_or_else_20231230_你应该先把作业做完不然老师会批评你.mp3

examples.cn: 你应该多喝水，不然你会感觉口渴。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yīnggāi duō hē shuǐ，bùrán nǐ huì gǎnjué kǒukě.
examples.en: You should drink more water, or else you will feel thirsty.

title: 一直 (yī zhí) - Straight, continuously
short_explanation: Used to describe continuous action or a straight direction.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese adverb '一直 (yī zhí)' is used to express the ongoing or continuous nature of an action, occurring from a certain point in the past until the present, or from the present continuously into the future. It can also mean 'straight' in a directional sense.

examples.cn: 从上班开始，我一直在写报告。
examples.pinyin: Cóng shàngbān kāishǐ, wǒ yīzhí zài xiě bàogào.
examples.en: Since starting work, I have been continuously writing the report.

examples.cn: 她一直在看书，直到深夜。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīzhí zài kànshū, zhídào shēnyè.

examples.cn: 你一直沿着这条路走，就能看到公园。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ yīzhí yánzhe zhè tiáo lù zǒu, jiù néng kàn dào gōngyuán.
examples.en: Continue straight down this road, and you will see the park.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一直_yī_zhí_-_Straight_continuously_20231230_你一直沿着这条路走就能看到公园.mp3

examples.pinyin: Wèile shíxiàn wǒ xīn zhōng de mèngxiǎng, wǒ huì yīzhí nǔlì xiàqù.
examples.en: In order to realize the dream in my heart, I will always keep trying.

title: 并且 (bìng qiě) - And, moreover, furthermore
short_explanation: Used to connect two clauses providing similar or additional information.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese conjunction '并且 (bìngqiě)' is used to link two statements that provide similar or additional information. It's equivalent to 'and', 'moreover', or 'furthermore' in English, usually bringing up not just an additional point, but an important one.

examples.cn: 他非常聪明，并且他非常努力工作。
examples.pinyin: Tā fēicháng cōngmíng, bìngqiě tā fēicháng nǔlì gōngzuò.
examples.en: He is very smart and moreover, he works very hard.

examples.en: The food in this restaurant is very delicious, and furthermore, the prices are not too expensive.

examples.cn: 他喜欢阅读，并且他有一个非常大的书库。

examples.en: He likes reading and moreover, he has a very large library.

examples.cn: 她每天都锻炼，并且她吃得非常健康。
examples.pinyin: Tā měitiān dōu duànliàn, bìngqiě tā chī de fēicháng jiànkāng.

title: 原来 (yuán lái) - Originally, as it turns out
short_explanation: Used to express the sense of realizing or discovering something that was previously unknown or not understood.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '原来 (yuán lái)' is generally used when the speaker finds out or realizes something new, surprising, or previously unknown. It is equivalent to the English expressions 'originally', 'as it turns out', or 'so that's why'. This word is often used to express the sense of realization or discovery.

examples.cn: 原来你是我的新同事，我刚才还在想你是谁呢。

examples.cn: 原来这个按钮是用来开启空调的，我之前一直都不知道。

examples.en: So this button is for turning on the air conditioning. I didn't know before.

examples.cn: 原来你们已经认识了，我以为你们是第一次见面。
examples.pinyin: Yuán lái nǐmen yǐjīng rènshi le, wǒ yǐwéi nǐmen shì dì yī cì jiànmiàn.
examples.en: So you already knew each other. I thought it was your first meeting.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_原来_yuán_lái_-_Originally_as_it_turns_out_20231230_原来你们已经认识了我以为你们是第一次见面.mp3

examples.cn: 原来他是专业的音乐家，难怪他的琴技这么好。
examples.pinyin: Yuán lái tā shì zhuānyè de yīnyuèjiā, nán guài tā de qín jì zhème hǎo.

title: 不料 (bù liào) - Unexpectedly, to one's surprise
short_explanation: Used to express unexpected results or surprising events.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '不料 (bù liào)' is used when the speaker wants to relay an outcome, event, or circumstance that happened surprisingly or unexpectedly. This phrase often signifies a change or twist in events that were initially perceived differently and is usually used in narration or storytelling contexts.

examples.cn: 他以为很容易找到工作，不料事实上却很难。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐwéi hěn róngyì zhǎodào gōngzuò, bù liào shìshí shàng què hěn nán.
examples.en: He thought it would be easy to find a job, but unexpectedly, it turned out to be very difficult.
