examples.cn: 明天想去爬山，不料天气预报说会下雨。
examples.pinyin: Míngtiān xiǎng qù páshān, bù liào tiānqì yùbào shuō huì xià yǔ.
examples.en: I was planning to go hiking tomorrow, but to my surprise, the weather forecast says it will rain.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不料_bù_liào_-_Unexpectedly_to_ones_surprise_20231230_明天想去爬山不料天气预报说会下雨.mp3

examples.cn: 她希望能得到他的帮助，不料他没有时间。
examples.pinyin: Tā xīwàng néng dédào tā de bāngzhù, bù liào tā méiyǒu shíjiān.
examples.en: She hoped to get his help, but surprisingly he didn't have time.

examples.cn: 我们本来打算参观博物馆，不料博物馆正在维修。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen běnlái dǎsuàn cānguān bówùguǎn, bù liào bówùguǎn zhèng zài wéixiū.
examples.en: We were originally planning to visit the museum, but to our surprise, the museum is under maintenance.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不料_bù_liào_-_Unexpectedly_to_ones_surprise_20231230_我们本来打算参观博物馆不料博物馆正在维修.mp3

title: 一般 (yībān) - Generally, ordinary
short_explanation: Used to express the concepts of 'generally' or 'ordinary'.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '一般 (yībān)' is often used to express a general or usual case, or to refer to something as being 'ordinary' or 'common'. When used to mean 'generally', it is used kind of like an adverb. When used to mean 'ordinary', it's more like an adjective. Learning to decipher which meaning is intended based on context is a key point of this.
formation: For generally: Sentence + 一般.  For ordinary: Subject + 一般 + Predicate.

examples.cn: 他一般早上七点起床。
examples.pinyin: Tā yībān zǎoshang qī diǎn qǐchuáng.
examples.en: He generally gets up at seven in the morning.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一般_yībān_-_Generally_ordinary_20231230_他一般早上七点起床.mp3

examples.cn: 她的中文一般，还需要多加练习。
examples.pinyin: Tā de Zhōngwén yībān, hái xūyào duōjiā liànxí.
examples.en: Her Chinese is ordinary, she still needs to practice more.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一般_yībān_-_Generally_ordinary_20231230_她的中文一般还需要多加练习.mp3

examples.cn: 这个饭店的菜一般，没有什么特别的。
examples.pinyin: Zhège fàndiàn de cài yībān, méiyǒu shé me tèbié de.
examples.en: The dishes at this restaurant are ordinary, nothing special.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一般_yībān_-_Generally_ordinary_20231230_这个饭店的菜一般没有什么特别的.mp3

examples.cn: 一般来说，我每天花两个小时练习滑板。
examples.pinyin: Yībān lái shuō, wǒ měitiān huā liǎng gè xiǎoshí liànxí huábǎn.
examples.en: Generally speaking, I spend two hours every day practicing skateboarding.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_一般_yībān_-_Generally_ordinary_20231230_一般来说我每天花两个小时练习滑板.mp3

title: 当然 (dāng rán) - Of course, certainly
short_explanation: Used to strongly affirm or agree with a statement or question. Also used to highlight the obviousness or certainty of a fact.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '当然 (dāng rán)' is commonly used to express a strong affirmation or agreement towards a statement or question. It translates to 'of course' or 'certainly' in English. It is also often used to stress the obviousness or certainty of a fact or situation. It is a handy tool in emphasizing confirmation or agreement in conversations.
formation: Subject + 当然 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence.

examples.cn: 你会帮我做这个任务吗？当然，我很愿意帮助你。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ huì bāng wǒ zuò zhè gè rènwù mā? Dāng rán, wǒ hěn yuàn yì bāngzhù nǐ.
examples.en: Will you help me with this task? Of course, I am willing to help you.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_当然_dāng_rán_-_Of_course_certainly_20231230_你会帮我做这个任务吗当然我很愿意帮助你.mp3

examples.cn: 你明天会去打篮球吗？当然，我已经答应过朋友们了。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ míng tiān huì qù dǎ lán qiú mā? Dāng rán, wǒ yǐ jīng dá yìng guò péng you men le.
examples.en: Are you going to play basketball tomorrow? Of course, I've already promised my friends.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_当然_dāng_rán_-_Of_course_certainly_20231230_你明天会去打篮球吗当然我已经答应过朋友们了.mp3

examples.cn: 你可以给我一杯水吗？当然，我马上就帮你拿。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kě yǐ gěi wǒ yī bēi shuǐ mā? Dāng rán, wǒ mǎ shàng jiù bāng nǐ ná.
examples.en: Can you give me a glass of water? Of course, I will get it for you right away.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_当然_dāng_rán_-_Of_course_certainly_20231230_你可以给我一杯水吗当然我马上就帮你拿.mp3

examples.cn: 你喜欢吃巧克力吗？当然，那是我最喜欢的零食。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ xǐ huān chī qiǎo kè lì mā? Dāng rán, nà shì wǒ zuì xǐ huān de líng shí.
examples.en: Do you like eating chocolate? Of course, it's my favorite snack.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_当然_dāng_rán_-_Of_course_certainly_20231230_你喜欢吃巧克力吗当然那是我最喜欢的零食.mp3

title: 忽然 (hū rán) - Suddenly, all of a sudden
short_explanation: Used to describe a sudden or unexpected action or event.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '忽然 (hū rán)' is an adverb used to show that something happened unexpectedly or without warning. It is equivalent to 'suddenly' or 'all of a sudden' in English. This adverb is often used in narrative context to surprise the listener or reader with a quick change in the situation or the action of a character.
formation: Subject + 忽然 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我正在看书，忽然手机响了起来。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhèngzài kànshū, hū rán shǒujī xiǎngle qǐlái.
examples.en: I was reading a book, suddenly, my phone rang.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_忽然_hū_rán_-_Suddenly_all_of_a_sudden_20231230_我正在看书忽然手机响了起来.mp3

examples.cn: 太阳还没完全升起，忽然天空中飘起了雪花。
examples.pinyin: Tàiyáng hái méiwánquán shēngqǐ, hū rán tiānkōng zhōng piāo qǐle xuěhuā.
examples.en: The sun had not yet fully risen when suddenly, snowflakes began to float in the sky.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_忽然_hū_rán_-_Suddenly_all_of_a_sudden_20231230_太阳还没完全升起忽然天空中飘起了雪花.mp3

examples.cn: 他们正在聊天，忽然听到一个巨大的爆炸声。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen zhèngzài liáotiān, hū rán tīngdào yīgè jùdà de bàozhà shēng.
examples.en: They were chatting when they suddenly heard a huge explosion.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_忽然_hū_rán_-_Suddenly_all_of_a_sudden_20231230_他们正在聊天忽然听到一个巨大的爆炸声.mp3

examples.cn: 我正在做作业，忽然断电了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhèngzài zuò zuòyè, hū rán duàndiàn le.
examples.en: I was doing my homework when suddenly the power went out.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_忽然_hū_rán_-_Suddenly_all_of_a_sudden_20231230_我正在做作业忽然断电了.mp3

title: 不久 (bù jiǔ) - Soon, before long
short_explanation: Used to indicate a short period of time will pass before something happens.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '不久 (bù jiǔ)' is used to express that an event or action will happen 'soon', 'before long', or 'in a short while'. This term helps in describing a near future occurrence. The event described is usually expected to happen and is reasonably near in the future.
formation: Subject + 不久 + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 他不久就要去北京出差。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù jiǔ jiù yào qù běijīng chūchāi.
examples.en: He will go on a business trip to Beijing soon.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不久_bù_jiǔ_-_Soon_before_long_20231230_他不久就要去北京出差.mp3

examples.cn: 我们不久将会举行一个大型的派对。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bù jiǔ jiāng huì jǔxíng yīgè dàxíng de pàiduì.
examples.en: We will hold a large party before long.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不久_bù_jiǔ_-_Soon_before_long_20231230_我们不久将会举行一个大型的派对.mp3

examples.cn: 学校不久将会结束这个学期。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxiào bù jiǔ jiāng huì jiéshù zhège xuéqī.
examples.en: The school will end this term soon.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不久_bù_jiǔ_-_Soon_before_long_20231230_学校不久将会结束这个学期.mp3

examples.cn: 不久你就会对这个工作非常熟悉。
examples.pinyin: Bù jiǔ nǐ jiù huì duì zhège gōngzuò fēicháng shúxī.
examples.en: You will soon be very familiar with this job.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不久_bù_jiǔ_-_Soon_before_long_20231230_不久你就会对这个工作非常熟悉.mp3

title: 不仅...而且... (bù jǐn... ér qiě...) - Not only... but also...
short_explanation: This pattern is used to present additional information or emphasize the importance of the initial statement.
long_explanation: In Mandarin Chinese, the phrase '不仅...而且...' (bù jǐn... ér qiě...) is used as a conjunction, similar to 'not only... but also...' in English. It allows the speaker to make a statement and then add extra relevant or emphasizing information to it. This pattern is often used to showcase multiple characteristics or aspects of a subject or situation.
formation: Subject + 不仅 + Statement 1 + 而且 + Statement 2

examples.cn: 她不仅聪明，而且还非常勤奋，是我们班里的学霸。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù jǐn cōngmíng, ér qiě hái fēicháng qínfèn, shì wǒmen bān lǐ de xué bà.
examples.en: She is not only intelligent but also very diligent, the top student in our class.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅而且_bù_jǐn_ér_qiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_她不仅聪明而且还非常勤奋是我们班里的学霸.mp3

examples.cn: 他不仅会说英语，而且还会法语和西班牙语。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù jǐn huì shuō Yīngyǔ, ér qiě hái huì Fǎyǔ hé Xībānyáyǔ.
examples.en: He can not only speak English, but also French and Spanish.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅而且_bù_jǐn_ér_qiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_他不仅会说英语而且还会法语和西班牙语.mp3

examples.cn: 这个城市不仅活动丰富，而且风景优美。
examples.pinyin: Zhège chéngshì bù jǐn huódòng fēngfù, ér qiě fēngjǐng yōuměi.
examples.en: This city not only has abundant activities, but also beautiful scenery.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅而且_bù_jǐn_ér_qiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_这个城市不仅活动丰富而且风景优美.mp3

examples.cn: 我们的产品不仅价格合理，而且质量高。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen de chǎnpǐn bù jǐn jiàgé hélǐ, ér qiě zhìliàng gāo.
examples.en: Our products are not only reasonably priced, but also of high quality.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_不仅而且_bù_jǐn_ér_qiě_-_Not_only_but_also_20231230_我们的产品不仅价格合理而且质量高.mp3

title: 尽管 (jǐn guǎn) - Although, even though
short_explanation: Used to express a contrast or contradiction between two clauses.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese word '尽管 (jǐn guǎn)' is a conjunction word used to introduce a concessive clause. It means 'although' or 'even though' in English, and is used to show a contrast or contradiction between two clauses. The condition stated in the '尽管' clause does not influence or change the situation stated in the main clause.
formation: 尽管 + Clause 1, (但是/不过/可是 - optional) + Clause 2

examples.cn: 尽管天气很冷，他还是决定出门去跑步。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tiānqì hěn lěng, tā háishì juédìng chūmén qù pǎobù.
examples.en: Although the weather is very cold, he still decided to go out for a run.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐn_guǎn_-_Although_even_though_20231230_尽管天气很冷他还是决定出门去跑步.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管他是我的好朋友，但是我并不完全同意他的观点。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tā shì wǒ de hǎo péngyǒu, dànshì wǒ bìng bù wánquán tóngyì tā de guāndiǎn.
examples.en: Even though he is my good friend, I don't entirely agree with his views.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐn_guǎn_-_Although_even_though_20231230_尽管他是我的好朋友但是我并不完全同意他的观点.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管她工作非常忙，可是她还是尽力抽出时间来陪孩子。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn tā gōngzuò fēicháng máng, kěshì tā háishì jìnlì chōuchū shíjiān lái péi háizǐ.
examples.en: Even though she is very busy at work, she still tries to take time to be with her child.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐn_guǎn_-_Although_even_though_20231230_尽管她工作非常忙可是她还是尽力抽出时间来陪孩子.mp3

examples.cn: 尽管我们尽力了，但是我们还是没能赶上最后的列车。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnguǎn wǒmen jìnlìle, dànshì wǒmen háishì méi néng gǎn shàng zuìhòu de lièchē.
examples.en: Although we tried our best, we still couldn't catch the last train.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_尽管_jǐn_guǎn_-_Although_even_though_20231230_尽管我们尽力了但是我们还是没能赶上最后的列车.mp3

title: 因此 (yīn cǐ) - Therefore, so
short_explanation: Used to express a consequence or result based on a given fact or reason.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '因此 (yīn cǐ)' is a conjunction used to connect a consequence or result to its preceding cause or reason. It is similar to 'therefore' or 'so' in English. It is usually used in the second clause of a sentence following the cause/reason in the first clause.
formation: Cause/Reason sentence + , 因此 + Consequence/Result Sentence

examples.cn: 今天下雨，因此我决定在家里看书。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān xiàyǔ, yīn cǐ wǒ juédìng zài jiā lǐ kàn shū.
examples.en: It is raining today, therefore, I decide to read a book at home.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_因此_yīn_cǐ_-_Therefore_so_20231230_今天下雨因此我决定在家里看书.mp3

examples.cn: 她没有好好复习，因此考试没考好。
examples.pinyin: Tā méiyǒu hǎohǎo fùxí, yīn cǐ kǎoshì méi kǎo hǎo.
examples.en: She didn't review well, therefore, she didn't do well in the test.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_因此_yīn_cǐ_-_Therefore_so_20231230_她没有好好复习因此考试没考好.mp3

examples.cn: 他工作很努力，因此得到了晋升。
examples.pinyin: Tā gōngzuò hěn nǔlì, yīn cǐ dédào le jìnshēng.
examples.en: He works very hard, therefore, he got promoted.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_因此_yīn_cǐ_-_Therefore_so_20231230_他工作很努力因此得到了晋升.mp3

examples.cn: 我没带伞，因此衣服全湿了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ méi dài sǎn, yīn cǐ yīfú quán shī le.
examples.en: I didn't bring an umbrella, therefore, my clothes are all wet.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_因此_yīn_cǐ_-_Therefore_so_20231230_我没带伞因此衣服全湿了.mp3

title: 终于 (zhōng yú) - Finally, at last
short_explanation: Used to express that something expected or awaited has finally happened.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '终于 (zhōng yú)' is used to signify that something that was expected or awaited has happened after a long period of time. It conveys a sense of relief or culmination, much like 'finally' or 'at last' in English. Please note that '终于' is normally placed before the main verb in a sentence.
formation: Subject + 终于 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 我等了三个小时，终于见到他了。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ děng le sān gè xiǎoshí, zhōng yú jiàn dào tā le.
examples.en: I waited for three hours and finally saw him.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_终于_zhōng_yú_-_Finally_at_last_20231230_我等了三个小时终于见到他了.mp3

examples.cn: 他终于完成了他的作业。
examples.pinyin: Tā zhōng yú wánchéng le tā de zuòyè.
examples.en: He finally finished his homework.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_终于_zhōng_yú_-_Finally_at_last_20231230_他终于完成了他的作业.mp3

examples.cn: 终于，我通过了驾驶测试。
examples.pinyin: Zhōng yú, wǒ tōngguò le jiàshǐ cèshì.
examples.en: Finally, I passed the driving test.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_终于_zhōng_yú_-_Finally_at_last_20231230_终于我通过了驾驶测试.mp3

examples.cn: 经过多年的研究，科学家们终于找到了治疗这种疾病的方法。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò duō nián de yánjiū, kēxuéjiā men zhōng yú zhǎodào le zhìliáo zhè zhǒng jíbìng de fāngfǎ.
examples.en: After many years of research, scientists have finally found a way to treat this disease.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_终于_zhōng_yú_-_Finally_at_last_20231230_经过多年的研究科学家们终于找到了治疗这种疾病的方法.mp3

title: 虽说 (suī shuō) - Although, though
short_explanation: This word is used to introduce a concession in a sentence.
long_explanation: 虽说 (suī shuō) is commonly used in Mandarin Chinese conversation to mean 'although' or 'though'. It precedes a statement or fact and is generally followed by a contrasting point or exception, thus indicating a concession or contrast in ideas. It's equivalent to 'although' in English---the situation or fact exists, but a different or unexpected result is presented after.
formation: 虽说 + Statement (fact) + Contrasting point / exception.

examples.cn: 虽说我很累，但是我还是要继续做工作。
examples.pinyin: Suī shuō wǒ hěn lèi, dànshì wǒ háishì yào jìxù zuò gōngzuò.
examples.en: Although I am very tired, I still have to continue working.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽说_suī_shuō_-_Although_though_20231230_虽说我很累但是我还是要继续做工作.mp3

examples.cn: 虽说他是个孩子，他的想法却很成熟。
examples.pinyin: Suī shuō tā shì gè háizi, tā de xiǎngfǎ què hěn chéngshú.
examples.en: Although he is a child, his thoughts are quite mature.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽说_suī_shuō_-_Although_though_20231230_虽说他是个孩子他的想法却很成熟.mp3

examples.cn: 虽说外面下雨，我们还是决定出去玩。
examples.pinyin: Suī shuō wàimiàn xià yǔ, wǒmen háishì juédìng chūqù wán.
examples.en: Although it was raining outside, we still decided to go out and play.

examples.cn: 虽说她工作很忙，她仍然每天都抽时间陪孩子。
examples.pinyin: Suī shuō tā gōngzuò hěn máng, tā réngrán měitiān dōu chōu shíjiān péi háizi.
examples.en: Although she is very busy at work, she still takes time to be with her child every day.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_虽说_suī_shuō_-_Although_though_20231230_虽说她工作很忙她仍然每天都抽时间陪孩子.mp3

title: 例如 (lì rú) - For instance, such as
short_explanation: Used to introduce an example or a list of examples.
long_explanation: The phrase '例如 (lì rú)' is used in Mandarin Chinese to provide examples that illustrate the point or argument being made. It can be translated as 'for example', 'for instance', or 'such as' in English. By using '例如 (lì rú)', you can not only enhance your point of view but also make your sentences more detailed and interesting.

examples.cn: 我喜欢各种运动，例如足球、篮球和排球。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuan gè zhǒng yùndòng, lì rú zúqiú, lánqiú hé páiqiú.
examples.en: I like all kinds of sports, for instance, football, basketball, and volleyball.
examples.grammar_audio: /audio/mandarin/grammar/s_例如_lì_rú_-_For_instance_such_as_20231230_我喜欢各种运动例如足球篮球和排球.mp3

examples.cn: 中国有许多著名的历史地标，例如长城和故宫。

examples.en: China has many famous historical landmarks, such as The Great Wall and The Forbidden City.

examples.cn: 吃蔬菜有很多好处，例如能降低患心脏病的风险。

examples.en: Eating vegetables has many advantages, for example, it can reduce the risk of heart disease.

examples.cn: 我计划去几个有趣的地方旅行,例如巴黎，东京和悉尼.
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jìhuà qù jǐ gè yǒuqù de dìfang lǚxíng, lì rú bālí, dōngjīng hé xīní.
examples.en: I plan to travel to several interesting places, such as Paris, Tokyo, and Sydney.
